12:15.race_name: Enquire About The Cheltenham Bloodstock Club Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Never landed a blow when an outsider over 2m1f here on seasonal debut
runners.name: Cant Resist It
runners.spotlight: Has bits of placed form but he never landed a blow when an outsider at Cheltenham (2m1f) on seasonal debut; this longer trip needs to prompt improvement.

runners.comment: Purchased for £55,000 since finishing third in Irish point
runners.name: Handin Manypockets
runners.spotlight: Purchased for £55,000 since finishing third in Irish point; starts off his rules career in waters that may prove too warm.

runners.comment: Showing consistency; latest effort has been franked; remains of interest
runners.name: Just Golden
runners.owner: The Late John Hales And Miss L Hales
runners.spotlight: Beaten favourite on three occasions but form figures of 2123 demonstrate consistency; gained the win in bumper; Newcastle hurdles effort (2m6f, good to soft) last time has been franked; remains of interest.

stable_tour.quote: He won his bumper last season at Chepstow by staying and ran really well on his hurdling debut over two and a half miles at Uttoxeter. He'll improve plenty for that and could go to Newcastle on November 29 for a £20,000 novice hurdle. He's got a good attitude and you wouldn't know how useful he could be in time. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Showed up well for a long way at Newbury on the switch to hurdles
runners.name: Kiwi Rush
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in series final at Kelso on final bumper start (won there the time before); showed up well for a long way at Newbury (2m4f, soft) on the switch to hurdles; one of the main form contenders.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Kelso and I think he could be one of my better novices. He'll start at the end of this month over two and a half miles. I see him as well above average - he jumps well and he's done well over the summer. I'm looking forward to him a lot. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Sold for £45,000 since off the mark at the third attempt in Irish points
runners.name: Minella Mission
runners.spotlight: Raced three times in Irish points, winning the final attempt; subsequently sold for £45,000; the betting may offer further guidance as regards this rules debutant.

runners.comment: Sold for £105,000 since Irish point win; the pick of the rules debutants
runners.name: Neon Dream
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism (by 4l) in second attempt in Irish points; subsequently sold for £105,000 at the Tattersalls Cheltenham Festival Sale; the pick of the rules debutants and market support would heighten interest.

runners.comment: Has solid placed form, latest switched to hurdles; firmly in the mix
runners.name: Step Ahead
runners.spotlight: Solid placed form in bumpers (including Listed) for previous yard; another sound effort, beating all bar the market leader, at Warwick (2m5f, good to soft) switched to hurdles; firmly in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: He's had three starts for us, and in two of them he has been beaten by Dan Skelton's Moneygarrow. We were beaten five lengths by him in an Ascot bumper last Christmas when Don Cantillon trained our horse, and it was a similar distance at Warwick last time out on his hurdles debut. We were pleased with him. He didn't jump as we hoped he might, but he's got a huge stride - the biggest of any in the yard - and maybe the hurdles just got in the way a bit. He'll probably run in a maiden hurdle somewhere between Christmas and the new year, and it'll be chasing next year when you see the best of him. 24-12-25

runners.comment: Both hurdles efforts suggest he'll be more interesting in handicaps
runners.name: Walk Tall
runners.spotlight: Winner of Irish point and second in a bumper; however, both attempts over hurdles suggest he'll be more interesting in handicaps shortly.

stable_tour.quote: He was second to Claim The Throne in his bumper and he's a big horse who should improve. He won his point-to-point and we're looking forward to getting him going over hurdles. We'll probably start at Newbury in a couple of weeks' time. He looks the part at home. 12-11-25

12:50.race_name: Ellenborough Park Hotel 'Chasing Excellence' Novices' Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Useful hurdler who won on chase debut at Thurles in November; respected under penalty
runners.name: Eagle Fang

quotes.race: A.M. Transport Supporting Kill GAA Rated Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eagle Fang has bumped into some smart horses. He would want it soft and I would like to see some rain but the Boodles has been the plan for some time - Gary Bannon, assistant trainer

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who was placed in a Grade 2 at Navan (2m4f, yielding) last season; weak 7-1 shot on chase debut at Thurles (2m6f, yielding) in November but he was always prominent and kept on well to beat the favourite; that was a bright start in this sphere and he ran right up to his best with that brave win; respected under penalty.

runners.comment: Won a Newbury handicap last month but this is much tougher and he has plenty to find
runners.name: Knight Of Allen
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner who made it second-time lucky over fences when landing a Newbury handicap (2m4f, good to soft) last month; hit a personal best with that success but this is much tougher back in a novice and he has plenty to find on the figures.

stable_tour.quote: He was unfortunately carried out early on in his debut at Cheltenham but he ran a huge race on his second start - and first race proper - in a Listed event at Aintree last month. It was a massive performance and he showed a huge amount. He's so far from a ready-made juvenile hurdler - he did that on pure ability and will only improve with time. He might be one for Graded novice hurdles next season - the Persian War and the Challow could be possible targets early next campaign and we feel he has the potential to definitely be up to that level on what he showed us at Aintree. 11-01-24

runners.comment: Smart hurdler who won in good style over fences at Wincanton last month; strong contender
runners.name: Regents Stroll

quotes.race: PricedUp The Jumps 'Chasing Excellence' Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regent's Stroll's jumping was fantastic, he was relaxed and he's learning at last. We made an error at Newbury taking the hood off; he had been so good at home it caught us by surprise how free he was, but we learned a lesson. The times he's been beaten, it's been because of immaturity and we can build on that. We need to keep a lid on him for next season, but he's got the size and scope to make up into a fantastic chaser. I haven't got an immediate plan, but there are some lovely targets. There's the Scilly Isles, there are some novice chases at Aintree and we might even consider Cheltenham -  trainer Paul Nicholls, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Coral John Francome Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regent's Stroll jumped brilliantly but just ran too free. He's got a huge engine but he just did too much in the first mile. It's testament to him that he kept galloping, but he's got to learn to relax. We might put a hood on him like we did at Aintree - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Turners Mersey Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That just shows Regent's Stroll is a real smart horse, and he's learning all the time. That's probably the best he's run. He jumped brilliant, and he's just chilled a bit more today. I thought better ground would help and I'm thrilled with him. It's a long-term project with a horse like him and as I said to the lads, Rome wasn't built in a day. What a super chaser he's going to make - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Salisbury Hospice Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regent's Stroll has behaved a bit better today and he's learning. He jumped very well. People expect too much just because he cost plenty of money. There's loads of horses making that money and more privately. We're quite keen to go to Aintree but Harry wondered whether the occasion would just get to him a little bit. In his bumpers last year, he never picked the bridle up, he was chilled and a completely different beast to deal with. I think that's a little bit of the Walk In The Park in him. He's not unlike Clan Des Obeaux. Clan novice hurdling was not easy, keen and stupid. Eventually, when he did relax and he stayed, he won a load of races  - Paul Nicholls, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: trustatrader.com Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He won't go now [to Cheltenham]. We'll just go and find a two-and-a-half-mile novice hurdle in the spring before going chasing with Regent's Stroll - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Challow Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I know full well Regent's Stroll is a very smart horse but he didn't run his race and he has to learn to relax. We have to get some experience into him in a lower grade so he learns how to race - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Regent's Stroll has a lot of pace and I'd say he'll stay too. It's a long way off making any plans with him. I need to get some experience into him, but ultimately he'll make a lovely chaser one day. I was going to run him in the Challow, but we'll see what happens as he's not short of speed. He's got loads of scope and he's a big unit - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs UK Spring Sale Bumper (An Open National Hunt Flat Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Regent's Stroll was very smart, but we were nervous about having to give most of them a stone. He's obviously very good and you couldn't be more impressed with that. He was doing his best work at the end and that would be it for the season - what more does he need to do? Who knows what the future holds, but I'd say he's the best bumper horse we have and if he hadn't been qualified for this race, he may have gone for a championship bumper at Cheltenham or Aintree - Charlie Davies, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Close second in the Grade 1 Mersey Novices' Hurdle at Aintree (2m4f, good) in April, and with this hood back on he settled better than on his chase debut and jumped well to win a match at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) two weeks ago; that was a comfortable win against a useful rival and this scopey 7yo could have a very bright future over fences; strong contender.

stable_tour.quote: He possesses so much potential and I hope he's going to leave his hurdles form well behind now he goes chasing. He ended up our best novice last season but it wasn't all plain sailing. I always like to aim our top staying novices at the Challow Hurdle and after he made a near-perfect start to his hurdling career it made sense to go for the mid-season Grade 1 Newbury prize. But he was still babyish - offspring of Walk In The Park can be a bit like that - and he nearly ran away with Harry on the way to the start. In the race he was much too free, could finish only fourth and it was back to the drawing board. Another defeat followed but I knew it was just a question of giving him time to mature and grow up. By the time Aintree came along he was a different horse; a hood helped him settle better in the Grade 1 Mersey and he was headed only close home. The winner gave the form a big boost at Punchestown. Now as a novice chaser he represents a challenge; he could be a slow learner like he was over hurdles, but if he improves as much as I think he can he'll be very exciting. The signs are looking good: he has grown up over the summer and seems much more settled in his work at home. He was fine when we took him for a racecourse gallop at Newbury last week. We won't be over-facing him first time and will take things quietly, quietly - just as we did in the past with the likes of Denman. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Listed hurdle winner and may have needed the run over C&D on recent chase debut; dangerous
runners.name: Califet En Vol

quotes.race: Sidney Banks Memorial Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew if Califet En Vol was in the argument two out that he would come home strongly and he's basically outstayed them. We'd rather this race be two miles and five than just short of two and a half but he overcame it and was strong through the finish. I don't think Cheltenham is the right way to go with him this year as he's still just a baby and there is a three-mile novice at Aintree and beyond that a race at Ayr, although we would have to mind him if we went there as he likes to get his toe in. We won this race with Shishkin a few years ago and hopefully this horse can be in the same sentence as him down the line - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Record of 2-4 over hurdles and his last win was in a Listed race at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft); well-held second of three on chase debut over C&D last month but a mistake two out didn't help and he shaped as though he needed the run; remains an exciting recruit to chasing and he receives weight from three of his rivals in this contest.

stable_tour.quote: He's done really well and has grown into a fine, big chasing type. He won the Sidney Banks at Huntingdon in February, which is no mean feat. He was running a seriously good race at Aintree in the Grade 1 [Sefton Novices' Hurdle over three miles], but he made a right mess at the second-last and went backwards. He came with an injury on his off-fore and I thought we were in big trouble. He was very sore, but he's fine now and he'll go chasing. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Good hurdler bu the's disappointing in two chase runs this autumn; something to prove
runners.name: Miami Magic

quotes.race: EBF Stallions "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I don't think I've had one as good as Miami Magic before. He literally does everything in a hack canter at home. I don't know how high he can fly but we'll have to look at the programme book a bit more now I would think. He won a point-to-point over two and half mile but shows a lot of speed. I'd had a sneaky look at the Formby (Grade 1 at Aintree on Boxing Day) before today as he's smart and we'll have to go somewhere quite nice after this - Stuart Edmunds, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 over hurdles with novice win at Kempton (2m, good to soft) last November and runner-up in Graded races on next two runs; however, didn't jump with fluency when well beaten on October's chase debut at Uttoxeter and he finished a well-held third again in another small-field event at Kempton (2m2f, good) last time; has something to prove in this sphere and this looks a tough assignment.

runners.comment: Scored easily at Haydock on reappearance; 4-10 at Cheltenham; may remain competitive
runners.name: Does He Know

quotes.race: CopyBet Early Payout On Top Football Veterans' Handicap Chase (Leg 10 Of Stayers' Veterans' Series)
quotes.quote: Does He Know is a bit of an old star. I'm a big fan of these veterans' races - this horse would be retired if it wasn't for them. He hasn't won for a couple of years, so it's nice to see him win. We've got the final to look at now - Kim Bailey, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Grimthorpe Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're not surprised by that as Does He Know was the best horse in the race and he was down in the handicap. He's not ungenuine, but we changed things around by putting cheekpieces on and it's come off. He was helped by the rain as he likes it sloppy - Kim Bailey, trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought 12 stone was enough to stop any horse and Does He Know is not very big. We weren't planning on coming here as we were meant to be going to Sandown (abandoned) last weekend. This was very much a fall back as we had nowhere else to go. Nigel's horse (Fantastikas) we had to give 6lb to last weekend but 10lb to today so we were wrong at the weights. He has taken a huge step forward from what he has done before. A lot of work with Laura Collet has been done with him as after he fell he completely lost his confidence - Kim Bailey, trainer.

quotes.race: Bateaux London Reynoldstown Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were slightly panicking about the time but Does He Know does have form on soft a long time ago. On ratings, he had a favourite's chance. It was a good staying performance. He can be a bit exuberant and a bit of a handful before the race. He keeps improving and tries under pressure. He's in the National Hunt Chase and will be entered in the Ultima - Matthew Nicholls, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Mick Turner A Lifetime In Racing Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Does He Know was in front anyway, David [Bass, jockey] was very confident. The hardest part is getting him on the racecourse, he's a bit of a headcase but he's absolutely fine at home. I think he'll come back here for the next meeting, he likes it here and that was a big learning curve. He probably wants good to soft but we had to come here for obvious reasons. He's got a lot of talent but he's quirky - Kim Bailey, trainer.

quotes.race: Tom Malone Bloodstock Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Does He Know has a lot of ability, but has a weird way of going with his head. We have to drop the reins completely when he jumps, and have it very light in his mouth, but he's very talented. I think it's just a trait and he's no right to be as good as he is. We came here thinking we had every chance. He's a good-ground horse and a little quirky. He ran in a Grade 1 last season and won a Grade 2 at Cheltenham so I'd like to take him back there at some stage - Kim Bailey, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballymore Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Does He Know is a very nice horse and I've always had a high opinion of him. He's a chaser and, with a bit of luck, he'll get better. I'll see how he comes out of this before making plans, but I'm not in any great rush - Kim Bailey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Veteran who scored easily at Haydock (3m1f, good to soft) on reappearance and may remain competitive despite going back up the weights; record of 4-10 at Cheltenham includes a win off 5lb higher in 2022.

stable_tour.quote: He ran his usual good race at Cheltenham on Sunday and is a smashing horse, but will always struggle with his handicap mark. He becomes a veteran after Christmas so that may open up some new avenues. 19-11-24

He was brilliant at Haydock last time out. We had it in the back of our minds to go for the veterans' final at Sandown but by bolting up at Haydock he scuppered his mark. I don't think he wants really bottomless ground so Sandown in January might be asking a bit much of him anyway. He's more likely to go to Newbury or Cheltenham next week, and we'll find a veterans' race for him in the spring. At the races, he's about as badly behaved as they come. It took us a few years to get it right, but we have a system that works for him. 24-12-25

runners.comment: Irish 8yo who may raise his game with Sean Bowen booked; heed the market signals
runners.name: Shannon Royale

quotes.race: Your Free Entry Sponsored By Tote Ireland Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Shannon Royale is a good galloping type and a good staying type. He is more of a handicapper than a graded horses. He jumped well in the main and was just wasn't doing a lot in front - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: End Of The Season Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shannon Royale has plenty of ability but he has his own ideas about things. He's done it well enough but was fairly idle in front. He jumped the last well and was always going to hold on - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were a bit disappointed with Shannon Royale the last day so we put cheekpieces on him to sharpen him up. He had fitness on his side and Jack said he was a different horse today altogether. His jumping was good. He won his bumper and got beat at Fairyhouse and we were disappointed with his last run but he was good today - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Irish 8yo who needs to improve on his two efforts (hurdle/chase) this season for new yard but may raise his game with Sean Bowen booked; market support would heighten interest.

stable_tour.quote: He did particularly well on his summer holidays and he has the makings of a nice staying novice chaser. He has a big engine and you haven't seen the best of him yet. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Shaped well at Cheltenham in last two outings; threatening to win a race of this nature
runners.name: Herakles Westwood
runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser who has shaped well at Cheltenham in last two outings, good fourth from out of the weights latest (3m2f, good to soft; joint-favourite); threatening to land a race of this nature.

stable_tour.quote: He's a smashing horse who is going the right way. He ran a bit fresh on his comeback at Cheltenham, but he finished the race strongly after having a bit of a blow. He'll have an entry in the Welsh National but he wouldn't want the ground to be really deep. There's also a £100,000 handicap chase at Cheltenham's December meeting, and the fact he handles the track is a plus. He should leap markedly forward for his run the other day and I'm confident he's going to win a big one. 23-11-25

The plan is to go to the National Hunt Chase. He ran a little bit below what I was expecting at Newbury last time. It was only three weeks after his Windsor run, which probably took a bit more out of him than I thought it did. I could tell early doors, as could James [Bowen], that he probably wasn't jumping with his zip and accuracy. But the reason for ruinning was that I wanted to give myself options by giving him a fourth start over fences so I could run him in handicaps. 05-03-25

runners.comment: Form in major handicaps includes a win last February and respectable effort latest start
runners.name: Katate Dori

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Trophy Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a brilliant ride from Charlie [Deutsch] and I do feel for Dylan [Johnston] as he has been fantastic for us all season as first jockey. He had the choice and it wasn't an easy decision so I do feel for him as he does all the work and schooling on him at home. A lot of credit goes to him for prepping the horse back at base. We've got a few entries at Cheltenham for Katate Dori, so we'll see what the handicapper does and go from there - Sam Thomas, trainer.

quotes.race: Happy New Year From Greendale Farm Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Katate Dori loved every minute of it. He's obviously improved a lot for a fence and he's a very neat jumper. When he needed to fiddle he fiddled and when I needed him he came up for me - Shane Quinlan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser whose form in major handicaps features an impressive win at Kempton (3m, good to soft) last February and respectable sixth at Newbury (3m2f) latest start; major player at this level.

stable_tour.quote: We've always thought a lot of him and pitched him in at the deep end last season. I'm still learning about the stallion. We thought we'd handle softer ground but he probably wants a sounder surface. He won on his final start last season and we gave him a tough assignment on his first start at Cheltenham. He was a bit outpaced but stayed on nicely and will have learned plenty. He then got stuck in the mud at Chepstow last time. We'll bide our time, wait for the ground to dry up and try to find the right race over hurdles. He's going to be a lovely novice chaser next season. 05-01-24

runners.comment: Contrasting efforts over the National fences at Aintree this term; not sure what to expect
runners.name: Excello

quotes.race: William Hill Grand Sefton Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Excello loves it over those fences - he was good in the Topham last season - and we're thinking about coming back for the Becher - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Contrasting efforts over the National fences at Aintree this term, running creditably in the Grand Sefton (2m5f) then poorly in the Becher (3m2f); not sure what to expect and his losing run is mounting up.

stable_tour.quote: He pays the penalty for his second run after coming from France, when we went to Ascot and he put up a remarkable performance to win. The handicapper got hold of him after that, but he's run some very sound races and had a great spin in the Topham. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Well treated on best form, including second off 8lb higher in this race two years ago
runners.name: Inch House

quotes.race: Sir Peter O'Sullevan Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inch House doesn't do a lot in front, but everything went according to plan. It doesn't always happen like that, but it's nice when it does. He's come back with a little cut but I don't think it's too bad. I haven't got anything in mind for him - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Far from solid on his form (PP6P) for current stable but registered the completion at Cheltenham and remains well treated on best figures, including a second-place finish off 8lb higher in this race two years ago.

stable_tour.quote: Last season was a complete write-off and looking back I don't think he'd ever got over a bad fall on his last outing for Jonjo O'Neill. Since then he's had lots of physio, etc, and I'm pleased to say he's been in great shape ever since the day he came back in. In fact he's looked a different horse to what he did 12 months ago and I was delighted with his return at Cheltenham, where he ran a blinder before getting a bit tired up the hill, when Harry looked after him. I said beforehand if we finished in the first six I'd be delighted. We're going for the Coral Gold Cup now and I can see him developing into a lively outsider. 04-11-25

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie La Grugerie
runners.comment: Disappointing last time but otherwise a largely productive sort; not written off
runners.name: Jasmin De Grugy

quotes.race: DJB Cleaning Handicap Chase (For The Harwell Trophy)
quotes.quote: We always thought Jasmin De Grugy would be a three-mile chaser but it's just been about finding the right opportunities for him. The ground was probably soft enough for him here but he won quite well in the end. This might be his ceiling but it's hard to know and he's eligible to run in better races now. It's worth having a go at a nice valuable novice handicap - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

quotes.race: Southwell Golf Club Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: When we had schooled Jasmin De Grugy over fences he was a little bit sticky to start, but to be fair to Anthony and his team they've done a super job getting him jumping well and that's paid off today - Richie McLernon, rider.

quotes.race: Peter Bowen Racing Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's the perfect scenario really because the handicapper can't quite get to grips with Jasmin De Grugy. Being one of JPs, he was a nice, expensive store horse. Things didn't really click for him as a young horse, but he's improved with racing. He was a bit of a goon jumping hurdles early on, but he's improved with every run and was so smooth there. Every time he's got near the front he's lugged across a bit, so hopefully he can keep ahead of the assessor. I think we'll put him away and ideally work towards novice handicap chasing over three miles in the autumn - Anthony Honeyball, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite in notable handicap at Newcastle (2m7f) last time but otherwise a largely productive sort over hurdles and fences; may still have more to offer in this sphere and remains of interest.

stable_tour.quote: He really improved last season and won three times in May. He'll go chasing and very much shapes like a three-miler. He should still have scope off his mark and could be a smart staying chaser. 14-11-24

runners.comment: Record of 1152 in hood; might have won at Sandown last time but for jumping left
runners.name: New Order
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-7 since switched to chasing and form figures of 1152 since wearing a hood; might have won at Sandown (3m, good to soft; beaten only narrowly) last time but for jumping left; possibilities.

14:00.race_name: Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Record of 3-3 for Willie Mullins then 2-5 for Henry de Bromhead; drops back in class
runners.name: Jungle Boogie

quotes.race: Howden Graduation Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jungle Boogie has been very fragile with different niggles but he's got a big engine. He's entitled to take his chance at the top level and the Ascot Chase back here [on February 15] would be a possibility but I do think he's a better horse going left-handed as well. The Ryanair Chase is another possibility but we'll keep our options open - Robbie Power, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Savills New Year's Day Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jungle Boogie was very good. Henry (De Bromhead, trainer) said to jump out and make the running. He jumped very well apart from the fence at the top of the hill when I gave him a squeeze and he kind of put down on me but other than that, he was really good. When you go back and watch his run at Cork, he wasn't beaten that far against the best of the two-milers in Ireland. He stayed on really well and for a horse that wants a trip, he travelled well. He won today but I felt the track was plenty tight for him as he's a big horse. Danny (Mullins, jockey on the runner-up) is tactically brilliant and every time I jumped on, I tried to slow it down and Danny was pressing me. Henry was adamant to go a nice gallop and he won his beginners doing that as well. For a ten-year-old, he's only had five runs and only been beaten once so he obviously has loads of ability - Darragh O'Keefe, jockey.

quotes.race: Happy New Year From Tote.ie Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: That was very impressive. Obviously Jungle Boogie been a bit fragile to train but he has a huge engine. Sean thinks he'll improve a little bit off it, the more experience he's getting - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Sarah Ann Madden Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Jungle Boogie is a brave horse. He was just a bit keen with Paul. He likes to get on with his job. He was just too keen to jump well but he will get the hang of it. He looks a decent sort so we will see if my owner want to travel. I have him well entered up and we'll look at the Ballymore and the Albert Bartlett - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Clonmel Oil Slan Abhaile INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Jungle Boogie is a nice, big, jumping type of horse. He's been immature and we've given him plenty of time. We'll probably stick to bumpers this season - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 12yo; record of 3-3 for Willie Mullins then 2-5 for Henry de Bromhead; one of the first beaten in the Ryanair over C&D on last appearance but returns to calmer waters on handicap/stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: New to the yard, he's a very talented horse but hasn't managed to take that much racing in his career. He's cantering away quietly at the moment and we're just getting to know him, but we hope he can be successful for us. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Very useful 2m chaser on his day; something to prove back up in distance
runners.name: Matata

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Game Spirit Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matata will go for the Champion Chase. He ran his heart out at Windsor and this probably came a little too soon. We've got just over four weeks till the next one and it's onwards and upwards - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Great Park Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matata is very keen but he jumps well. I think there were a lot of excuses for the ones behind, I'm not saying that for the handicapper, but he doesn't suddenly become twenty pounds better than he's been before. We'll discuss options [regarding the Champion Chase] with the owners but the other idea is that he could go for the two and a half mile race [Melling Chase] at Aintree - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Three Counties Christmas Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matat is a very talented horse on his day and he's calming down with age. I think two and a half miles on good ground could be key. He has to go left-handed so that limits our options but we'll let the dust settle - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Matata is a long way from the finished article and he's just a baby. He needs to learn to do things properly and has to go left-handed. Daryl Jacob, jockey

runners.spotlight: Very useful 2m chaser on his day and is 1lb below last winning mark; hasn't found his peak form this season, however, and this step back up in distance leaves him with something to prove.

runners.comment: Made all for 10l success at Newbury, taking record this term to 2-2; better than ever
runners.name: Twinjets
runners.spotlight: Made all for 10l success at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) last time, taking chase strike-rate to 3-8 and record this season to 2-2; climbing the weights but warrants respect in current form (better than ever).

stable_tour.quote: After one season with us, he remains unexposed with just seven outings over fences. We had a few little issues with him last year, but his second to Masaccio at Newbury suggests he's well up to winning a decent handicap. He's usually the type who will come on for his first run, but I'd done a lot more work with him this autumn, so I knew he was fairly straight when he reappeared at Fontwell the other day and he made all. He could go on to Newbury at the end of the month now for a handicap over two and a half miles or two miles six; he's at his best on good ground and going left-handed. 04-11-25

He won his point-to-point last December in the style of a nice horse and I was confident before his Hereford bumper last spring. He won nicely by 12 lengths and followed up under a penalty at Haydock on his only other start. That was a good performance and augurs well for this term. He has schooled beautifully, and I am looking at starting him back at Fakenham on Friday, ground permitting. I rate him as an exciting prospect and the plan is to start small before stepping up in grade. 13-10-22

runners.comment: New mark has kicked in but this drop back in trip is a plus; has won over C&D
runners.name: Riskintheground

quotes.race: Matt Hampson Foundation Silver Trophy Handicap Chase (Grade 2) (A Limited Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I always had this race in mind and, in current times, I thought we'd better run again. It's worked out really well. Riskintheground will run on the last day of the season at Sandown - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Hillhouse Quarry Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Riskintherground was always going to improve for going chasing and he has done this season. We're delighted with him, he went through the race nicely and enjoyed the ground. He's entered next week at Cheltenham and that's possible or he could run at Sandown on the last day of the season - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Record of 7-22 over fences includes a C&D success in April; non-stayer in major handicap over 3m2f last time when ahead of the assessor; new mark has kicked in but the drop back in trip is a plus.

stable_tour.quote: He won an intermediate chase at Newton Abbot last month when wrong at the weights. His experience probably told that day, but he'll head to the Paddy Power at Cheltenham, where he won a Grade 2 at the back end of last season. He's been a very consistent horse over middle distances. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Has several pieces of good form over C&D, including two wins; on a handy mark
runners.name: Il Ridoto

quotes.race: Paddy Power Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Il Ridoto will come back for the December Gold Cup as he loves it here. The ground was perfect for him today. He's not a Grade One horse, he's a good handicapper and has won his big race. He had had a run at Chepstow, a month's work at home and had a nice light weight. He deserved it today - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Cheltenham Countdown Podcast Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought El Ridoto had a big chance of winning here the last day but he sort of ducked in left handed and fell through the last and that sort of cost him any chance really. I think a few were doubting about whether he wanted a flat track and whether he truly stayed. I thought he was kidding us a little bit as he was coming out of his races so well and the cheekpieces have focused his mind today. He travelled and jumped brilliantly and had a great ride so it's superb - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Ladbrokes Handicap Chase (For The Jim Joel Memorial Trophy) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance from Il Ridoto and it was a long-term plan as Paul had won this race with another four-year-old, Ulck Du Lin, in 2012. He was a bit flat out the first mile - I think they went quite hard - and the race became about stamina, and he jumped well. We wouldn't be in a mad rush to go further because of his age, but I think he'll end up over a trip. He's entered at Sandown on Friday, but I don't think Paul will be in a hurry with him - Harry Derham, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has several pieces of good 2m4f form at Cheltenham, including two wins; has proved a weaker finisher here in last two outings but holds a fighting chance off current mark provided he's back to best.

stable_tour.quote: He always comes on for his first run and ran an excellent trial for the Paddy Power Gold Cup when runner-up at Chepstow a few weeks ago. What's more, he has worked in eye-catching style since then, so I see no reason why he won't run a mighty race when going for a repeat in the big race at Cheltenham this month. Last season's victory, which meant his form figures in the race now stand at 431, was thoroughly deserved as it had taken an age for his rating to come down. An 8lb hike for that success meant it was game over as far as he was concerned and he's been well held in five outings since. But he's slipped back down the weights again and he'll be just 1lb higher than 12 months ago in the Paddy Power. He's more effective in the autumn than the spring and I'm confident he'll go to Cheltenham spot on. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Has bits of C&D form, notably close second to Moon d'Orange last January
runners.name: Grandeur Dame

quotes.race: John Ayres Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grandeur D'Ame jumped brilliantly all the way round and he has a very good record fresh. Tom [Bellamy] got him into a great rhythm - it reminded me of Eclair Surf in the Classic Chase - Tim Syder, joint-owner.

quotes.race: 'Chairman' Colin Baldwin Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Grandeur D'Ame is better when he's fresh and when he wins he looks very impressive. I hope they can keep him fresh, there may be another race to be had with him - Tom Cannon, jockey.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Chris Ascroft Memorial Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Grandeur D'Ame was good at Chepstow and I think the heavy ground just did him at Lingfield. He never got into a rhythm there and you can draw a line under that. Watching that today he will be better going left-handed but it was good to see him get his head in front. I thought at the last he was probably held but he is a horse that gets that trip really well and one that probably wants a wee bit further - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Record of 4-17 over fences; beaten long way in major 3m2f handicap at Newbury most recently; has bits of C&D form, notably close second to Moon d'Orange off 2lb higher last January; not dismissed.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a notoriously poor work horse but is working well by his standards this autumn. I was thrilled with his reappearance win at Chepstow, where he settled and jumped well. He went up 4lb to a mark of 136 and he loves to be fresh so he'll probably be trained for the December Gold Cup at Cheltenham; he was a good fourth in it last year. His trip is two and a half miles. 25-10-24

He'd been working much better than usual before his reappearance win at Chepstow, where he settled and jumped well. Being fresh is the key to him so we'll train him for the December Gold Cup at Cheltenham - he was a good fourth in it last year. His trip is 2m4f. 07-11-24

runners.breeder: Earl Elevage Marion & Mr Didier Marion
runners.comment: Return to this scenario may have positive effect; gained sole chase win over C&D
runners.name: Moon Dorange

quotes.race: Betfair Exchange Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Moon D'Orange is a three-miler and couldn't go with them early on but it just shows what horses can do when you give them a chance early and don't hassle them. He'd have won well if it wasn't for the mistake at the last. Three or four strides before the fence he pricked his ears and I thought if I send him now he's going to do something stupid. He did something stupid anyway but I stayed on. I suppose it's instinct but he was tough - Sean Bowen, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Gained sole chase success in similar event over C&D (off 4lb lower; soft) last January when overcoming a bad late error; inconsistent since but the return to this scenario may have positive effect.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good shape since his win at Cheltenham last month and the plan is to go for the novice handicap chase. He showed a good attitude to win despite the mistake at the last and we've found the way to ride him, which is a big thing. We're hopeful he can run a big race. 20-2-25

runners.comment: Made all in the December Gold Cup over C&D last month; major player off 3lb higher
runners.name: Glengouly

quotes.race: Support The Hunt Family Fund December Gold Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly is a star and I couldn't have been any happier with where Sean [Bowen] had him and the speed he was going. I know this horse inside-out and could tell he was loving it - Faye Bramley, trainer.Glengouly was out of the handicap but Faye [Bramley] and AP [McCoy] obviously know what they're doing. Faye is a very good trainer and AP said to my agent that he had a massive chance. When someone like that is telling you he's got a big chance, you trust in it. Hopefully AP will think I'm better from the front now as well! He had some good form here and stepping up to two and a half miles has really suited him. He got in a really good rhythm - Sean Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Richard Brennan Fencing Services Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Glengouly jumps well at home and I think he can jump better than he did today but he got a good start and kept it up. When the mare came at him he picked up again which was nice to see - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Novice Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly got a lovely ride from Jack. He got him settled going down the back and produced him nicely. I thought this trip might be a bit short for him. I love the way he jumped and he'll be prepared for the final of this series at Punchestown - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Ladies Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Glengouly was a bit idle in front, he was looking all around him. I wouldn't be afraid of going out in trip with him, he will go 2m6f or 3m next time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made all in the December Gold Cup over C&D (good to soft) last month, belying his market position (rank outsider) and ending a long losing spell; major player off 3lb higher, especially if again able to dictate.

runners.breeder: M Collet, J Collet & M Collet
runners.comment: Two from two this term; out of weights upped in class but is open to further progress
runners.name: Just Over Land
runners.spotlight: Two from two this season, the latest win at Chepstow (2m3f, good to soft); 10lb out of weights upped in class but Benjamin Macey takes off 7lb; open to further improvement over fences and may emulate the similarly progressive Thistle Ask who landed this season's Haldon Gold Cup from out of the handicap.

stable_tour.quote: He's a full-brother to Good Risk At All. It took a while for the penny to drop with him but he's running off a lovely mark now. He's had a wind op and has made a solid start in two outings this season. Fingers crossed we can have a good second half of the campaign with him. 05-01-24

runners.comment: Largely sound record over hurdles at Cheltenham; second in this race last year
runners.name: Gowel Road

quotes.race: Betfair Cleeve Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gowel Road really deserved it today. He has bumped into some well-handicapped horses here this season and then back in Graded company last time out he bumped into a good one, so today we hoped he could go and do it. Consistency is what he is about and today it is that what has got him home in front - Sam Twiuston-Davies, rider.

quotes.race: Ascot Underwriting Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very good. Happy days. Fortune favours the brave - you have to take on these horses. Gowel Road is the only one who has jumped a fence before and he showed it. I was pleased with how he went about it. I've got nothing in mind for him at the moment but you'd hope a horse with his class could go to Cheltenham - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Feel Like A Favourite Intermediate Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We always thought Gowel Road would stay the trip and he's always been a lovely horse ? the softer the ground, the better. Let's hope he carries on going up the ranks, the handicapper will have his say now. He jumped beautifully bar one and next season he'll almost certainly be going over fences. We'll wait and go home and see now, but we'll look at all of the top handicaps - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

quotes.race: Read Paul Nicholls On Betting.Betfair Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gowel Road had a look at a couple of the wings but still got the job done and he's not the end article by any means. To break in he was a bit of a rebel and he definitely didn't have my name against him for the job. Tom Bellamy got bucked off him plenty of times. He has something about him and he definitely has a bit of spirit, which in some ways is what you want. We'll see what Dad wants to do (about a possible run in the Supreme) as he's the master, but it wouldn't surprise me - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Largely sound record over hurdles at Cheltenham includes a second-place finish in this contest last year and success in the Cleeve next time; well held over fences here most recently but looks likely to give his running returned to this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: He has great course form and had been running well all season before getting his day in the Cleeve. Whether he's quite good enough to win the Stayers' I don't know, but on a track he likes he's got to have a very good each-way chance. We know he'll stay on from the bottom of the hill and hit the line strong. 17-2-25

runners.breeder: E Aubree & Mrs J Goffin Van Aken
runners.comment: Successful in this contest 12 months ago; major contender returned to hurdles
runners.name: Lucky Place
runners.owner: Mrs G Van Geest & M George

quotes.race: Dornan Engineering Relkeel Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Lucky Place is an absolute terrier. He doesn't know when he's beat and galloped all the way to the line. I think we'll be stepping up in trip again because he saw out today's trip on soft ground. On spring ground in March, I think three miles [in the Stayers' Hurdle] is where we'll end up - Nico de Boinville, rider.

quotes.race: Howden Ascot Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Ascot Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was plan B unfortunately. I'm not going to bang on about it but Lucky Place was meant to be going novice chasing but I couldn't see anywhere to go, so we brought him back into here instead. He jumps fences beautifully but maybe we'll keep that until next season now.  We're going to have to have a look if he stays three and whether he's a Stayers' horse. We could look at the Relkeel Hurdle on New Year's as a stepping stone - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Turned over at short odds in two chase attempts this term; very useful over hurdles and his progressive spell culminated in a success in this race 12 months ago, completing a Grade 2 double (good/soft) in the process; major player back in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: The intention was to go novice chasing last year as he jumped beautifully at home, but we had nowhere to run him so we slipped him into the Ascot Hurdle, which he won. He then won the Relkeel on New Year's Day and we went to the Stayers' Hurdle, but I don't know if he stayed or not. He's going novice chasing this season, staying at two and a half miles for now, and I think we'll be very disappointed if he doesn't take very high rank this season. He has a wonderful temperament and is a very kind horse in every way, so I think he can go to the top. 21-10-25

runners.breeder: Mrs J Rainer, Mr F Jereczek & Mr Rainer
runners.comment: Grade 2 winner over fences last term; possibly needed his reappearance run
runners.name: Jingko Blue

quotes.race: Hampton Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were hoping Jingko Blue would stay three miles so I think he'll continue down that road. This was never the plan but then they put this race on and it's a great effort. We weren't really prepared for this because we were waiting for the Reynoldstown. I think there's every chance he'll still go there and then onto Cheltenham. I was chatting with Nico [de Boinville, jockey] and he's very happy that we do that. I think he's going the right way and he's a talented horse - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: 2025 Uttoxeter Annual Membership Now Available Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jingko Blue was great. He jumped really slickly; he's not very big but he certainly respects those fences a lot more than he did hurdles. He's gone through that ground easy enough. I thought it was the perfect start - Nicky Henderson, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That caught me unaware. I thought it was quite a big test off top weight in a competitive race. I've had the odd issue with Jingko Blue at home and not been unable to run him but that was a good performance. You'd love to mind him a bit this season. He's a nice big horse who will jump a fence - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Committed To Safer Gambling Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Jingko Blue did well to get back up. It deserved to be a dead-heat and I think the first two are both smart horses. It's a juggling game at the moment with the novices because they are a good bunch and spreading them out is important. I think he is good but he's only young and let's go one step at a time. He's growing up all the time - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Rules record is 4-8; brief spell over fences last winter featured a Grade 2 win at Windsor (unseated rider final outing); came up short in Haydock handicap returned hurdles on reappearance but may fare better with the outing under his belt.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Uttoxeter and then in a Grade 2 Windsor last season. We were thinking about the Brown Advisory at the festival, so we went to the Reynoldstown at Ascot, but his jumping got a bit muddled. He made a shocking mistake going down the hill and that was lights out for the season. It transpired that he had significant kissing spines and he's had back surgery, which we're hoping can make a difference. He's grown into a fine, big horse, and he's physically improved. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Impressive in Haydock handicap on stable/seasonal debut; strongly respected
runners.name: Kabral Du Mathan

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Podcasts Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I hoped Kabral Du Mathan would win. He did a very good bit of work in a gallop about three weeks ago, which suggested to us that he had a big engine. But to be honest his form last year suggested that, and we are lucky to have inherited him in such good shape. Hopefully he is a horse that can continue to progress as he goes up in trip. He's been crying out for a trip. We have to look forward now. I think we might go for the Relkeel with him and then maybe on to the Stayers' Hurdle - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We're thrilled and for a four-year-old it was a mighty run. Kabral Du Mathan will go straight to the Betfair Hurdle [February 8] now, we won't run him before then and we'll look after him. It's hard for four-year-olds in their second season, but that was a very good run and he's a progressive horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Chatteris Fen Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very pleasing performance. Kabral Du Mathan has done everything nicely in Ditcheat. When they come over from France you don't know what to expect, and we were very nervous about having to give all of these eight pounds. He has jumped brilliantly, done it all very professionally, and I think he has done it quite cosily. Hopefully he might be one for the Fred Winter in March. I think he is more a Fred Winter horse as to be a Triumph Hurdle horse you have got to be a really good horse, and you would have to take on Burdett Road, and Sir Gino looked very smart the other day - Charlie Davies, assistant trainer.

runners.spotlight: Reached a useful standard at about 2m for Paul Nicholls; took his form to an even higher level and strike-rate to 4-7 when upped to 2m3f in Haydock handicap (good to soft) on stable/seasonal debut, scoring impressively and entering the Stayers' Hurdle picture (likely to stay further still); new rating puts him top in this field; strongly respected.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to us but has some good handicap hurdle form and I think the step up in trip to 2m3f at Haydock on Betfair Chase day will suit him. He'll make a chaser in time but we thought we'd stick over hurdles for the time being and we're looking forward to running him. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Has the worst chance at the weights on this return to hurdles
runners.name: Kamsinas

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll probably go the same route as Crambo last year and go to Haydock now. We stepped Kamsinas up in trip all last year and he danced every dance and turned up nearly every day. He's a lovely horse, who's so straightforward, and has amazing will to win - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kamsinas is a personal favourite, a little pocket rocket, and if you could take out what he has and put into other horses you'd be happy. He has a will to win. We told Jack to drop in and hunt around and he went to sleep, and toughed it out well, although I was a bit worried when Dan Skelton's horse came upsides. He's tough and was like a handicapper against novices. He's won a Grade 2 and the ground was bottomless in the Grade 1 at Aintree, while things were too quick for him in the Betfair Hurdle. Today was logical to step up in trip and we'll try to find a race for him, maybe at one of the festivals, before we go chasing next season - Dave Crosse, owners' representative.

quotes.race: Betfair Racing Podcasts Newton Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kamsinas had been working well and I thought he was very unlucky at Cheltenham, he got blocked coming down the hill and he ran on very well. What I loved about it was even though he'd had a fair old bang and a rough ride he threw himself over the last. He's got a great will to win. He loves being a racehorse. We'll sit down and decide where we're best going. It's a long road to Cheltenham in March and there will be plenty of races before then, hopefully - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Lowes Garage Home Of £30 MOT's EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That race did fall apart a bit. I rode Kamsinas at Kelso on good ground and even though he won I didn't get the same feel as I got from him there. He's exciting - Paddy Brennan, rider.

runners.spotlight: Similar type to Lucky Place in that he returns to hurdles after two chase defeats this season (admittedly went close on first occasion); successful in Grade 2 as a novice but, in terms of ratings, has the worst chance at the weights in this field.

stable_tour.quote: We really love him. His form was franked in the Greatwood when Lookaway, who he finished second to at Cheltenham last month, ran really well to finish runner-up. I think he was a bit unlucky that day as his run got blocked but he put things right at Haydock on Saturday. I love the way he hit the line. He doesn't work like a two-miler at home but he was quick round there and travelled very well. It was a competitive race and I was very impressed with him. I suppose the obvious place to go now would be the Tolworth at Aintree on Boxing Day. 27-11-23

He's been schooling over fences and will go novice handicap chasing. There was a race for him at Worcester last week but the ground isn't suitable for him yet. He has some good form over hurdles and hopefully will take well to fences having won a point-to-point. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Hurdles form remains inferior to his best achievements over fences
runners.name: The Real Whacker

quotes.race: bet365 Charlie Hall Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I never wrote The Real Whacker off. We just had no luck. Every time we went to run him, the sky opened the night before. He got his ground today. I'm delighted to get him back, I had him fairly right going to Listowel and he unfortunately unseated but we were happy with the ground today. The ground is the key to him. He won't go for the Betfair Chase, he'll maybe go for the King George and then the Cotswold Chase, then hopefully the Gold Cup - Paddy Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes King George VI Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Real Whacker travelled well and jumped well for his first time in open company. He stayed on really well at the end, which I was happy with. He missed the start for some reason today, and we were always chasing after that. I like the way he stayed on at the end and the Gold Cup is still on the agenda. Cheltenham is a place that he likes. I think we might go straight to the Gold Cup - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Brown Advisory Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (Registered As The Broadway Novices' Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was toying with the Gold Cup this year but we made the decision to try to give The Real Whacker a bit more experience and mind him with the view to coming back next year. We'll give him a good summer as he might have done enough now for this year. He could go to Punchestown but we'll see how he comes out of this. He'll probably go to Listowel in the autumn because it's one of my favourite tracks - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Novices' Chase (Registered as The Dipper Novices' Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was thinking in my head that The Real Whacker had improved for his last run and I knew he had improved at home. I took my time with him and I saw this race and said we will go for it and make it a test of jumping. Looking at Monmiral you had to respect him as he is a Grade One winner, but this horse is progressing and is on the up. Hopefully he will be a Grade One winner soon. We will come back for the festival and enter him in a couple of them. We might even go for the Gold Cup! - Patrick Neville, trainer.

quotes.race: mallardjewellers.com Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Real Whacker is a smashing horse and we've always loved him. Fences are his game. He's gorgeous and would probably be better on softer ground. Gavin Sheehan was brilliant on him and his jumping was outstanding - Patrick Neville, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Pestered up front and eventually dropped away last time when bidding for a second win in the Charlie Hall Chase; beaten at Perth in most recent hurdles attempt and his form in this sphere remains inferior to his best achievements over fences.

stable_tour.quote: I might have made a couple of wrong decisions with him last season, but with a horse like him there aren't that many races. People were doubting him but I never lost the faith and I was delighted to win the Charlie Hall last month. We had him right for his return in the Kerry National and he was running a massive race but, unfortunately, he hit a fence and unseated Sam [Twiston-Davies]. The ground dried up at Wetherby and the race came at the right time. He's come out of it really well and we had him in the Betfair Chase but took him out on the day because of the ground. With the form he's in, he could possibly run in the King George after all. We'd have to supplement him but we've looked into it. It would be ground dependent but we'll have a good idea of the ground and weather forecast by then. He finished fourth in it last year and ran very well for a first run in open company. You can run him at any track - it's the ground that's key. There's a race at Wetherby on Boxing Day as well, but we'll look at the King George because it's a wide-open race. We're still thinking of the Cotswold Chase and then the Gold Cup, but it'll depend on the ground. If the Cheltenham Festival came up soft like it did last year, we'd go the Aintree route. There's the Bowl and we'll probably put him in the Grand National as well. Everyone keeps telling me that's a good race for him, so we'll see. 11-12-24

15:10.race_name: Best Odds On The Betfair Exchange Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Pulled up on two of his last four starts, mixed in with some very solid results
runners.name: Harbour Lake

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Long Distance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I felt off 12st Harbour Lake was maybe a few pounds too high but that was a good, tough performance - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We have a lovely clear run with Harbour Lake this autumn. We thought he would run well today and he has. The Pertemps Final at the Cheltenham Festival has to be an option for him. He is in the Betfair race at Haydock but that is only two weeks away so I imagine that would come too quick so we could work back from Cheltenham - it's a nice problem to have. He wouldn't want a lot of racing and I'd say he would have a couple of runs before the final as that's a nice target - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen #yourodds Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harbour Lake is a grand horse, a typical big, fine Trevor Hemmings horse. Whether or not he wants the ground that soft I'm not sure but he has to run on it to get experience. This is only the second run of his life, he's two from two and he's not done a lot wrong - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Harbour Lake is a smashing horse, we've always liked him. If he'd finished in the first four or five we'd have been happy. He'll stay further and he'll learn from the experience - Mick Meagher, racing manager to the executors of the late Trevor Hemmings.

runners.spotlight: Pulled up at the Cheltenham Festival in March (bled from the nose) and when 33-1 in hot race at Haydock last month, which was followed by wind surgery; those are mixed in with some very solid results, for instance when second here in April and winning a good prize at Haydock in May, but he's also now looking handicapped up to his best.

stable_tour.quote: He'll stay hurdling for the time being. Despite the fact he schooled very well at home, he didn't enjoy chasing. He ran some good races back over hurdles in the spring and will start back soon either at two and a half or three miles. We could also try to qualify him for the Pertemps Final. 25-10-24

Although he schooled very well over fences at home, he didn't enjoy chasing so he'll stick to hurdles for the time being. He ran some good races back over hurdles in the spring and will head to Aintree this Saturday for a Pertemps qualifier. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Comfortably won 17-runner race here (3m, good) in October; Haydock flop four weeks later
runners.name: Ma Shantou

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ma Shantou has done it really well. I couldn't believe the money that had come for him, even though the horses are in good form and he had done everything right at home and I think today shows he might be quite well-in! He is smashing, straightforward horse and we are on the right trajectory. We like him and the Pertemps Final could definitely be an option - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Welcomes Jumping Back @ Royal Windsor EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qual) (GBB)
quotes.quote: There's a lot to like about Ma Shantou ? he grinds it out and wants to win ? and ultimately we'll look at the three-mile division with him. He's not overly big, but he's so neat and quick over his hurdles and he's just got better and better. He'll be a genuine stayer. When he hits that flat spot he keeps going, and I love seeing that in a horse - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Comfortably landed a gamble in 17-runner handicap at Cheltenham (3m, good) in October but tailed-off favourite off this 9lb higher mark in a hot race at Haydock four weeks later; needs to resume progress.

stable_tour.quote: He's not bad! He's clearly improved since last season and he was decent then. He wasn't at his best in the Albert Bartlett last March and didn't get up the hill after travelling well. He hadn't worked on grass at home before winning a Pertemps qualifier back at Cheltenham last month. He's a great little jumper with a fine attitude and his next race will be the 3m hurdle at Haydock on Betfair Chase day. That'll tell us whether we work our way back from the Pertemps Final or, if he wins off 138, then he deserves a try in Graded company. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Good third here on chase debut in October but the fences have got in the way since
runners.name: Double Powerful

quotes.race: Lycetts Insurance Brokers Conditional Jockeys Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hdl Series Qual')
quotes.quote: Double Powerful is a one-dimensional kind of horse and you have to ride him like that. When you ask him, he comes alive so quickly and is one of those horses you always think has got there too soon. He stuck his head down today and it was a good performance - Dylan Johnston, rider.

runners.spotlight: Six hurdle wins in 2024 (the latest at Cheltenham) and best hurdles form when upped to 3m at Aintree last April; another good third here (2m4f) on chase debut in October saw a rise in his mark but the fences have got in the way since, which sees him back over hurdles today; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed and went up 58lb in the handicap over hurdles and ran an absolute cracker on his chase debut at Cheltenham. We dropped him out and got him jumping with confidence - the more of that he gets, the better he is. He can be a bit highly strung. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Won a maiden here; progressive in handicaps, in hot race at Haydock latest; major player
runners.name: Ace Of Spades

quotes.race: Sue Ryder Leckhampton Court Hospice Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: The key move was not committing from three out. It's disappointing for everyone that it's a four-runner race but Ace Of Spades will be progressive. Last season he just improved and hopefully he can this season - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a maiden here on good in 2024; progressive in handicaps, winning at Aintree (2m4f) in October and fourth of 17 off this mark on return to 3m in a hot race at Haydock (again good to soft) in November; major player.

stable_tour.quote: We didn't think he was as fit as he evidently was when scoring at Aintree on his return, so it was a nice surprise. Hopefully, he can get some more ground that's not too soft, and we'll aim for a valuable 3m handicap hurdle at Haydock. 10-11-25

He progressed nicely last season, having got off the mark over hurdles at Cheltenham's November meeting. We feel there's a little more room for improvement in him over hurdles and we'll look at the longer-distance races with him. The £100,000 stayers' handicap hurdle on Betfair Chase day at Haydock on November 22 is on his radar. There's a good programme for him over hurdles this season and then he'll probably go chasing next term. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Bang there again over C&D three weeks ago, both under Benjamin Macey; respected
runners.name: Spike Jones

quotes.race: Sharon Knapp Memorial Cup Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers' Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Spike Jones had all sorts of niggly problems and wind problems. I did advise at one point to retire him so his owners deserve all the credit. He'd done a lot of work and Joe, my brother, rides him out most days. Maybe the better ground and cheekpieces helped him. We'll celebrate like he's won the Gold Cup - Sam Drinkwater, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Beaten a nose at Lingfield (2m7f, good to soft) and bang there again over C&D (good to soft; just ahead of Pike Road) three weeks ago, both under Benjamin Macey; creeping back up the weights but needs plenty of respect.

runners.comment: Usually front-runs; better than ever for Chepstow win latest; more to prove on good ground
runners.name: Love Of Neymore
runners.spotlight: Usually front-runs; solid in her three races last winter and better than ever when always prominent to win by a neck at Chepstow (extended 2m7f) last month; 5lb rise looks okay and this trip should be fine but there is a bit more for her to prove when the ground is not softer than good.

runners.comment: Close fourth over C&D latest, just behind Spike Jones, but 2lb out of the handicap today
runners.name: Pike Road
runners.spotlight: Usually ridden by Freddie Keighley in 2025; some jumping problems over fences before he won a hurdle race at Uttoxeter (extended 2m7f, soft; fine on good) in November; close fourth over C&D three weeks ago, just behind Spike Jones, but he is 2lb out of the handicap this time.

stable_tour.quote: He's been unlucky a few times, hitting the deck, but he's a lovely jumper. He looked to have the race in the bag at Ludlow last time and it wasn't his fault because the track was so slippy they abandoned the next chase. The jockey said his leg slipped and he chested the fence and unseated him. He can win over hurdles and fences. He's a tough horse who stays well, he just needs a change of luck. 12-11-25

15:40.race_name: 18-24 Get Your Racepass 'Junior' National Hunt Flat Race (Standard Open NH Flat Race) (Listed) (GBB)

runners.comment: Got up in the final strides to beat some of today's rivals at Wincanton
runners.name: Baillys Comet
runners.spotlight: Got up in the final strides to beat some of today's rivals at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and is bred to improve plenty on that bare form, being a half-brother to very smart Romeo Coolio.

runners.comment: Ties in with Molly's Lad on Aintree running; progress is plausible
runners.name: Berkshire Woody
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.spotlight: Easy to back but showed promise with staying-on third, one place behind Molly's Lad, at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft); progress is plausible, especially if the market signals go the other way.

runners.comment: Only a neck behind stablemate Bailly's Comet at Wincanton
runners.name: Champ Kabai
runners.spotlight: Only a neck behind shorter-priced stablemate Bailly's Comet at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and can't be totally dismissed on bare form, albeit that rival may have the greater potential.

runners.comment: Not certain to confirm Ludlow placings with Faithful Guardian
runners.name: Crack Ops
runners.spotlight: Has shown his form on sharp/flat, right-handed tracks, beating Faithful Guardian by half a length at Ludlow (2m, good) latest; unexposed but this is a stiffer test in more ways than one.

runners.comment: Lost chance on the final bend in Wincanton race won by Bailly's Comet
runners.name: Crest Of Arms
runners.spotlight: Lost his chance on the final bend (proved unrideable and dropped to last then stayed on) in the Wincanton race won by stablemate Bailly's Comet; may improve at this left-handed track.

runners.comment: Ran encouragingly at Exeter but this is a much deeper contest
runners.name: Dont Rein Me In
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly at Exeter (1m5f, good to form) where he beat all bar a subsequent hurdles scorer; the form behind has less substance, however, and this is a much deeper contest.

runners.comment: Open to progress and may reverse Ludlow placings with Crack Ops
runners.name: Faithful Guardian
runners.spotlight: Finished only half a length behind Crack Ops, who had the benefit of experience, at Ludlow (2m, good); may progress and reverse the placings with the outing under his belt.

runners.breeder: Ecurie De Cachene, Mr Patrick Charel
runners.comment: 87,000euros 2yo; Stable Tour comment suggests he has major potential
runners.name: Garrincha
runners.spotlight: 87,000euros 2yo; brother to useful 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner Madara, out of French 1m2f scorer (RPR 84); Stable Tour comment suggests he has plenty of potential; interesting newcomer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a brother to Madara who was bought as a two-year-old in France. He's going to start off in a three-year-old bumper and has plenty of potential. 18-11-25

runners.comment: 22,000euros yearling; has a bumper winner on dam's side
runners.name: Ivor Bear
runners.spotlight: 22,000euros yearling; dam point and 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to bumper and useful 2m-2m5f chase scorer Castle Oliver; heed the market signals.

runners.comment: Has a useful bumper scorer on dam's side; check the betting
runners.name: Maestrow
runners.spotlight: First foal of point-winning half-sister to three winners, notably Have You Seen Me (useful bumper and 2m-2m4f hurdle/chase), from family of high-class chaser Nick Dundee; check the betting.

runners.comment: Close second in French Flat race; has joined Nicky Henderson; respected
runners.name: Mariole
runners.spotlight: Related to several French jumps winners; close second in Flat event at Lignieres (1m4f, very soft) in sole start in France; has joined Nicky Henderson and warrants respect, particularly if strong in the betting.

stable_tour.quote: He's come from France after a run in an AQPS bumper and he finished second. We'll probably go for a bumper to start with, but he jumps very well. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Promising second at Aintree and should be capable of progress; player
runners.name: Mollys Lad
runners.spotlight: First foal of a fairly useful jumps winner for his owners; duly showed promise with staying-on second at Aintree (2m1f, good to soft) and should be capable of progress; likely player.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Mont Dit Mont
runners.comment: Swallowed up at Aintree when bidding to follow up Market Rasen win
runners.name: Pureis King
runners.spotlight: Has raced in a clear lead in both starts, holding on by a neck at Market Rasen (2m, good) but totally swallowed up at Aintree; could prove a sitting duck in this big field.

runners.comment: Close third to fellow joint-favourite Bailly's Comet at Wincanton
runners.name: Roximan
runners.spotlight: Grandson of a French Grade 1 hurdle winner; close third to fellow joint-favourite Bailly's Comet at Wincanton (1m7f, good) and looks set for an interesting rematch with improvement plausible.

runners.comment: Overcome trouble to win readily at Wetherby; promising contender
runners.name: Sollys Gold
runners.spotlight: Overcame a spot of trouble to lead in the final furlong and surge clear for a ready success at Wetherby (2m, soft); promising contender who has created the biggest impression visually.

runners.comment: Placed twice in French bumpers but this looks a harder task
runners.name: Marvelous Dragones
runners.spotlight: Placed in the last two of her three attempts in French bumpers, keeping-on third at Durtal (1m6f, very soft) latest; however, probably faces a stiffer task in this field.

11:49.race_name: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Well beaten in three novice hurdles but ought to be more competitive in this lowly grade
runners.name: Delta Blues Belle
runners.owner: Noel Fehily Racing Syndicate - Delta B
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in November 2024; well beaten in three novice hurdles this autumn and not obviously well treated for this handicap debut but represents a top stable and it won't be a surprise if she displays significant improvement.

runners.comment: Always behind on latest outing in September and now 0-8 over hurdles
runners.name: Linden Lane
runners.spotlight: Always behind on latest outing at Fontwell (2m1f, good) in September and now 0-8 over hurdles; given a chance by the handicapper but needs a much more dynamic performance today.

runners.comment: Pulled up on first two hurdle starts but last month's Southwell fourth was much better
runners.name: This Sway
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on first two hurdling starts but his huge-odds fourth at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month was much more encouraging and further progress is possible in handicaps.

runners.comment: Showed promise in qualifying races but soundly beaten in both handicaps
runners.name: Away For The Night
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in his qualifying races but was soundly beaten in his first two handicaps (2m3f/2m) and arrives here with quite a bit to prove; tongue-tie removed after one use.

runners.comment: Pulled up in first two handicaps but fared much better when third at Ludlow last month
runners.name: Midnight View
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in two handicaps in November but fared considerably better when third at Ludlow (2m, good to soft; no threat to easy winner) last month and enters calculations here.

runners.breeder: S A S Haras Le Gue
runners.comment: Headstrong and showed only minor promise in his qualifying races; handicap debut today
runners.name: The Padster
runners.spotlight: Headstrong and showed only minor promise in his qualifying races (2m-2m2f; ran out on second occasion); open to improvement in handicaps but others look less risky.

runners.comment: Placed in three juvenile hurdles last season but struggling in handicaps this term
runners.name: El Gavilan
