runners.spotlight: Placed in three juvenile hurdles last season but well beaten in all three handicaps this term and now 0-11 over hurdles; needs addition of cheekpieces to make a big difference.

runners.comment: Found 2m3f too taxing last time; good chance if judged on earlier Ffos Las second
runners.name: Cumhacht
runners.spotlight: Reportedly found 2m3f on good to soft ground too taxing when well beaten at Doncaster three weeks ago but returned from long absence with very creditable second behind dual subsequent winner at Ffos Las (2m, soft) in October and ought to be better suited by the good ground here; good chance.

runners.comment: Would probably have preferred a stronger pace to chase when sixth at Taunton last month
runners.name: Rukaana

quotes.race: Conferencing And Events At Nottingham Racecourse Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I had no plan. Rukaana was a little bit slow away but he's still learning but when the penny dropped he quickened nicely. He should get plenty of confidence from coming through them like that and he's hit the line strongly. He's a big horse but coming here onto good ground suited him and I'd be confident he'd get a mile and a quarter - Christian Howarth, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca With BetMGM Nursery Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Rukaana is a big lad and, once I got the position I wanted to be in, I was hoping I could set sail early enough because I think he'll stay further. He showed a nice attitude going to the line.  - Ben Curtis, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles but ran well when second on the Flat in November and might have preferred a stronger pace to aim at when respectable sixth on return to hurdling at Taunton (2m, good) last month; could have a say.

stable_tour.quote: He came from Charlie Hills on the Flat and will be going juvenile hurdling this season. He's got a really nice attitude to jumping and hopefully he can pick up a couple of nice juvenile races. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Fair Flat racer who has made the frame in three good-ground juvenile hurdles this autumn
runners.name: Flagon Dry
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who has made the frame in three good-ground juvenile hurdles this autumn; takes on older horses on this handicap debut; improvement possible.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecuries Babsen Courses
runners.comment: Third at 40-1 two runs ago and had possible ground excuse last time but others appeal more
runners.name: Saucats
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden; belied 40-1 odds when placed at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in November and may not have been suited by the soft ground when pulled up last time but overall profile remains unappealing.

12:24.race_name: Oliver Jorg Ties Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Wide-margin winner on hurdle debut; didn't run badly when turned over at short odds since
runners.name: Fountains Blenhein
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin winner on seasonal/hurdle debut at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft) in October; last of three finishers when 4-11 favourite in small field at Plumpton (2m4f, good) in November but that certainly wasn't a bad run and he has another big role to play here.

runners.comment: Won run-of-the-mill 2m7f novice on rules debut but latest run was disappointing
runners.name: Ignore The Door
runners.spotlight: Joined Harry Derham after Irish point win in March and made winning start to rules career in run-of-the-mill novice at Worcester (2m7f, good) in October; needs to better that form here, though, and last month's Chepstow run was disappointing.

stable_tour.quote: He won a novice hurdle at Worcester in October and will probably run again at Christmas as we just wanted to give him a break. He's a nice staying horse. He's not flash but he keeps galloping and stays well. I liked that he was still a bit green but won anyway. I'm not sure we'll know what's in him until he gets beat as he keeps a bit for himself. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Placed in Chepstow bumper on debut in November 2024 but not seen since; market helpful
runners.name: Assertive Walk
runners.owner: Mrs P Bond, Magniers, Mrs P Shanahan
runners.spotlight: Kept on for third of 13 on bumper debut at Chepstow (good to soft) in November 2024 but not seen since and has good standard to reach on hurdling debut; market may guide.

stable_tour.quote: He went a bit weak on us after running with promise at Chepstow, but there's been no major issues. He's a big horse who has taken time to fill his frame, but he's done well over the summer and is one we're looking forward to seeing over hurdles. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Good start to rules career when second at Bangor in November; engaged Uttoxeter Wednesday
runners.name: Firm But Fair
runners.spotlight: Placed on Irish point debut in April (soft ground) and made pretty good start to rules career when second of five at Bangor (2m7f, soft) in November; held an engagement at Uttoxeter (1.43) on Wednesday but will warrant serious consideration if he runs here.

stable_tour.quote: He's a really nice horse. I was very pleased with him on his debut at Bangor last week as he travelled well and jumped nicely. He's probably not this year's horse as he's still quite raw, but he'll develop into a nice staying chaser for next season and beyond. He'll run over Christmas and I think he'll be progressive. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Quickly bounced back from disappointing hurdle debut with easy win at Exeter; big player
runners.name: Pottersville
runners.spotlight: Readily won 15-runner Clonmel bumper (2m4f, good to yielding) by 8l in the spring and bounced back quickly from disappointing stable/hurdle debut when scoring easily by 24l at Exeter (2m7f, good to soft) in November; takes on males in a stronger race here but looks useful.

12:59.race_name: DJB Property Services Windsor Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Mares' Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Just 1-10 over hurdles but gave excellent account when placed at Cheltenham last month
runners.name: Game Colours
runners.spotlight: Just 1-10 over hurdles but is largely consistent and gave excellent account when third at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last month; will be fine on the forecast faster ground here; must be considered.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a really good mare and has always shown plenty of speed at home. She fractured her leg in the spring and had to take a bit of time off because of that. She's progressed this season, going close a couple of times before winning a novice hurdle at Lingfield last time. We want to run her at Kelso in a £100,000 mares' final in a couple of weeks. If it's good to soft ground she'll act on it as she's got plenty of speed. She's pretty well handicapped off her current mark of 116 and we're looking forward to it. 12-03-25

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way over 3m last month and may be better suited by this shorter trip
runners.name: I Spy A Diva
runners.spotlight: Yet to match her best form since returning from long absence in April (four runs) but ran well for a long way at Southwell (3m, good to soft) last month and may be better suited by today's trip-and-ground combination.

stable_tour.quote: She's progressing and should pick up another little race. If it's a case of running her with a double penalty, I can take 7lb off her with Kai Lenihan on top. 21-11-22

runners.comment: Ran well on stable debut last December but absent until early unseat last month
runners.name: Ring O Roses
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who seems very versatile ground-wise; ran well before fading into third on stable debut at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) just over a year ago but not seen again until early unseat last month and still has fitness to prove; hood refitted.

runners.breeder: J Dubois & Scea De La Vallee De Lorne
runners.comment: 2-7 over hurdles; tailed off in Listed race last time but enters calculations here
runners.name: Jasmine Dairy

quotes.race: Chris, Sue And Gail Birthday Celebration Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jasmine d'Airy has grown up a lot from last season. She likes to have her own way and her jumping was superb. This was a prep run before going to the Listed mares' novice hurdle at Newbury on Coral Gold Cup day. She wants further than two miles and that's a really good starting point for her -  Ben Sutton, jockey.

quotes.race: ExTech Cloud Computing Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jasmine D'Airy has been a bit frustrating all season because I think she's quite a nice mare. She travels so strongly and always looks like she's going to jump two out and take off, and it hasn't happened. We changed her bit today and Ben said that's the nicest ride he's gotten off her, so maybe she's just more settled with that. She'll probably be a mares' chaser eventually, and we'll see if Nick [Sutton] wants her out again this spring - she could well be but I wouldn't run her on quick ground - Harry Derham, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Front-runner who ended last season with maiden win at Plumpton (2m4f, good) and followed up in Uttoxeter novice (2m, heavy) when back in action in November; tailed off in a subsequent Listed race but still enters calculations on this handicap return.

stable_tour.quote: She did the job well at Uttoxeter. She'll now go to the mares' Listed race on Coral Gold Cup day. She deserves her chance at black type and could stay hurdling or go chasing after that. She's got a high cruising speed and she wants an aggressive ride over two miles. I'd love her to go chasing as she's a very good jumper. 19-11-25

runners.breeder: A Hales, Mr & Mrs J Fry, Mr D Fitzgerald
runners.comment: Unraced on ground faster than good to soft but otherwise, has sound claims
runners.name: Looking As You Are
runners.spotlight: Chased home very progressive rival on seasonal debut at Market Rasen (2m2f, good to soft) in November and also ran well when third at Sandown (2m4f, soft) last month, albeit she was tired in the closing stages; unraced on ground quicker than good to soft but, otherwise. has sound claims.

runners.comment: Flopped on latest outing but looked very promising beforehand; handicap debut
runners.name: Easy Love
runners.spotlight: Looked quite useful in bumpers last season and, having won run-of-the-mill Fontwell maiden (2m5f, good) on hurdling debut in May, returned with creditable third at Cheltenham (3m, good) in October; flopped when warm favourite for next race but can be dangerous if back on song for handicap debut.

runners.comment: Kept on well for second at Wincanton last time and still has low mileage; likely contender
runners.name: Bobbi With An
runners.spotlight: Held off Springtime Legend to win Wincanton novice (2m5f, heavy) at start of last year and has made the frame in all three handicaps this season, most recently when keeping-on second at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) last month; also suited by good ground; likely contender.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a blinder at Exeter on Friday. She's gone up a couple of pounds for that, but it won't be long until we're winning with her. She scored nicely on her first start for us at Wincanton and her point-to-point form looks good too. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Reeled in clear leader to score at Haydock last month, her first run after long absence
runners.name: Lets Go To Vegas

quotes.race: George Rickards Birthday Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lets Go To Vegas has been been a lovely mare and won very well first time out before we bumped into a nice horse [Kateira] for Dan Skelton. Her form is good and she'll be a nice chaser next season - Alastair Ralph, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Returned from long absence with narrow win at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft) last month, keeping on gamely to reel in the clear leader, and is now 3-7 over hurdles; only 4lb higher here and still well handicapped on her old form.

runners.comment: Made low-ley seasonal debut last month but is open to improvement in handicaps
runners.name: Springtime Legend
runners.spotlight: Lost out only by a head to Bobbi With An I at Wincanton (2m5f, heavy; first-time hood) last January; two lesser efforts have followed but the latter (last month) came after a layoff and she remains open to improvement on this handicap debut.

13:34.race_name: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won Irish point and 2m hurdle; capitulated tamely once headed over fences latest
runners.name: Admiral Stewart
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who added a hurdle win at Ffos Las (2m, soft) in late 2024; had a walkover on his intended chase debut but offputting that he capitulated so tamely once headed at Southwell (2m4f, soft) in November and soon pulled up; risky after that.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut at Ffos Las and was second under a penalty at Ayr, trying to give 7lb to Jet To Vegas, who won a Grade 2 at Kelso and was fourth in a Grade 1. He's off a mark of 122 and there should be an awful lot more to come from him over a fence. We'll start off over two miles on soft ground. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Off the mark in minor 2m Plumpton maiden hurdle; respectable chase debut; can improve
runners.name: Norn Iron

quotes.race: Roy Reeve Memorial "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very straightforward and Norn Iron will make a nice chaser one day. He's had a couple of good runs in defeat and was second a few times through no fault of his own. Harry [Derham, trainer] said after the last day that we should go for a maiden or novice and try to win before we put him away for the summer, so it's good to get that win before he goes chasing - Paul O'Brien, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Consistent rather than progressive over hurdles and found the ideal race in a Plumpton maiden (2m, good) last April; made just a respectable chase debut at Warwick (2m, soft) after a layoff, with the odd stutter along the way behind one on a three-timer, but a likely type who should improve.

stable_tour.quote: He'll go chasing this season. He was always a very good jumper and I think chasing could bring out some improvement in him. He'll be ready to start at the beginning of December and he's potentially well handicapped. 19-11-25

runners.breeder: C A F R E Enniskellen Campus
runners.comment: Won maiden/novice hurdles last winter; not gone on over fences and ran moderately latest
runners.name: Bond Broker

quotes.race: MW Paving & Groundworks Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward on Bond Broker. He's growing up all the time - Freddie Gingell, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won maiden and novice hurdles (about 2m1f; good to soft and good) last winter but he has yet to go on over fences and found little when a remote fourth of five at Plumpton (2m1f, good) in November; needs another drop in the weights on that evidence.

stable_tour.quote: He's always inclined to be a bit buzzy and ran too keen on his chasing debut at Ffos Las in May, not getting home over two and a half miles. So we came back in trip at Newton Abbot last month when he ran to a similar level of form. He's well capable of winning over fences provided we keep him to the right level, and there's a two-mile handicap at Plumpton on November 17. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Has form at 2m but stayed 2m5f well when hurdle winner in April; a threat now chasing
runners.name: Koukeo
runners.spotlight: Respectable bumper and hurdle form at about 2m but he saw out the stiff 2m5f well at Exeter (good) last spring when giving weight to one who won his next two starts; ended campaign on a low note last April but could well take to fences at the first attempt; a threat.

stable_tour.quote: It was probably all a bit too much for him going over to Punchestown for his first outing in April, but he'd shown some nice pieces of work before finishing second at Chepstow last month. He'll be going over hurdles now and we're keen to get some experience into him. He could be a nice stayer down the line. 06-11-24

runners.comment: Not at best over hurdles for new stable this season but drops in grade for chase return
runners.name: Tax For Max

quotes.race: Forth Mountain Trails Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Once we got TAX FOR MAX jumping, he was very straight-forward. I took a lead but after the first couple of fences, I was happy to let him roll away. He was the best horse in the race so there was no point complicating it. He made a mistake at the second last but apart from that he was very nimble and good. He is not the biggest in the world. It was a good round of jumping for his first go over fences - Kieran Callaghan, jockey.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boosts Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: It looked a good opportunity for Tax For Max when Flaming Moon fell as he was the obvious danger. He was more manageable than I thought and maybe he's learning more now. We were going a nice gallop which suited him too and he's a grand horse. He's doing the world of good to win, he's been running in some competitive races and hard races without winning, so that'll do his confidence good - Paul Townend, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on old hurdling form for Willie Mullins and won a beginners' chase for him in 2023; returned from long absence with four underwhelming hurdle runs for new stable in the autumn but drops in grade for this return to fences and has been given a wind op.

stable_tour.quote: He can be very keen in his races and we're giving him a break now to be gelded. He's a maiden over hurdles but has been able to build up experience. Possibly from Christmas on, he'll aim for the top novice races. 02-11-21

runners.comment: Dual winner last March; latest run steadied the ship after three non-completions
runners.name: Yes Day

quotes.race: Green Dragon Hotel Hereford Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: There are no plans going forward for Yes Day as it looked a poor race - Jonjo O'Neill, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner last March (3m1f/3m6f); pulled up on final two starts last season and fell on reappearance outing in October but steadied the ship with a respectable run in November; suited by good ground and should cope with this drop back in trip; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He probably would have won at Ludlow on his comeback when he fell four out, and got tapped for speed last time at Wetherby. He's one for the regional nationals providing he gets decent enough ground. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Won over 2m on British chasing debut in October and could have more to offer over 2m4f
runners.name: Mister Cessna
runners.spotlight: Came good in Britain with novice hurdle win at end of last season and followed up with ready success in handicap chase at Uttoxeter (2m, good) in October; perhaps a shade disappointing when second of three last time but could still have untapped potential over fences and over this new trip.

stable_tour.quote: He was very disappointing first time at Chepstow. We put him in the deep end there, but I embarrassed myself and the owners with that entry. He really redeemed himself at Ludlow, and I think we'll definitely take our chance in the Boodles if he gets in. 18-2-25

runners.comment: Five wins for stable since September; 3lb well in after going close at Fakenham last week
runners.name: Shantou Lucky

prev_owners.owner: J Bedi, P Ellerby And Partners

quotes.race: Kilmanahan Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Shantou Lucky ran very well at Leopardstown last time and he is taking to fences. He will stay on the go probably but he might not run on good ground - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won five of his first six starts over hurdles/fences (2m4f-3m2f; visored for all) after joining James Owen in September and recovered from slight dip in form when close second at Fakenham (2m5f, soft) 11 days ago; good ground also suits and he's 3lb well in from a 2lb lower mark here; headgear switched.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well enough at Fairyhouse this month. He'll mix and match between hurdles and fences and hopefully pay his way. 27-10-22

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Haie Neuve Et Al
runners.comment: Wide-margin winner in spring 2024; jumping error cooked his goose on last month's return
runners.name: Toothless
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences at fourth attempt, with wide-margin success at Plumpton (2m3f, good) in May 2024; not seen again until Wincanton last month, where he was going okay until jolting error seemed to knock the stuffing out of him; could still have more to offer.

stable_tour.quote: Since last seen on the track, he's nearly died of colic and needed major surgery. He's back now and I hope he can remain competitive, in the right grade and when conditions are suitable; he's best on decent ground. I'll be looking for a two-and-a-half-mile handicap round one of the smaller courses towards the end of the month. 04-11-25

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De Lorne
runners.comment: Good winner on chase debut; lacked fluency when only fourth last time; remains of interest
runners.name: Kalif Dairy
runners.owner: S Packham, A Austin And B Austin
runners.spotlight: Endured some seconditis over hurdles last season but was a clear winner when switched to chasing at Lingfield (2m4f, good) in November; lacked fluency and finished about 7l behind Joe Cotton when fourth at Wincanton last month but remains very much of interest; swaps cheekpieces for new blinkers.

stable_tour.quote: He finished second four times last season and I think he's well handicapped. He's been immature so far, but the penny seems to be dropping and hopefully he'll improve over a fence this season. 28-10-25

runners.comment: Won valuable series final last March and has remained in good form since; respected
runners.name: Joe Cotton

quotes.race: Smith And Western Chase Series Final (A Handicap Chase) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm particularly delighted as Joe Cotton has been frustratingly consistent without winning. I was thrilled that the headgear seemed to make a difference. He runs on every single type of ground but I imagine we'll probably stop there, he's earned himself a holiday - Jeremy Scott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won valuable series final at Fontwell (2m3f, good; first-time blinkers) last March and has remained in good form since, most recently when third in first-time visor at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft) last month; probably won't be far away.

14:50.race_name: Fitzdares New Year's Day Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Disappointed last time but posted career-best form when bagging good prize in October
runners.name: Rambo T

quotes.race: Wasdell Group Silver Trophy Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Rambo T was handicapped out of it. It just shows that you should run them and with a good ride they don't need to be the best handicapped. I'm not shocked often but I am after that - I didn't think he'd win - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Stan Mellor Memorial Beginners' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I don't think Rambo T liked making the running to be honest. Uttoxeter, two miles is a lovely place to get a horse started. He got a nice bit of experience that day and we got beat, but that stood him in good stead. He's been a real fun horse for connections and hopefully he'll carry on improving - Ollie Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Needs to rebound from last month's disappointing effort at Aintree but posted career-best performance when bagging good prize at Chepstow (2m4f, good) in October and promising conditional Shane Fenelon claims 5lb here.

stable_tour.quote: He likes being very fresh and he surprised me when winning the Silver Trophy at Chepstow. He's done what he needed to this season already, so everything else is just a bonus. He probably won't run for another five weeks. We'll look for a nice handicap for him somewhere. He likes intermediate trips. 23-10-25

He won very well at Newton Abbot and ran well when third at Cheltenham last week. He looks progressive and we could go over fences with him later in the season, but we'll go for one last run over hurdles and try to win a nice pot. 01-11-23

runners.comment: Ran big race when second on seasonal debut and is not yet filly exposed; respected
runners.name: Guard Duty

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Proudly Supporting British Racing National Hunt Flat Race (Cond'/Amateurs') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Guard Duty is an athlete and a nice horse but he has been a little overenthusiastic at home and had lots of niggly issues and growing pains. Jack rides him every day - he is a handful and tests all the boundaries - so it was lovely he could ride him today and be rewarded for all the hard work he's put in. He's a work in progress but he's a decent horse in the making and has plenty of potential - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won three times as a novice last season (once over C&D) and ran big race when second on reappearance outing at Newbury (2m4f, soft) in November; went up 5lb for that but is not yet fully exposed and should be fine on the faster ground here; might be the answer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great order and I need to unleash him somewhere shortly. The problem is he wants proper soft ground. I'm going to start him over 2m4f - ultimately 3m is probably the answer for him but he'll come out all guns blazing, so it's best to begin over shorter. He had many niggly issues in his formative years but had a full season last time and he's a proper racehorse. He scoped dirty after his final run at Uttoxeter, so you can put a line through that. He wasn't the most straightforward and has taken a lot of patience from everyone but the way he developed with a clear run last season makes you realise all the hard work was worthwhile. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Began season with two good efforts but needs to find something extra here
runners.name: Act Of Authority

quotes.race: Peak Cap & Pearls Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was never in any doubt for Act Of Authority. He could possibly have a break now and then step up in grade - Colin Asquith, owner's representative.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Act Of Authoirty is a classy little horse. He's a bit of a wimp and when the two closed in on me in the straight, I thought, 'We're done here' but he showed an extra gear and I think he's way better than what he's off [ratings wise]. We've always thought he was a nice prospect but has just taken time to get to where he is. He showed an amazing turn of foot up that hill - Lewis Saunders, jockey.

quotes.race: Bowel Cancer Screening Programme Saves Lives Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Act Of Authority is not the biggest and I don't think he'll be seen at his best on winter ground. He's a horse for the autumn and the spring so we'll look at a sexier target for him. Aintree may come a bit too soon but we could look at Ayr or the Cheltenham April meeting. He didn't turn up last time, he was beaten early on. He's a funny horse, he has a kink in him. It's hard with two penalties so that was a good performance - Olly Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Paul & Janet Mizen Wedding Anniversary Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Act Of Authority didn't run badly at Cheltenham where I still don't think he ran his race. I hate riding horses like that, but his best performances have been when ridden positively. We'll have a go at a nice handicap and probably go up in trip - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 5-15 over hurdles; began this season with two perfectly respectable runs but was behind Stream Of Stars when third at Aintree (2m4f, soft) last month and needs to find something extra here.

stable_tour.quote: He was second in the Martin Pipe at Cheltenham and he's very unexposed at staying trips over hurdles. He could well make up into a nice Pertemps horse. 23-10-25

He came up against some nice horses last season and got off to a good start over hurdles at Bangor but was found out in Graded company at Cheltenham last week. He's never worked the house down at home and saves his best for the track. I don't think he'll improve loads for a fence, but he's one to look forward to. 01-11-23

runners.comment: Made good progress last season but not much has gone to plan this term
runners.name: East India Express

quotes.race: Kingston Stud Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: East India Express has had a great season and won three this season. I'm not sure he's a chaser but Nico [de Boinville] was keen to try. Freddie's been great on him all the way through. Nicky Henderson - trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jumping is so important and East India Express has winged the last two hurdles, and it's what has made us win the race. He might respect a fence a bit more and fingers crossed he'll be better for the future - Freddie Gordon, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I tried to get East India Express ready for the Newbury (Goffs Sale) bumper after he won here, however after that he coughed and coughed and for months and I couldn't get him out again. It has taken a bit of work to get him there. He wouldn't show you anything at home and that is why he was probably the second string here last time. He jumped really well. We have all had to work a little bit hard on his jumping and it wasn't the most natural thing to him, but he has got the hang of it the last few weeks and he was very good out there. I went this trip just to give him a little more time to work it out - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Get Closer To The Action Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That wasn't the plan! The objective is the sales race at Newbury and we didn't want a penalty for that but we have got one. East India Express is the first one of a bunch of sales horses we have to run. I think they are a nice bunch but I don't want to say too much. He will go for the Goffs bumper at Newbury now and you are better going there with a bit of experience. Everybody has always liked him and he has got a great temperament - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made good progress last season, signing off with 6l win at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in April, but not much has gone to plan this term and others in this line-up have less to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He had a fantastic year last season. He ran at Ascot on one Saturday in December and Jerry McGrath had the brains to ring me before the race and say to put him in at Kempton six days later. He won at Ascot, so we left Freddie Gordon on next time to allow him to claim 5lb. That worked out and then he ran a hell of a race in the Martin Pipe at the festival in March before winning a nice race at Cheltenham in April. We need to decide whether he stays over hurdles or goes novice chasing, but he's summered well and we start again with the same enthusiasm. 21-10-25

runners.comment: Won at Aintree festival in April and placed at Punchestown in May; back from a break today
runners.name: Wellington Arch

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Wellington Arch did everything right and jumped well. It was a good ride and it all went according to plan, but it was tense at the end and I thought we were going to be caught until thank God somebody moved the post for us. We always had this race in mind, but we were the last one in and we thought we might have to wait until tomorrow and the two-mile race. I'd imagine that will be it for the season and then I've got chasing in mind for him next season. He'll hopefully make up into a nice chaser, but he's done his job today and we'll enjoy that - Jonjo O'Neill, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It looked like Wellington Arch should go and do that, but he's done it nicely. I'm very happy for Mike and Mary (Gaskell). They've had to be patient with him this autumn, but I think they'll see the rewards in the spring hopefully - Jonjo O'Neill Jnr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Richard Newland Racing Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was pleased to see the rain last night so I let Wellington Arch take his chance. He's a big raw horse, we'll see how it goes and take it from there but I'd say he'll go for another bumper somewhere - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

runners.spotlight: In excellent form when last seen in the spring, winning 20-runner handicap at Aintree festival (2m4f, good to soft) before very creditable third of 16 at Punchestown (2m4f, yielding); still quite lightly raced; contender if fully tuned up after break.

stable_tour.quote: He was ultra-consistent last season and the highlight came when he won at Aintree in the spring. He'll improve for a fence, but he's only six so we'll see how much he can progress over hurdles first. 18-11-25

runners.comment: 2-3 since reverting to hurdles this season and good 7lb claimer Isabelle Ryder booked here
runners.name: Idy Wood

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Pertemps Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: He's such a reliable, consistent individual. Idy Wood was a very decent novice hurdler and then won a couple of chases, but I think he's appreciated going back over hurdles. I think he might be the type for the Lanzarote Hurdle, but he wouldn't want it [the ground] too deep. He has good Kempton form and seems to like the track. It's a possibility [that he could go to the Pertemps final at Cheltenham], it would also be ground dependent, and we haven't campaigned him over three miles. But there might be a bit of improvement when he does. - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Idy Wood got a nasty cut. I think he got it at the first when he bunny-hopped and it's taken half of his hoof off. He'll be fine with a bit of TLC and I'd say that explained it. It was still a good run and the winner looked a good horse - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Duo Systems Your Floor Our Focus Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Idy Wood is a lovely, straightforward horse who gives everything and he's still unbeaten under rules. He looks to be progressing well and there will be more exciting things to come. He never won a point-to-point but he looks to have thrived under rules. We might look for another similar novice under a penalty before looking at nicer things - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won two chases last season and is 2-3 since he reverted to hurdling this term, the latter win gained at Kempton (2m5f, good) in November; 6lb higher in stronger race here but Isabelle Ryder claims a very useful 7lb; no surprise if he features.

stable_tour.quote: He's placed in Graded company over hurdles and was fourth in the Silver Trophy. I'd have thought something like the Lanzarote Hurdle might be ideal for him. He doesn't like it too soft, so Kempton in January should suit him. 05-11-25
Successful on his only start under rules in a Newbury bumper in February, he is a fine type who jumps well - he's one to look forward to as a novice hurdler. 28-09-23

runners.comment: Set to be placed at least before last-flight fall last month; remains very lightly raced
runners.name: Castle Carrock

quotes.race: Anne Boleyn "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I knew coming to the last I had a bit left and I would have liked to have winged it, but Castle Carrock picked up well from the back of it. He's always jumped well. He might improve as the season goes on. He won on good ground up at Ayr, so it was nice to get today's win under his belt - Tom Cannon, rider.

runners.spotlight: Unexposed 7yo who was a promising novice last season; well beaten when making handicap debut in Greatwood at Cheltenham (2m, soft) in November but was set to be placed at least before last-flight fall at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) last month and may still have potential.

runners.comment: Quite lightly raced for his age and last month's clear Aintree second was career-best form
runners.name: Stream Of Stars

quotes.race: Bangor-On-Dee Family Fun Day Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stream Of Stars is very consistent and has been coming down the weights. Sam [Twiston-Davies] gave him a lovely ride. He's ground-versatile and had been coming back into form at home recently, and the drop into this kind of race was key - Willy Twiston-Davies, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Kilburn Gaels Hurling Club Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Stream Of Stars had a long time off and the owners have been very patient, because I promise you we've probably given him eight entries and he's never once been declared. There's been a lot of patience shown all round and it's paid off. He had a leg, and then recovered from that and was just coming back into training at possibly the wrong time. I thought stepping up to two miles and three on his first run back possibly wasn't ideal but luckily he got a nice slot in behind the leader and it was a nice even pace. He relaxed and jumped - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Veteran who is lightly raced for his age and probably posted career-best performance when clear second at Aintree (2m4f, soft) last month; also suited by good ground and James Turner claims 5lb here; can make his presence felt.

runners.comment: Second in major 3m handicap at Haydock in November; player if okay back at 2m4f
runners.name: Hartington

quotes.race: Agetur UK Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It went pretty well and the race seemed to fall apart up the straight. I was flat out for most of the race and Hartington stayed on well - Brendan Powell, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Made winning seasonal debut at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) in November and bettered that form when second in major handicap at Haydock (3m, good to soft) later that month; not sure to be ideally suited by the reduced emphasis on stamina here but might still be on the upgrade.

stable_tour.quote: He won nicely on his first start of the season at Carlisle. He'd run really well at Windsor in January but tweaked a muscle, and we didn't bother running him after the ground quickened up in the spring. Our plan to be patient worked and it was a good pot at Carlisle, where he stayed really well and needed every yard of the two and a half miles. There's more to come. We'll stay hurdling and look at a Pertemps qualifier, just to tick that box for later on. 12-11-25

runners.comment: Won 25-runner handicap at Punchestown last April but too inconsisent to rely upon
runners.name: Thanksforthehelp
runners.spotlight: Won 25-runner handicap at Punchestown festival last April (2m3f, yielding) and remains well handicapped on older form but has very mixed record over last couple of years and made a low-key reappearance in November; hard to predict.

stable_tour.quote: He bolted up at Chepstow after a wind operation and then went to the Pertemps Final, which was a bit of a messy race, but he wasn't beaten that far in 12th. We ran him at Haydock in May but the ground was too quick and Jack did the right thing to pull him up and look after him. If he schools well, I'd imagine he'll be going over fences this season. He's still filling into his frame and will hopefully improve with age. 31-10-23

runners.comment: Gave good account when placed at Plumpton in November but others look more progressive
runners.name: Listentoyourheart
runners.owner: S T Racing - The Founders Syndicate

quotes.race: Play Coral 'Racing-Super-Series' For Free Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Listentoyourheart was good there, she snipped through that gap. She's tough, she's hardy and has a little bit of experience under her belt. We got on with it and got some racing into her early in the season. Today was always going to be harder, but we were preparing her for it. When they turned the taps on, she took about five strides to pick up when the others picked up immediately in front of her. Some would back out of that hole, but she's not like that - Dan Skelton, trainer.

quotes.race: CSP Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Two and a half miles will be no issue and Listentoyourheart actually ran well on softer ground at Aintree, but I'm not in a massive hurry to pitch her in. While the ground is like this we don't have to - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Gave good account when third (about 5l behind Stream Of Stars) at Plumpton (2m4f, good) six weeks ago but is yet to make any significant further progress since winning Listed novice hurdle in November 2024; others have more appealing profiles.

stable_tour.quote: She was fourth on her seasonal debut at Chepstow last month in the Welsh Champion Hurdle, lacking speed mid-race but staying on well. That told us she needs two and a half miles and will be tactically suited by the step up in trip, but we're waiting for a little bit of rain and some nice, safe ground. 10-11-25

runners.comment: Lightly raced and disappointing since Grace 2 novice win in 2023; cheekpieces added here
runners.name: Minella Missile

quotes.race: Trustatrader Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Hyde Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Minella Missile is very laid back. I love a horse you can drop in and then they quicken, not many can get there in two strides but he can. Talk is talk and the men in March, they don't talk they just turn up. We're under no illusions and he's won his race. He's a half-brother to Monbeg Genius who I think is a very good horse and his future will be over fences somewhere down the line. For a staying novice hurdler he quickens - Evan Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice hurdle at Cheltenham (2m5f, good to soft) in November 2023 but lightly raced and generally very disappointing since; needs first-time cheekpieces to provide a significant boost.

stable_tour.quote: I couldn't get him right after he won the Grade 2 contest at Cheltenham last year, so I just gave him time. I could have run him, but I was never 100 per cent happy, so we chose to be patient. I'm delighted with him now and he's ready to run. He's still not got much experience and it's difficult to find the right starting point, but he doesn't want it too deep and he'll have a few entries in the coming weeks. 25-11-24

He was a nice novice before Christmas last season, winning at Chepstow and a Grade 2 at Cheltenham, where he beat Captain Teague, but I couldn't get him right after that. He struggled and I was lucky that I was under no pressure to run him in the spring. We basically just gave him the chance to come back to himself. He's now ready to run and I did have him entered at Hereford recently but decided to wait. There's a handicap hurdle on New Year's Day at Cheltenham or I might wait for Kempton on January 11 for the Lanzarote, but we'll see. We'll slot him in somewhere. He's ready to go but doesn't want the ground too deep. 24-12-24

runners.comment: Won his first two handicap chases easily and could still have further improvement to come
runners.name: Fortune Dancer

quotes.race: Southern Contract Lifting Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Fortune Dancer is all about her fences. She's not the quickest, but she's the most wonderful jumper. When it started raining I was worried it might go too soft for her, but for her first time over fences it was fantastic - Chris Gordon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three maiden/novice hurdles last season but easily won two handicap chases (3m2f, good to soft/3m, soft) by wide margins in November; raised 24lb in total and needs to prove himself on the quicker ground here but could still have significant further improvement to come.

stable_tour.quote: She probably benefited from the yard being out of form last season and got quite a nice mark over hurdles. She wasn't really showing many signs but as soon as we came to schooling her over a fence she completely changed. She's a wonderful jumper. She went out for her first chase start at Fontwell and hacked up. It wasn't the strongest race - it was only a 0-100 - but she jumped brilliantly. She's in a mares' 0-100 at Uttoxeter on Thursday. The handicapper put her up 13lb, which I thought was tough. She won it well, but in those 0-100s there are usually a lot of characters who have issues, so bearing that in mind the rise might be harsh, but we'll see on Thursday. 01-12-25

runners.comment: Well handicapped on hurdle form but has shaky record over fences; new headgear tried
runners.name: All Authorized

quotes.race: Cappagh Browne Utilities Ltd Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: All Authorized was given a very good ride and everything worked out well. Fair play to the course, they must have done a brilliant job with the going because this horse can't go on anything other than slow ground. He's done it well today and he'll go straight chasing now. That trip suited him well, he's a brother to I Am Maximus so he should stay well - Gary Moore, joint-trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner on good ground (2m3f/3m1f); well handicapped on that form but has shaky record over fences (four attempts) and was tailed off in first-time cheekpieces last month; tried in blinkers here; not easy to predict.

stable_tour.quote: He won over hurdles at Plumpton in April, but he'll go back over fences now and I think he's a well-handicapped horse. He's a full brother to I Am Maximus and will keep on improving with age. He could be a proper horse. 28-10-25

runners.comment: 26l behind Fortune Dancer when fourth on chase return in November; had recent wind op
runners.name: Flintara
runners.spotlight: Well beaten over hurdles on seasonal debut (wore cheekpieces) in November and was 26l behind Fortune Dancer when fourth on chase return at Uttoxeter (3m, soft; first-time visor) later that month; on good mark now but needs latest wind op (his third) to have made a difference.

runners.comment: 0-12 over fences and wasn't firing on all cylinders when last seen last spring
runners.name: Limetree Boy
runners.spotlight: 0-12 over fences and wasn't firing on all cylinders when last seen last spring; resumes on another career-low mark and remains very unexposed at around 3m but others have more compelling claims here.

stable_tour.quote: His run at Aintree behind Hillcrest and Our Jet last season was good, as was his win at Wetherby. We'll hopefully start him off over fences at Worcester on Thursday and he's been schooling well. We're looking forward to seeing him mature over fences. 25-10-22

runners.comment: 2-5 over fences; beaten off lower hurdle mark last time; may still have chasing potential
runners.name: Bridget Mary
runners.spotlight: Doubled chasing tally with 10l win at Bangor (3m, good) at end of last season and was close/clear second over that C&D (good)  when returning in October; beaten at short odds off her lower hurdle mark since (cheekpieces left off, as today) but may still have potential over fences.

stable_tour.quote: She always works like a nice horse but I've been a bit disappointed with her. I think she'll prove to be better than she's turned out to be so far. 10-02-25

runners.comment: Four-time chase winner but out of form this season; headgear switched
runners.name: Felton Bellevue
runners.owner: Mrs H Munn, R E Good, B Case

quotes.race: Sri Lanka, The Wonder Of Asia Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I couldn't believe the price difference between Felton Bellevue and Twilight Glory because they've run against each other quite regularly. He didn't run badly at Sedgefield the other day. I expected them to go a gallop there, but it just turned into a bit of a sprint - Ben Case, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner; back down to a good mark now but has looked laboured on all three appearances this season and needs to respond very positively to a change of headgear today (usually wears cheekpieces).

runners.comment: Well beaten on seasonal debut but last month's run was better; on tempting mark now
runners.name: Spotty Dog

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I got there a bit soon on Spotty Dog but I had to go as I had pressure. He enjoyed the fast pace and loves it around here - Liam Harrison, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer who began last year with some respectable efforts and is on a tempting mark now; well beaten in November, after a layoff, but last month's Wincanton run was a bit better and he might take another step forward on the quicker ground here; headgear switched.

12:30.race_name: Virgin Bet Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Respectable Listed fourth at Aintree last time and he's a leading player under a penalty
runners.name: Scarlet Moon
runners.spotlight: Progressive on the Flat and won at Warwick (2m, good) in November on second hurdle start; respectable fourth of seven in Listed hurdle at Aintree (2m1f, soft) last time and he's a leading player under a 7lb penalty.

runners.comment: Made the frame on first two hurdle runs but flopped at Catterick last time; wind op since
runners.name: Arctic Voyage
runners.spotlight: Promise in defeat on first two hurdle starts (including over C&D on good to soft) albeit not totally convincing with his stamina; a tongue-tie returns and he's had wind surgery since being pulled up at Catterick 16 days ago (failed to settle) but has something to prove after that.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse we're just getting to know. While 6f on soft ground will be ideal, I don't think he's a proper sprinter. He's giving the impression in his work that he'll probably stay 7f or even a mile. His first run for us on the all-weather told us that. Hopefully he can pick up a nice prize in the back end. He's ground dependent and if it turned up soft at the Western meeting next week we'd take our chance there, even back at 6f. 10-09-25

runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on hurdle debut and has to leave that run miles behind
runners.name: Ashdown Forest
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden on the Flat who was bought for 44,000gns to go hurdling; disappointing on hurdle/stable debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) three weeks ago when sent off favourite; wears first-time blinkers and he's probably capable of better, but has to leave that last run miles behind.

runners.comment: There was promise in his recent fifth on hurdle/stable debut at Newbury and he's respected
runners.name: Belaya River
runners.spotlight: Modest maiden on the Flat but he should have a brighter future in this code judged on his recent fifth on hurdle/stable debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) which came in a deeper race than this; respected for good yard.

runners.comment: 0-6 on the Flat and tailed over C&D on hurdle; may be best watched for now
runners.name: Canavan
runners.spotlight: In good hands and he could take a step forward at some stage but he failed to progress on the Flat and was tailed off at 18-1 on hurdle debut over C&D (good to soft) in November; may be best watched for now.

runners.comment: 1m wins on last 2 Flat runs in Ireland; bought for 105,000gns; high on list on h'dle debut
runners.name: Falls Of Acharn
runners.spotlight: Won 1m maiden at Leopardstown (good) in August and followed up on handicap debut at Cork (1m, yielding); sold out of Jessica Harrington's yard for 105,000gns since; his (admittedly Flat) pedigree provides optimism he'll have the necessary stamina for this game; high on the list for top yard.

runners.comment: 28-1 when always behind on sole Flat start; a dramatic transformation is necessary
runners.name: Flagstone
runners.spotlight: 28-1 when always behind for John Joseph Murphy at Galway (7f, yielding) in July on sole Flat start; a dramatic transformation is necessary on this hurdle/stable debut.

runners.comment: Flat winner at ordinary level; soundly beaten on sole hurdle run; others preferred
runners.name: Glenridding
runners.spotlight: 1m Flat winner for the Kublers at an ordinary level (from 11 starts in that code); soundly beaten in July on sole run over hurdles; changed hands for 7,000gns in October; makes stable debut and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Tailed off in August on sole Flat start and same story when 50-1 for recent hurdle debut
runners.name: Orphan Ollie
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in August on sole Flat start and same story when 50-1 for recent hurdle debut at Doncaster (2m, good to soft).

runners.comment: 0-6 on the Flat for Jim Bolger & didn't achieve much; others have far more pressing claims
runners.name: Blondina
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on the Flat for Jim Bolger and didn't achieve much; new trainer enjoyed a productive December but others have far more pressing claims.

13:05.race_name: Livescore Bet Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Patchy profile but has shown promise over fences & could improve for November reappearance
runners.name: Ozzy Cosmo
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who has a patchy profile but is on a handy mark on his third of five over fences at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in February and could improve for his reappearance in November (hurdles); not ruled out.

runners.breeder: E A R L Equi-Michel 6 & T Leboucher
runners.comment: Took a step forward over hurdles recently and the switch to fences may be a good move
runners.name: Lord De Vinci
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who took a step forward when fourth of eight over hurdles at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) recently, which was his reappearance and second handicap start; also displayed ability in points and the switch to fences may be a good move; he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Ran well for a long way before fading over 2m7f here last time; could have a big say
runners.name: Marty Mcfly
runners.spotlight: Hasn't kicked on since winning on chase debut at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) in June but ran well for a long way here (2m7f, soft) last month before fading into fourth; could have a big say now back down in trip.

stable_tour.quote: We were really disappointed with him at Ayr the other day and maybe it was the desperate ground. We haven't had him that long and are just finding out about him. He'll make a nice novice chaser next season. 22-01-25

runners.comment: Going nicely when falling 5 out here on chase debut; possible player granted a clear round
runners.name: Fiveafterfour
runners.spotlight: Fell five out on chase debut here (2m7f, soft) last month which came on the back of a 604-day absence; however, she was going nicely at the time and this point and handicap hurdle winner retains potential in this sphere; could be a major player granted a clear round.

runners.comment: On a reduced mark but 0-11 over hurdles and needs to better his recent performances
runners.name: Cage Rattler

quotes.race: Goresbridge Handicap
quotes.quote: Cage Rattler found the trip a bit short for him at the Curragh last day but we were more confident today. He is still green and he will improve again. He handles a dig in the ground - John Kinsella, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Sole win (from 28 attempts) came on the Flat in May 2024; on a handy mark on his best hurdle form but 0-11 in this sphere and he needs to better his recent performances if he's to make a winning chase debut.

runners.comment: The drop back in trip and first-time cheekpieces could help on his second chase start
runners.name: Didntgotwenty
runners.spotlight: Former pointer who showed signs of promise over hurdles, albeit went 0-7 in that sphere; faded into fifth on last month's chase debut at Ayr (3m, heavy) but attracted market support and the drops back in trip and first-time cheekpieces could help today; not discounted.

runners.comment: 0-10 over hurdles and didn't achieve much, but new trainer enjoyed a fine December
runners.name: Parish Star
runners.spotlight: Ex-Nigel Hawke mare; didn't achieve much over hurdles and returns from an absence for this chase/stable debut, but Adam Nicol enjoyed a fine December and has done well with similar stable-switchers previously; wears a first-time tongue-tie and she's not a forlorn hope.

13:40.race_name: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Hogmaneigh Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Unexposed over hurdles; has potential off this mark in view of his abundant Flat ability
runners.name: Wise Eagle

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Wise Eagle broke on terms but they went so quick that I just left him to it. He easily got into it in the back straight and won with plenty in hand. He has plenty of ability but they went so quick they set it up for him - Billy Garritty, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Very talented Flat stayer who is 2-4 over hurdles, the wins coming in late 2024 (1m7f/2m3f, good/good to soft; including here); didn't run badly on AW three weeks ago following a break; has potential off this hurdle mark in view of his Flat ability and has an excellent record here in that code.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Des Marais
runners.comment: Won first two handicaps and runner-up at Aintree next time; could have a big part to play
runners.name: Moonbow
runners.owner: J Fyffe And Mrs W Duffus

quotes.race: Lord Mansfield Memorial Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was hoping Moonbow would run tomorrow again as it's my local track, but Brian [Hughes,, jockey] said let's just look after him and go for a proper race with him - Jimmy Fyffe, owner, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Made it 3-5 over hurdles, and 2-2 in handicaps, when winning at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in September; another big run when second off this mark behind a progressive winner at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) in October and he could have a big part to play.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely young horse who came out of his debut run really well. He was second in a Sedgefield bumper and he's improved for it. He's one for hurdles and has schooled brilliantly, so I think that's where we'll go. He's got a great attitude and we're very happy with him. 11-12-24

runners.comment: Three wins from his last five starts; clearly on the up and he's entitled to respect
runners.name: Serious Chat

quotes.race: Scan Your tote Bet With Raceday-Ready Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Serious Chat still has a bit to learn about his jumping but he's a nice horse with a nice pedigree. He's going to get three miles and this was a good opportunity - Donald McCain, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressive 7yo who made it three wins from his last five starts when returning to form to score at Doncaster (2m3f, soft) in November; the other wins were on good ground; clearly on the up and he's entitled to respect.

stable_tour.quote: He won an average race nicely at Stratford and then they went a bit hard in front at Bangor the other day. He gets three miles well and he'll stay in handicap hurdles. He's a likeable horse who knows how to win. 30-10-25

runners.comment: Won this last year and is on a handy mark but didn't shine on his two runs in autumn
runners.name: Bold Light

quotes.race: LiveScore Bet Best Odds Daily Hogmaneigh Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bold Light was sold for £50,000 three years ago, but when he was taken home the owner found out he had a hole in his leg, so took him back to the sales. I then bought him for £1,000 and it turned out to be quite a bad injury, the vet told me it was better to put him out of his misery. We put him out in Ruth Jardine's [sister of trainer Iain] field for three years, and it's done the world for him. He's been fantastic ever since, we couldn't complain at all. After he finished third at Haydock we were scratching our heads and wondering where to go, we came here and the next plan will be the Scottish County Hurdle here on February 1. We think we'll stick to hurdles because we want to look after him  - James Scott, owner.

runners.spotlight: 9yo who is lightly raced for his age and won this last year (soft); also won at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) in March and is now just 1lb higher; however, soundly beaten on both outings in autumn and has to raise his game.

runners.comment: C&D maiden winner in December 2024; mixed fortunes since but retains potential
runners.name: Smokeringinthedark
runners.spotlight: Won on rules debut over C&D (good to soft) in December 2024; mixed fortunes since but he was second on his handicap debut at Hexham (2m, good to soft) in May and soft ground may not have suited at Wetherby (2m5f) in November when below par; retains potential and could be a contender.

runners.comment: Won 1m7f novice hurdle last time and could have more to offer for top yard back up in trip
runners.name: Fasol
runners.owner: P J Vogt And Bryan Drew

quotes.race: Download The BetMGM App Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was about time Fasol got his head in front and it was a last-minute decision to enter him as I thought if the ground was too quick to run the filly then I needed something in it was a good race. Fredie Keighley was due to ride him, but I thought let's see if a girl gets on with him as he gets on well with the girls at home - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: DragonBet - Oncourse And Online Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Fasol choked at Windsor last time so we had his wind done and he liked the better ground here. He'll have plenty of options during the spring - Paul Nicholls, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Ran well in defeat in hotter handicaps than this last year (2m/1m7f) and he won a novice hurdle under Olive Nicholls at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in November last time; stayed well on the Flat in France and runner-up in 2m5f maiden hurdle in May 2024, and he could have more to offer for his top trainer now back up in trip; firmly in calculations.

stable_tour.quote: Somewhat frustrating and I admit he's becoming quite expensive to follow. Breathing problems came to the fore last season, so he had surgery in January and showed the benefit on his return when finally getting off the mark in a Taunton maiden hurdle. He did well for a summer break and clearly needed the run when only fifth at Chepstow last month. Harry Cobden came back and said we need to go right-handed and possibly go up in trip, but we stuck to two miles at Ascot on Saturday where I agree he looked like he needed further, so that's what we'll do next time. He's a novice until December 1 so we'll look for a soft little race somewhere. Not the easiest of rides as he doesn't do a lot in front. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Running respectably in handicaps but without threatening the winner; needs something extra
runners.name: Bel Amigo

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Team Spirit, Jacques Detre & Patrice Detre
Ecurie Team Spirit, Patrice Detre & Jacques Detre

quotes.race: Pauline Phizacklea Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was obviously his race to lose. Bel Amigo was very impressive when he won a claiming chase in France and was very disappointing in his first two starts for us but it was obviously his wind. That's two runs in 14 days so we'll let him catch his breath and we may find something for him at Perth - Nick Alexander, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won three novice hurdles from the front at Carlisle (2m1f/2m3f, good to soft/good) last spring; respectable efforts in handicaps on his last three starts but hasn't threatened the winner and he needs something extra.

runners.comment: 2 wins in the autumn; below par last month but today's return to better ground could help
runners.name: Heart Above
runners.spotlight: Course winner (1m7f, good to soft) who posted two wins at Kelso (2m2f/2m5f, good/good to soft) in the autumn; this is a hotter than he's used to and we was well beaten at Kelso last month, but today's return to better ground could help and he's not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: 2-2 here (bumper/maiden hurdle); could improve further now upped in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Chanonry Point
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner who made it 2-2 at Musselburgh when making all here in November on second hurdle start (1m7f, good to soft); not obviously well treated off her opening mark but this unexposed, 3m point winner could continue to improve now upped in trip on handicap debut.

14:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Auld Reekie Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 11yo who hasn't threatened this term but he's dropped to a very dangerous mark
runners.name: Tommys Oscar

quotes.race: Scotty Brand Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's quite an occasion, beating all these top horses from the south and Ireland. It was a great performance. My wife made me drive 725 miles because Tommy's Oscar just doesn't settle if we stop overnight. Last time at Doncaster he jumped to the right too much but we knew he would go well because he's fresh again. Everywhere we go he has 12st but he carries it very well, it's amazing how he does because he's a light-framed horse - Ian Hamilton, owner.

quotes.race: NSPCC School Service Simply Ned Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar did it so easy with 12st on his back. It was a good performance. Sean said he took a blow down the back, then came back on the bridle. He said he was still tightening the bridle just before the last and then he was idling a bit in front. I don't know where the hell we're going to run him. He'd won only two races over fences before today so we thought he could go in a graduation chase at Carlisle, but that's stopped that now. He's not a Cheltenham horse. He doesn't like the undulations. But beggars can't be choosers and we might just have to go there. We can't find anywhere else at the moment. He wants something in a month's time - Ian Hamilton, owner.

quotes.race: MND Association Race For Research Lightning Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was just the job. Tommy's Oscar wants better ground and a flat track. He'll go to Aintree, I suppose. He's not a Cheltenham horse, it's too undulating for him. We'd like to find another race for him but Ann and I are getting on a bit and we cannot travel too far. Ian Hamilton, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: From The Horses Mouth Podcast Arkle Challenge Trophy Trial Novices' Chase (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar has done nothing wrong. it got a bit tight turning in but that's racing and he's used to it. He settled a lot better than when he ran in the Champion Hurdle. He ran a blinder. He prefers a flat track but he came down the hill okay - Danny McMenamin, rider.  He boiled over. We've got the diesel money for the way home. Danny said he needed the run again. We'll come back for the Arkle. He's entered in the Fighting Fifth and he could go there, it's just down the road for us - Ian Hamilton.

quotes.race: Book Your Christmas Party Now Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went fast and didn't hang about. Tommy's Oscar was badly in need of a run and will come on a ton. He jumped like a buck and straight as a die, so he's a super jumper. We only schooled him once but he's run in point-to-points in the past. We'll look at the valuable graduation race here next month and if he goes and wins that we'll probably stop over fences. A lot of people say you shouldn't go back to hurdles [once you go chasing] but I'm pleased we've got him and he's a fair horse - Ian Hamilton, owner.

quotes.race: 'The New One' Unibet Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Champion Hurdle Trial Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar is a lovely horse who tries his best. He's very straightforward and does everything you ask and if we're going to have a go at Cheltenham, I suppose this is the year to do it, while the horses are well - Ann Hamilton, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar did well off topweight after going up 9lb from the last day. I don't need to sing the praises of the trainer anymore - she's fantastic - Brian Hughes, jockey.

quotes.race: Betfair Pays Tribute To Andy Stewart Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tommy's Oscar was good today. He didn't get the trip at Carlisle on heavy ground. It was different today on an easier track over two mile three on better ground. He's a chaser but the other one in the next [Pay The Piper] is similarly handicapped, so where do you go? We will chase him but we always thought there was a decent hurdle in him first - Ian Hamilton, owner.

runners.spotlight: 11yo who won here twice over hurdles and is on a very dangerous mark on last season's best chase form; hasn't threatened this term but this is less competitive than Kelso last time, when he was fifth; not written off.

stable_tour.quote: He just didn't run his race last time at Kelso, which was his first time out this season, but he's well. There's just been little bits of setbacks, but he's on the way back and the plan is to go Kelso on December 8. It's a new two-mile open handicap at the track and we like to try to stay as local as possible with him, but a lot of the high-rated handicaps he could run in are further south. He's on track and we're happy with him. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Won two handicaps last winter, including C&D; in good hands to continue to progress
runners.name: The Kalooki Kid

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish Champion Chase (For The Bowes-Lyon Trophy) Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Kalooki Kid is a good traveller, good jumper and that was a good display on just his third chase. He's doing well for a young horse and my owners are local from Kirkcaldy so they are over the moon. I don't know what the handicapper will do, but I think he's got Aintree written all over him. There's a two-and-a-half-mile handicap that might suit him, and looking towards next year, something like the Paddy Power at Cheltenham might suit - Nicky Richards, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Kalooki Kid jumped from fence to fence and travelled very well. We were up at the front end and stayed out of the carnage - Danny McMenamin, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Won two handicaps in a row last winter, including C&D (good to soft), and reappeared with close fourth of four in Listed intermediate chase at Carlisle (2m4f, good to soft) when up against it at the weights; this second-season chaser is in good hands to continue to progress; key player.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in two bumpers last season and then I shouldn't have taken him to Perth as the ground was wrong and it was getting late in the season. His schooling has gone well and I hope there's a good bit of fun to be had with him. 25-10-23

runners.comment: Inconsistent last term but won easily over C&D in February & has good reappearance record
runners.name: Insurrection

quotes.race: Betway Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've won this with some nice horses and Insurrection looked really good. We've always thought a lot of him. He had a breathing op and we wanted to see him go and do that today. He bowled along in front and sprinted from the last. We could go down a similar route to Tahmuras and end up in what was the Tolworth. He's a talented horse - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last season and below par on last two outings; however, he produced a career-best performance when winning easily over C&D (good to soft) in February and on that evidence he shouldn't be stopped by today's 5lb higher mark; has a good reappearance record and he's high on the list.

stable_tour.quote: There were more lows than highs in his first season as a novice chaser. Quite a nasty cut to a hind leg in November, sustained at Wincanton, put him on the sidelines for a month, and then he disappointed us at Doncaster at a time when a lot of ours were below-par. But we had him right when he got off the mark in good style at Musselburgh, seeming suited by a flat track. I can't help feeling 140 is a high enough mark for what he has achieved so far, but the aim will be to win a handicap chase somewhere. He's still a few weeks off a run. 04-11-25

He had a bit of a hit-and-miss season. He ran a nice race on his chasing debut at Chepstow, had a couple of disappointing runs and then got clobbered by the handicapper after bolting up at Musselburgh. He's probably held by the handicapper at the moment, so it might be tough for him for a while, but I'm sure he can be competitive again if he comes down a few pounds. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Runner-up on both chase starts and latest form at Ascot has been franked by the winner
runners.name: Jet To Vegas

quotes.race: bet365 Premier Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jet To Vegas is lovely. I knew the trip was right for him. He normally has to go right handed but it was worthwhile taking a chance here. As he got tired he jumped straight, when he was fresh he jumped right handed. He'll go to Aintree - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won Grade 2 novice hurdle at Kelso (2m2f, good to soft) in March and runner-up in three-runner beginners' chases on first two starts over fences (2m4f/2m5f, soft/good), most recently at Ascot behind Thomas Mor who has since finished second in a Grade 1; could be on a handy mark.

stable_tour.quote: He was second at Perth last week, where he bumped into a nice horse. He was a little bit novicey at times, but he's a very good horse who stays well. He might stay a bit further than two and a half miles and he's got plenty of ability. He's a real fun horse to be novice chasing with this season. Graded races might suit. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Pulled up at Cheltenham last time but won in good style at Perth in April; not written off
runners.name: Inox Allen
runners.spotlight: Lacked fluency and pulled up at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) in October; something to prove after that but he won in good style at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in April on his second chase run and it's too soon to write him off.

stable_tour.quote: The handicapper hasn't missed him and Cheltenham last week was too big an ask. Since he's had the blinkers on, he's jumped much straighter. We'll look at getting him back on track in the north. 29-10-25

runners.breeder: Mrs J A Niven & Mrs D M Ewart
runners.comment: Showed spark with Kelso win in September but three lesser performances have followed
runners.name: Malystic
runners.owner: Clova Syndicate And P D Niven

prev_owners.owner: Clova Syndicate And Mrs J A Niven

quotes.race: Scotty Brand Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I couldn't explain Cheltenham. Malystic travelled well and he just never picked up, it may have been the ground. Apart from that he's been grand and that's the third big handicap he's won this season. That will be it for this season - Peter Niven, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance, particularly with the way Malystic travelled - he was absolutely swinging turning in. He basically missed last season after picking up a terrible infection, so he has low mileage. He's a proper horse, but things haven't gone his way. The only conditions race I was considering was the Game Spirit but it might come a bit quick and then there's the Red Rum at Aintree. I'd love to have a go at the Celebration Chase at the end of the season, but we'll see - Peter Niven, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Castleford Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Malystic had a hiccup at Cheltenham and he scoped badly afterwards but we got him cleared out and he was in great form. He'd run well first time and this was the right race for him. I hope he's a nice horse - Peter Niven, trainer.

quotes.race: Vertem Investing For The Future Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race (All-Weather)
quotes.quote: Malystic is a nephew of [handicap and Graded winning hurdler] Clever Cookie and is the most like him we've had. He wouldn't have his turn of foot but he's a lovely horse. We'll finish him now or maybe go to Aintree and then he'll go jumping next season - Peter Niven, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 12yo who showed he retains spark when winning at Kelso (2m1f, good) in September and he's now 1lb lower; however, he hasn't been at the top of his game on his three runs since (fences/hurdles); wears a first-time visor.

runners.comment: The return to better ground could but others are more compelling in view of recent form
runners.name: Bleu Denfer
runners.spotlight: Won at Carlisle (2m4f, good) in April on final run for Stuart Crawford and the return to better ground could help on his third run for Donald McCain; however, others are more compelling in view of his last two efforts.

stable_tour.quote: Another one who's new to us, I ran against him quite a lot last season and liked him. I kept talking to Stuart Crawford and we ended up buying him at the sales. He's a big, fine horse who'll be competing in nice middle-distance to staying handicap chases. He's entered in the Sefton, but it might come a bit quick. He's a proper Saturday handicap chaser. 30-10-25

runners.comment: Well treated on past exploits but all his 2025 form puts him down the pecking order today
runners.name: Rexem

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rexem is a lovely horse I like a lot. It's taken us a couple of runs to figure him out but he's a stayer who can quicken off a good gallop. He's sharp and always there when you need him, jumps great. He's done everything we've asked him to do so I'm excited to see how he progresses because he's done everything at his ease. He won a point-to-point on nice ground so I'd imagine he will prefer nice ground as opposed to softer ground than today - Ben Harvey, rider.

quotes.race: Magners Irish Cider Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rexem had a good opportunity here, the only real fear was it maybe coming too soon after Galway, but he did it nicely. The step up in trip was no problem - Simon Torrens, rider.

runners.spotlight: Won off 11lb higher over fences at Ludlow (2m4f, good) in October 2023; he's travelled from Ireland and won a claiming hurdle two starts ago, but all of his form in 2025 puts him down the pecking order today.

stable_tour.quote: We could find nothing wrong with him after he disappointed at Cheltenham last month. He did get more wound up travelling over than any of our horses at that meeting, though, and boiled up a little pre-race. We'll probably go back to Britain again, this time to a lesser race, and see if he behaves himself well enough to warrant travelling another time for a step up in class. He's a good horse who we thought would win last time. I think he has a big engine. 21-11-22

runners.breeder: Scea Haras Des Evees & Mr Daniel Cherdo
runners.comment: No match for the first two when third at Newcastle but the form has had a major boost
runners.name: Breizh River

quotes.race: Ray & Anita Green Chasing 500 Winners Handicap Chase (Registered As The Simply Ned) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Breizh River is a cracking horse. He's been very lightly raced and we're just going to target him at certain races throughout the season. He won't take a lot of racing because he's only six and is quite backward in his mind, but he's obviously very tough.
