He'll have a break now and we'll aim him at the Southam Handicap Chase over two and a half miles at Cheltenham's November meeting. That was always the plan and we know he wants further - Paul Robson, trainer.

runners.spotlight: No match for the first two when third at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in November on his second stable start but that front pair have both given the form a major boost subsequently; 2lb lower today and not discounted.

14:51.race_name: Livescore Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Series Qualifier)

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Cap Orne
runners.comment: Possible improver now up in trip; one of two handicap newcomers for yard
runners.name: Kool Raoul
runners.spotlight: Course bumper runner-up (good to soft) who has finished placed on all three hurdle runs (2m/2m4f); his stable's horses often improve when sent up in trip and he could be a contender; one of two handicap newcomers for yard.

runners.comment: Yet to pose a serious threat in a handicap but unexposed at this sort of trip
runners.name: Jena Doudairies
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (soft) who won a maiden hurdle at Chepstow (2m3f, good) in March; has contested four handicaps subsequently without being able to pose a serious threat but she was reportedly unsuited by the good to soft, soft in places ground when upped to 2m7f at Chepstow last month and she remains one to be interesting in for her top yard at this sort of trip.

stable_tour.quote: After a couple of disappointing runs early on she took advantage of an easier task when getting off the mark over hurdles at Chepstow in March. But she still ran green that day, putting in some awkward leaps on the way round. Her final run, when not disgraced in a better event at Cheltenham, suggests she's up to winning a mares' handicap and the valuable Richard Barber Memorial at Wincanton looks absolutely ideal. 04-11-25

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late John Harrington
runners.comment: Promising third on stable debut at Kelso in November but a lesser run followed at Haydock
runners.name: Wolfspear

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We knew Woldspear was fit and well but he'd had so long [493 days] off the track and some of these horses take time to get going again. He ran well and was full of running at the end. I was pleased so hopefully he can come on for it and win more races - Oliver Boyden, rider.

runners.spotlight: 10yo whose last win was in January 2024; kept on for third on yard debut at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) in November and this trip may be within range, but has to bounce back from a lesser run at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft).

stable_tour.quote: He won very well on his debut at Huntingdon. The form has worked out well and the runner-up, First Street, has won twice over hurdles. He'll start off in a maiden hurdle in two or three weeks. 21-10-21

runners.comment: Runner-up in 2m/2m5f novice hurdles; bred to be suited by the longer trip on h'cap debut
runners.name: Biglesisback
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in mares' novice hurdles on last two outings (2m/2m5f, good to soft/soft); she's closely related to Pertemps Final winner Doddiethegreat so is open to improvement now up in trip; one of two handicap newcomers for the yard; on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Easily made all at Newcastle last month and an 11lb rise might not stop her
runners.name: Snowrocco

quotes.race: Position Payout At bet365 Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Snowrocco was very disappointing last time but it was her first run of the season and she's quite a deep, stuffy mare who carries a bit of condition and she may have got a bit lost on that type of [soft] ground. We thought we'd bounce her out and she showed what she's capable of doing. It was always the plan to go chasing but we thought we'd try and nick one over hurdles first - Adam Nicol, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing. Snowrocco bombed out last time and we couldn't work out what had happened. It's beautiful ground out there, just on the easy side of good, and I think that suited her and she's done it nicely. I was keen to dictate the race - I didn't go very quick as I knew she has a bit of speed and I was able to use that at the end. I know she's quick over hurdles but she jumps a fence really well - Ryan Mania, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Inconsistent across light career but she left November's reappearance run miles behind to easily make all at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) last month; an 11lb rise might not stop her if she can confirm that latest promise.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; soft ground might not have suited last time; yard won this last year
runners.name: Rememberthename
runners.spotlight: Placed in two maiden hurdles in Ireland (2m1f/2m, good) and also showed promise when third on handicap/stable debut at Kelso (2m6f, good) in October; soft ground may not have suited there last month and it will be no surprise if he bounces back with a good run for last year's winning yard.

runners.comment: Consistent veteran; place possibilities but he's won only one of his last 22 starts
runners.name: Artic Mann
runners.spotlight: Consistent veteran who is versatile ground-wise and again ran a sound race when 4l third of seven over C&D last month; place possibilities but he's won only one of his last 22 starts.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice horse. I think we'll stay over hurdles with him as he's found a niche where he can be competitive. He'll go to Haydock in the first week of December for a 0-110 conditionals' race over 3m and hopefully we can put on Dominic Hislop, who can claim 10lb. 21-11-24

runners.comment: Some good form over hurdles in the autumn; now 0-19 under rules but not ruled out each-way
runners.name: Wearelongterm
runners.owner: Dennis J Coppola & Mrs Dianne Sayer
runners.spotlight: Twice went close over fences at Kelso in the autumn (2m7f, good/good to soft) then didn't jump well when soundly beaten here (2m7f, soft); now 0-19 under rules but not ruled out each-way now back over hurdles.

15:25.race_name: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Huntingdon and this unexposed 6yo is open to further improvement
runners.name: Mr Mcloughlan
runners.spotlight: Won two novice hurdles in a row (2m, good to soft/good) before respectable run in Cheltenham Grade 2 (2m, good to soft) in October, and back on the scoresheet on handicap debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) in November; open to further improvement and he's respected up 5lb.

runners.comment: His losing run continues but he's on a reduced mark and has an appealing record here
runners.name: Afadil

quotes.race: bet365 Scottish County Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Afadil enjoyed the ground and was given a great ride by Freddie (Gingell). He'll have an entry in the County Hurdle but perhaps the conditional jockeys' race at Aintree might be the race for him - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Remus Uomo Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We thought Afadil would win, we thought he was still quite nicely handicapped. He ran very well at Ascot, where we beat him with a 50-1 shot. He ran a bit free in front there so we dropped him in a bit today. He got a pound for Ascot, which I thought was okay, and he had a four-year-old's allowance. Whether he'll run again I don't know. The only possibility is the Swinton Hurdle. He's a tank of a horse and if he's in good form and we were happy, we could well look at it - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Invest Southwest Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Afadil will love the soft ground so I'd expect he'd go to Haydock and we'll try to keep them apart. He and Rare Middleton will get entries in the Triumph - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 7yo who has been beaten on his last 14 starts going back to February 2024; however, he's on a reduced mark and took a step back in the right direction when third at Sandown last month; the return to Musselburgh could trigger a return to winning ways, with his form figures here reading 1312.

stable_tour.quote: He was frustrating last season when his form was in and out. He looked like he was coming to win the Imperial Cup in the spring when just run out of it up the hill; unfortunately the ground at Sandown that day was softer than we thought it was. Always needs a run to bring him on and after his reappearance at Ascot on Saturday we'll think about giving chasing a go. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Won by nearly 5l on handicap debut over C&D and a 7lb rise may not stop him today
runners.name: City Of Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-5 over hurdles when beating Star Of Guiting by nearly 5l to win on his handicap debut over C&D (good to soft) in November; a 7lb rise might not stop this unexposed and progressive 6yo.

runners.comment: Running well in defeat since tackling handicaps and he holds each-way claims
runners.name: Evaluation

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Stayers Handicap
quotes.quote: It depends what mark Evaluation ends up with but there's a staying race at the Sunday Series at Musselburgh in two weeks and as long as he's okay from a handicapping point of view he'll go there - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat in his prime; he's raced seven times over hurdles and running well in defeat since tackling handicaps; each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very good second in the Northumberland Plate this year and we'll get a move on with hurdling now. He's very exciting. 30-10-24

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner who returns from a break on a competitive mark on stable debut
runners.name: Bashful
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner for Iain Jardine, the latest in February; below par in June on final outing for that yard but the subsequent break and change of scenery may have helped and he's on a competitive mark; not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's on a break but is due back in any time. He's done very well for us and is a decent horse when you get him in the right form. He's won at Kelso and Musselburgh and will probably start with races at those tracks in the next couple of months. He can be competitive in northern races. 10-09-25

runners.comment: Encouraging start to hurdling career; improvement needed on h'cap debut but it's possible
runners.name: Cueros

prev_owners.owner: Javier Maldonado Trinchant & Mauricio Delcher Sanchez

runners.spotlight: Prolific on the Flat in Jersey and he won on his hurdle/stable debut at Newcastle (2m1f, good) in October; runner-up on next two starts (2m, soft), albeit no match for the winner; improvement needed on handicap debut but that's possible now back on better ground; Lambourn trainer won this last year.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when second at Wetherby last weekend. I was worried about the ground when it started raining but we let him take his chance and I was very pleased with his run. The winner looks a decent horse and our lad will improve in fast-run handicaps on spring ground. We probably won't go wild through the winter. I think he'll be a fun horse. 19-11-25

runners.comment: Won in first-time cheekpieces at Wetherby and the runner-up has franked the form
runners.name: Chase A Fortune
runners.spotlight: In front when falling two out over fences at Kelso (2m1f, good) in October and his good form has continued back hurdling, making all in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at Wetherby (2m, soft) last time, when clear with one who has since gone one better; can make another bold bid up 5lb.

runners.comment: Well handicapped on last season's form but not at the top of his game this term
runners.name: Admiralty House

prev_owners.owner: N Farrell, C Hodgson & A King

quotes.race: bet@racingtv.com Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Admiralty House is not easy, we tried to hold him up but it was never happening. At least he got over the first few hurdles at the rear and then once he got to the front he did settle. I was surprised by how much he was able to find from the second last having pulled so hard. He's a good horse, he's just difficult. His first two or three runs he was okay but for whatever reason he's become stronger and stronger. He's not nearly this bad at home. This might make a man of him, but it's going to take some time. This horse isn't the sort to be going to Cheltenham next, he's probably a slightly better horse right-handed, so we'll just have to mind him a bit and wait for the brain to click into gear - Alan King, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on last season's form for Alan King and his new trainer's horses are running well; however, he hasn't been at the top of his game on either start for this yard and could do with settling better.

stable_tour.quote: He was a winning hurdler two seasons ago and has been off with a leg injury, but he's been back in work for some time and made a very promising return when second at Wincanton last week. 25-10-24

He missed last season with a leg injury but he'd shown decent form over hurdles the previous campaign. He's been back in work for some time and made an encouraging return when second at Wincanton last month. 07-11-24

runners.comment: Runner-up over C&D on second stable start and could improve for that outing
runners.name: Star Of Guiting
runners.spotlight: Two junior hurdle wins for the Twiston-Davies yard last season; early unseat on stable debut in October following a break and beaten about 5l by City Of Diamonds over C&D (good to soft) last time; he could improve for that latest outing and be in the mix; trainer won this two years ago.

runners.comment: May have needed his latest outing and he was runner-up in this race 12 months ago
runners.name: Ravenscraig Castle
runners.owner: A Sinclair, I Jardine & V Renwick
runners.spotlight: He finished held in fifth over C&D (good to soft) in November but that was his first run since August and he may have needed it; runner-up in this race 12 months ago and might not be far away.

stable_tour.quote: He's got loads of ability but is a tricky customer. He reached a pretty high level on the Flat and he's enjoying hurdles. He won in decisive fashion at Perth in July and then didn't run too badly back there last time. He might be best running fresh, though. We might consider chasing and somewhere like Musselburgh, where the fences are a bit smaller, could suit him. 10-09-25

13:20.race_name: Read Meg Nicholl's Blog At betmgm.co.uk Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Three solid efforts over 7f; solid form claims if seeing out the longer trip (not assured)
runners.name: Areti
runners.spotlight: Promise in two runs at Newmarket before finding only a well-bred newcomer too strong at Kempton three weeks ago (7f); not certain to stay this far on pedigree but she holds solid form claims.

runners.comment: Dam a useful 7f AW winner (RPR 99); yard had a well-backed newcomer win here recently
runners.name: Arrivera
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 7f AW winner (including 2yo; RPR 99); stable sent out an impressive winning newcomer here two weeks ago (well backed) so she needs a market check.

runners.comment: 550,000euros yearling; dam a useful and well-related middle-distance winner; check market
runners.name: Bint Kilfrush
runners.spotlight: 550,000euros yearling; first foal of a middle-distance winner (RPR 91), herself from the family of 1m4f Group 1 winners Schiaperelli and Samum; no surprise were she to play a part on debut.

stable_tour.quote: This is the most expensive horse we've ever been sent - she cost ?550,000, which smashes our previous record by about double. She's a beautiful Sea The Stars filly. She'd be a middle-distance type for three and four and as you can probably tell from the price tag she's very good looking and takes the eye. We haven't pressed any buttons yet, although we're not too far from doing so. 09-07-25

runners.comment: Better effort when third at Kempton (7f) after six months off; this demands even more
runners.name: Charming Doll
runners.spotlight: Returned from six months off to finish third of nine at Kempton three weeks ago (7f); open to further progress but it is essential.

runners.comment: 50-1 and well beaten in two runs in late 2025; minor handicaps beckon.
runners.name: Cospicua
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and well beaten in two runs in late 2025; minor handicaps beckon.

runners.comment: Promising 2nd at Kempton (1m) 80 days ago; open to improvement; solid claims
runners.name: Shebara
runners.spotlight: Smart pedigree and although she was no match for the winner on her Kempton debut 80 days ago (1m), she pulled clear of the third; that race yet to throw up a winner but her stable's newcomers tend to improve for a run and she's a leading contender.

runners.comment: 40,000gns yearling; has 2 winning siblings but other newcomers hold stronger paper claims
runners.name: Song Of The Stars
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns yearling; fifth foal;  sister to 11.4f/1m4f winner Phaedra (RPR 73), half-sister to 10.5f-1m4f winner Saracen Star (including AW/Belgium; 57); dam placed 1m4f/13.5f, sister to Group-placed 1m4f winner Travelling Man; other newcomers appear to have more compelling claims.

runners.comment: Sister to Group-placed winner Frankellina (RPR 105); appealing paper claims; likely player
runners.name: Star Obsession
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; sister to winners Frankellina (Group-placed 1m 2yo; RPR 105; won on debut) and Mr Curiosity (11.6f-1m6f; 99); dam 1m-1m4f winner (including 2yo/Listed; 108); plenty to like on paper and she's one to take seriously.

13:55.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Good 2nd at Kempton three weeks ago; in the mix with a repeat but more exposed than some
runners.name: Galileo Island
runners.spotlight: His only blip since his debut came when failing to see out 1m here in November; solid second at Kempton three weeks ago; more exposed than some but still likely to give a good account.

runners.comment: Good effort back up to 7f last time; should run his race but vulnerable to improvers
runners.name: Gorey Gold
runners.spotlight: Not far behind Galileo Island at Kempton, confirming his stamina for 7f in the process; highly likely to run his race but might find or two more progressive.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely type. He was very green first time but learned a lot from it and won a good pot at Bath second time out. It was an ambitious target to go to Royal Ascot for the Windsor Castle on his third run - he ran very well but looked a bit light and tired afterwards, so he's had a break since. He's done well for it and is looking great. Hopefully he'll find a nursery in September. 20-08-25

runners.comment: Tough task last time and his earlier win was a good effort; stamina for 7f not assured
runners.name: Generous Rascal
runners.owner: Valmont, C Rosier & Mrs J Rosier
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning at Kempton last October (6f) and faced a tough task trying to concede 12lb to a filly with a BHA mark of 82 last time; slight question mark over his stamina for 7f (neither of his smart full siblings won over the trip but he is a half-brother to 2000 Guineas winner Chaldean (by Frankel)) but open to improvment and he is one to consider.

runners.comment: Led late when winning at Lingfield (7f) four weeks ago; gelded since; unexposed at trip
runners.name: Chale Chalo
runners.spotlight: The winner of two of his seven starts, the latest when finding plenty in a 7f nursery at Lingfield four weeks ago (cheekpieces on for the first time); gelded since; could have more to offer at this trip.

runners.comment: Off the mark for this yard when beating 3 rivals at Newcastle latest; not ruled out up 3lb
runners.name: Luminare

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Tabor, Mrs J Magnier, Mrs Shanahan, Mrs Hyde

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We have no serious targets at the moment but Luminaire's half-sister Raqiya was a good filly for Owen Burrows last year, so she has a nice pedigree and hopefully she can keep improving. We kind of thought she was overpriced. She ran reasonably on her debut when she was green, but the race has worked out well and she showed what we were kind of expecting. I think she can go back up to six furlongs as she's versatile, but she's got enough slick speed for five - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 5f turf win for Ollie Sangster in June; successful at the third attempt for her new stable when beating three rivals at Newcastle 16 days ago (7f); closely matched with Chale Chalo on a line through the runner-up; may yet do better.

runners.comment: Modest 6f form; up in trip and visored for handicap debut; opening mark looks tough
runners.name: Tactical Formation
runners.spotlight: Sent off joint favourite for a York maiden on last summer's debut but ended up a well-beaten fourth (6f, good to firm); no progress in two runs since and he looks on a tough mark for this handicap debut; this 360,000gns 2yo breeze-up purchase now steps up in trip with a visor fitted so improvement wouldn't be a bolt from the blue.

runners.comment: 6f win here on debut; held under penalty twice since; upped in trip for handicap debut
runners.name: Sahara Magic
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f fillies' maiden here on debut last November; struggled under a penalty since but she may prove suited by today's extra furlong now making her handicap debut.

runners.comment: Hasn't progressed from a promising debut; drops in trip in a change of headgear
runners.name: Uniter
runners.spotlight: Yet to build on the promise of his Kempton debut (1m), including when last of five on his nursery debut four weeks ago; dropped 3lb and now tried in new headgear; needs the shorter trip to have a positive effect.

14:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: 3-3 on AW; not fully exposed; sold for 320,000gns since latest run; fascinating contender
runners.name: Ten Pounds

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Ten Pounds has run huge, first time back at six [furlongs]. Trevor thought he had the winner in his sights two down. I think in a normal year horses do stop - it's hard to make the running here. I suspect looking at the Jersey, they're not making up ground quite as much. Some of the jockeys were suggesting it's just a bit loose from watering. He's run huge, very happy with him - Harry Charlton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Capable of smart form on turf, as when a close third in last season's Wokingham, and he took his AW record to 3-3 when readily seeing off five rivals in a Kempton conditions event last October (6f); sold out of Harry Charlton's yard for 320,000gns later that month; still has time to develop into a Pattern-race performer and it will be interesting to see how strong he is in the market after his break.

runners.comment: Smart sprint form (including AW) in 2024; absent since modest C&D run last April
runners.name: Wiltshire

quotes.race: Jenningsbet 200 Shops Nationwide Handicap
quotes.quote: I was very impressed. The race developed in front of us and we picked up the pieces. The gaps got tight but Wiltshire stuck his neck out and he kicked on well. The ground went against him last time as it was a bit quick and he didn't let himself down on it. You've seen the best version of him and he's improving - Cieren Fallon, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Capable of smart sprint form in 2024, including on AW; only seen once in 2025 and that was a modest effort over C&D nine months ago; can go well fresh but perhaps a shade high in the weights on his return.

runners.comment: Down in the weights and capable of smart AW form in his pomp; absent five months
runners.name: Willem Twee

quotes.race: BetUK Golden Rose Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Willem Twee is a lovely horse. It was quite a tactical race, the pace was slow and I elected to stay three deep but to keep cover. I probably delivered him into the race early enough. He's a very nice horse, he's got a future. He gave me a lovely feel as I started to improve into the race round the turn - Oisin Murphy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Has been a smart sprinter on AW in his day but he ended 2024 tamely and took a while to find his feet last year; his Newcastle third last May was a good run but he has been absent since finishing last at Wolverhampton five months ago; dangerous mark if ready to go.

runners.comment: Progressive last year; two solid runs for new yard after a break; each-way claims
runners.name: So Darn Hot

quotes.race: BetMGM AWC 3 Year Old Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't expect So Darn Hot to win like that. He was essentially carrying 12lb more than last time and I wasn't sure Lingfield would suit him. He didn't have any cover, which wasn't ideal, but he's by Too Darn Hot and his progeny love a good fight - Kevin Philippart De Foy, trainer.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: So Darn Hot has definitely sharpened up and was a bit cautious of the ground early on, but he's had no problem with that. He's very game and he felt the other horse come to him and found another gear. There'll be more to come next year. He's done really well over six months. He just wasn't there for his debut at Salisbury, but he's going from strength to strength - Benoit de la Sayette, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Did well last winter and carried the good work onto turf, winning at Windsor last June on his final run for Kevin Philippart De Foy; two good runs in defeat for his new stable this winter; Oisin Murphy booked and he is one to consider.

runners.comment: Easy win at Yarmouth in September but he beat a motley crew & this is much tougher up 6lb
runners.name: Caburn

quotes.race: Boodles Handicap
quotes.quote: We had changed a lot of things and of course you're nervous. It was Caburn's second run for me ? first time gelded, first time in cheekpieces, first time on easy ground. There were quite a lot of changed variables. My fear was whether he'd handle the ground, but I got more optimistic as he moved down to post. He had some really hard races as a two-year-old, and you wouldn't have blamed him if he wasn't up for putting his best foot forward. I did think I had my work cut out. We needed a complete change, and it was nice to see him back to form. He's a horse that doesn't have the straightest of legs and he was moved to me so he could swim every day, which he embraces now and it seems to have helped him a lot. We'll have to see what the handicapper does and whether we go for a big handicap or some smaller Listed races - James Tate, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Super Sprint Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The question mark was dropping back to five furlongs after Caburn won over six on his debut. We were always coming here with the prize-money but, in the first two furlongs, I thought this ain't happening today. To do that on his second start is pretty unreal and the Gimcrack would be an obvious next step. This will be the last time he'll run over five furlongs; onwards and upwards - Jack Jones, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: At home Caburn was showing the right things to be a nice horse but, worryingly, most of the 2yos I've ran so far have ran averagely but I thought he was above them so it was nice to see him put it in on the track. This was a half bit of a stepping stone to the Super Sprint and so far the first leg has gone remarkably well - Jack Jones, trainer, speaking to RTV.

runners.spotlight: Useful 2yo who returned to form to win a five-runner handicap at Yarmouth in emphatic fashion in September (6f, good to soft; cheekpieces on for the first time; second run for James Tate); while that was visually impressive, the form hasn't worked out and a 6lb rise in this considerably stronger race asks a much stiffer question; AW debut.

runners.comment: Better horse on AW now; a repeat of either of his last two AW runs would see him involved
runners.name: Fivethousandtoone

quotes.race: JenningsBet 200 Shops Nationwide Handicap
quotes.quote: We've not had Fivethousandtoone too long, we've been trying to figure him out. Arguably his best form is at Newcastle, held up, and it all worked perfectly for him today. There was a bit of a headwind and he got plenty of cover - David Allan, jockey.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Today it all came together and hopefully it will be the beginning of a decent season for Fivethousandtoone. He was good last time and better today - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap
quotes.quote: Fivethousandtoone has run well without winning. The race worked out well for him today, waiting with him and coming late. That's his level - William Buick, rider.

runners.spotlight: Well suited by AW and his last two runs on Tapeta saw him win a good race at Newcastle in June and finish second in a Racing League handicap at Wolverhampton one month later; absent for 103 days but has the ability to go well off this mark.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very smart juvenile, winning over 6f before finishing second in the Mill Reef Stakes and mid-division over 7f in the Dewhurst Stakes. He had a setback earlier this year but that has been resolved and he is now back in fast work. The plan is to go straight to Royal Ascot for the Commonwealth Cup. He is a very smart horse who looks very together this year and is one I am excited about getting back on the track. 19-05-21

runners.comment: Yet to win a handicap but has some strong form; no obvious reason he won't go well
runners.name: Pocklington

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That went to plan really. Very smooth, very simple A to B. When I gave him a squeeze Pocklington put the race to bed very well. I thought Hollie (Doyle, jockey on runner-up) would make it but I didn't want it to turn into too much of a sprint because he hit a bit of a flat spot the last day. I thought the quicker we get through the gears and striding out, the more chance I've got. He's an exciting horse - Harry Russell, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts, both over 6f at Newcastle; yet to win a handicap but he ran some mighty races in defeat last year, notably at Newcastle (behind Fivethousandtoone) and Doncaster; solid return from a three-month break at Newcastle (7f) 19 days ago; should go well.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and he is handicapped to run well; high on the shortlist
runners.name: We Never Stop

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: We Never Stop didn't have the best of draws but he has such a high cruising speed I was able to get him up there. The key to him is the first half of the race and getting him switched off - Shane Gray, jockey.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything fell into place today really. We Never Stop jumped well, and they went a blistering gallop, so I just sat off the lead a little bit and it worked out really well. I had something to aim at going to the furlong pole, and he had a good look when he got there, but he's done it comfortably in the end - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner; enjoyed the run of the race when winning the big sprint handicap on Good Friday but struggled on turf afterwards; more promise when a close fourth over C&D five weeks ago and handicapped to go well.

runners.comment: Impressed on AW debut here nine weeks ago; up 7lb and drawn wide but unexposed at 6f
runners.name: Lakers

quotes.race: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap
quotes.quote: Lakers did it well and coming [back] on the all-weather has really been a positive for him. At Doncaster he came through a furlong out looking as though he was going to win but he didn't quite finish his race off but he sees this trip out well and he did it nicely - Rowan Scott, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: He hasn't been with this yard long and he relished the return to sprinting when easily seeing off 12 rivals over C&D nine weeks ago (AW debut); up 7lb and drawn widest but foolish to think he isn't capable of better.

runners.comment: Came from poor position to take 2nd at Kempton latest; up 3lb but improving all the while
runners.name: Coul Angel

quotes.race: Turners Parks Group Ltd Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Once Coul Angel got the gap he was always going to get there. He likes this ground we may give him a couple more runs and then put him away as he'll be a nice horse for next year - Mick Appleby, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Progressive sprinter; failed to complete an AW hat-trick when second at Kempton two weeks ago but he flew home from a poor position and it represented another step forward; up 3lb but could still have more in the tank.

runners.comment: Not at best on last two starts but well handicapped on last year's best; lively outsider
runners.name: Purest Time
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on his last two starts but he had some strong handicap form in 2025, notably at Newcastle in August and York in October; on a dangerous mark and a big run could be forthcoming.

runners.comment: Comes here in top form and still on fair mark; can't afford to fluff the start back at 6f
runners.name: Eminency
runners.spotlight: Comes into the race having won three of his last five starts; wouldn't want to miss the break back at 6f but he still has some handicapping scope.

stable_tour.quote: He's always been a laid-back character and I'm really pleased with how he's done over the winter. He had nowhere to go on his comeback at Kempton and hopefully he can move forward from that run and have better luck next time. He wouldn't want it too soft, is versatile at six or seven furlongs and I hope he can keep progressing. 02-05-23

He has only won the once but he has run consistently well in defeat apart from last time at Newmarket where he got a bit behind the pace and that cost him any chance. His penultimate run behind Quinault at York reads well and I'm looking at going back to the July course if conditions are in his favour and it dries out as he is not far off winning again. He may even run in the Stewards' Cup on Saturday. 02-08-23

runners.comment: Not at her best in France last winter; makes stable debut after 328-day absence
runners.name: Rochelle
runners.spotlight: Won twice on AW early in her career before being highly tried; unplaced in three runs in France last winter; plenty to prove on stable debut after a 328-day absence.

15:05.race_name: Win 250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Sold for 2,000gns since last seen; promising debut; betting to guide on stable/h'cap debut
runners.name: Tafah
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut at Bath last summer (5.7f, firm; trained by David Loughnane) but no progress in two subsequent runs; sold for 2,000gns last October and gelded; betting to guide on stable debut.

runners.comment: Easy win on nursery debut but disappointed 11 days later; still has time to do better
runners.name: The Tunguska Event
runners.spotlight: Left his maiden/novice form behind him when running away with a Newcastle nursery last November (6f; blinkered first time); disappointed when odds-on for a selling nursery back at Newcastle 11 days later; still has time to do better.

runners.comment: Low-level form since handicapping; return to 6f can help but others look safer
runners.name: Tickettothestars
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six starts and little to shout about in three nursery efforts; she would have finished closer at Wolverhampton when last seen in September (5f) with a clear run but latest 3lb drop not enough to tempt.

stable_tour.quote: She was bought out of one of the breeze-ups for Middleham Park. We took her to Yarmouth last time and fancied her, but unfortunately she ran up the backside of horses coming back at her. She's rated 65, so that gives us half a chance. 27-08-25

runners.comment: Has run respectably in three nurseries but the change of headgear needs to spark extra
runners.name: Mereside Princess
runners.spotlight: She has run respectably in her three starts in nurseries but without looking ahead of her mark; returning to 6f might help but improvement is required; change of headgear today.

runners.comment: Drops in trip and tried in headgear on his return from 134 days off; not discounted
runners.name: Maynora
runners.spotlight: Modest form in his six starts but prominent in the market on his last two starts when failing to get home over 1m and 7f; returns from 134 days off with blinkers added and back sprinting; not discounted.

runners.comment: Poor form in his three starts but bred to do much better and he's been gelded since latest
runners.name: Dartrey
runners.spotlight: Smart pedigree; sent off Evens favourite for his debut last August (6f, AW) but hung right and proved unsteerable, eventually tailed off; well beaten in two turf runs since (6f and 7f); gelded ahead of his handicap debut and the fact he is still being persevered with by his powerful stable offers hope of much better.

runners.comment: 3rd on three occasions but seemingly exposed and needs to find improvement from somewhere
runners.name: Mademoiselle Belle
runners.spotlight: Limitations seemingly exposed after eight starts; not sure where the requisite improvement is coming from today.

runners.comment: Likely improver back up to 6f and switched to a minor handicap; betting to guide
runners.name: Al Najashi
runners.spotlight: Only modest form in three novice/maiden runs but stepping back up to 6f should suit and he is open to improvement now handicapping at a low level; one to note for market confidence.

runners.comment: Modest form for D O'Meara last summer; had wind op prior to stable/h'cap debut; unexposed
runners.name: Rogue Rebellion
runners.spotlight: Didn't offer much in three runs for David O'Meara last summer, including in a tongue tie on second and third occasion; has undergone wind surgery prior to this stable/handicap debut (same owners); betting useful.

15:44.race_name: Win 250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Good stable debut (6f) and latest effort was over 7f in a higher grade; solid claims
runners.name: Grey Horizon
runners.spotlight: Won a weak Catterick nursery in good style on final run for Richard Fahey (6f, soft); good debut for new yard when second at Newcastle a fortnight ago (6f) and when third of five at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day it was over 7f and in a much higher grade; should be no excuses back down in class.

runners.comment: Tailed off over 9.5f 12 days ago; drops in trip with a point to prove
runners.name: Ar Diddy Dum Dum
runners.spotlight: Good chance on the pick of her form for her former stable but she hasn't fired in three runs for James Owen; drops from 9.5f to 6f this time and comes with risk attached.

runners.comment: Couldn't live up to market billing on nursery debut in October; hood off now down in trip
runners.name: Inclusive
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three maiden/novice runs and it was a similar story on her nursery debut at Yarmouth last October (all runs at 7f); she was sent off favourite for that latest run and this well-related filly may yet have a bigger run in her; hood absent now dropped in trip.

runners.comment: Not easily recommended on racecourse evidence but faces a more realistic challenge today
runners.name: Missile Kode
runners.spotlight: Poor form in three novice/maiden runs in the autumn; looks on a stiff mark on that evidence but he is faced with a more realistic challenge today and better could be forthcoming.

runners.comment: Modest form in 3 quick AW runs this winter; headgear on for h'cap debut; possible improver
runners.name: Petes Diamond
runners.spotlight: Big prices and down the field in three quick runs on Tapeta this winter (5f to 7f); the combination of first-time headgear and switch to a modest handicap could see him step forwards; betting instructive.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 on the up; has to prove she stays 6f but likely she will and may do better yet
runners.name: Rosieisme Darling
runners.spotlight: Improved for the switch to nurseries late last year, finishing second at Wolverhampton before finding plenty to win at Chelmsford (both 5f); has to prove her stamina for this longer trip but on the up and a 3lb rise shouldn't be beyond her.

runners.comment: 9th time lucky when scoring at Chelmsford three weeks ago; up 4lb but should go well again
runners.name: Saeculamation
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the ninth attempt when landing a 6f nursery at Chelmsford three weeks ago; up 4lb and drawn widest but still more appealing than some.

runners.comment: Below par latest (7f, soft); some promise beforehand and Billy Loughnane booked
runners.name: Lady Lucky Vegas
runners.spotlight: Never dangerous over 7f on soft ground when last seen nine weeks ago but there had been flickers of promise beforehand; Billy Loughnane booked and she is edging down the weights; may have a bigger effort in her.

runners.comment: Third behind Saeculamation on last month's nursery debut (6f); may do better yet
runners.name: Magnificent Mel
runners.spotlight: Improved for the switch to a low-grade nursery when finishing third to Saeculamation at Chelmsford three weeks ago; would have finished closer there with a clear run and she remains capable of better.

16:15.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Smart staying form for A O'Brien; missed a year; promising here (2m) latest; trip query
runners.name: Chemistry
runners.owner: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Vinnie Roe Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Obviously it's not really the way you like to get them, in the stewards' room, but unfortunately that's the way it worked out. Chemistry is a big, scopey horse and has just taken a bit of time to fill his frame. Aidan [O'Brien] thought it was a nice race to start him back in. He's a horse that will go as far as you want, he's very genuine. Declan gave him a very positive ride. He felt there's plenty more in there and he'll come on a lot fitness-wise. There is no immediate plan for him, we'll just find a Group race and step him up. We probably won't see the best of him until next year - Chris Armstrong, Ballydoyle representative.

runners.spotlight: Smart form for Aidan O'Brien included a Listed win at 1m6f (awarded race); two heavy defeats for new yard back from a year off but there was much more fire in his performance on AW debut here (about 2m) last month when doing best work late; on the road back but has a trip query back at 1m4f.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux & Skymarc Farm Inc
runners.comment: Latest win over 1m3f here in early 2024; in good form over 2m; interesting back at 1m4f
runners.name: Enemy

prev_owners.owner: Qatar Racing Ltd, Ecurie Des Monceaux & Ecurie Skymarc Farm

quotes.race: BetUK Winter Derby Trial Conditions Stakes
quotes.quote: We were just looking for an opportunity with Enemy and he was in a handicap at Kempton later in the week, but we thought we'd take this chance. It's a severe drop back in trip and he's beaten quite a classy field. Although they didn't go fast, they took each other on from the beginning of the straight and that gave him a chance just to sneak into it behind and finish as strongly as he did. I was mightily impressed with him. He's getting older now, but he hasn't lost any of his ability - Ian Williams, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Charbonnel Et Walker British EBF Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Sire And Dam Restricted Race)
quotes.quote: John was pleased with Enemy at home and said he was ready to start off but might be a little bit babyish. He learnt as the race progressed and it was a lovely result first time out. On paper Law Of Peace set a fair benchmark. He looks as though he could go seven again or up to a mile. He seems to have a nice future and that's a great starting point - Oisin Murphy, rider.

runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back two years to his 1m3f win here, which was the last time he tackled this sort of trip on AW; in good form in 2m handicaps of late, albeit he found little when just behind Chemistry here last month; interesting to see how he copes back at 1m4f.

runners.comment: Out of depth in Listed race latest; 3-3 on AW earlier, including CD; could resume progress
runners.name: Palazzo Blu
runners.spotlight: Out of depth in Listed race here in November but previously 3-3 on AW, the handicap win gained in good style over C&D; presumably disappointed connections last time as cheekpieces go on but he could resume progress.

runners.comment: Two 1m4f wins in 2024; weights turnaround with Palazzo Blu on C&D form in September
runners.name: Assail
runners.spotlight: Won maiden on Tapeta elsewhere; two 1m4f wins in 2024, on turf and Polytrack, and has run some fair races in 2025, including when chasing home Palazzo Blu over C&D in September; has a weights turnaround and might come on for his latest run after a short break so not ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice, progressive horse. He probably won quite a weak race last time out for an Ascot handicap. It doesn't look strong form but he got a 7lb rise, probably correctly, because he won very comfortably. I think he'll stay very well. A mile and a half is the bare minimum for him and he'll get 1m6f and 2m in time - what he's doing at this trip is almost a bonus. He's got a family full of stamina even though he's by No Nay Never. He's straightforward and a horse we like. I'd like to think we can get more out of him. 04-09-24

runners.comment: Six Tapeta wins, the latest over 1m4f/1m3f here; promising at Newcastle latest; respected
runners.name: Humble Spark
runners.spotlight: Six Tapeta wins, the most recent over 1m4f and 1m3f here last spring; just intermittent good runs since but he's just 1lb higher than the latest win and there were promising signs at Newcastle (1m2f) recently; respected.

stable_tour.quote: What a year he's had. He was coming in the Stayers' Handicap on his last run but we were hoping to get into the 1m2f race as that's his trip, but you'd say he was a player at the 2m race. His ability to switch off is impressive, especially on the all-weather. We're hoping to get him into the Northumberland Plate, so we'll probably go back to Newcastle on Saturday. He'll probably have to go up to get into it, and if not we'll get in the Vase on the same day. He's another with stall issues but we're getting around them. He's not showing signs of diminishing. He's interesting, he's not straightforward but I don't think good horses are. We've had a lot of fun with him. He's got a good pedigree and he's getting there. 07-05-25

runners.comment: 2-4 for this yard, over 1m6f here and 1m4f at Kempton; luckless latest; possibilities
runners.name: Another Run

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Another Run really fills the eye. He's a lovely, big horse who's strengthened over the winter and I was quite taken with how he picked up and put it to bed. He's a good mover and I can't see why he won't be effective on grass, probably on nice summer ground - Ross Coakley, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing

runners.spotlight: Record of 2-4 for yard on AW, over 1m6f here and when coming with a wet sail at Kempton (1m4f) in October; had a luckless run when third of 12 in this higher grade there (2m) last month and has some handicapping scope.

runners.comment: Last won in July 2024 but close 2nd over C&D in May and weighted to win again
runners.name: Robusto
runners.spotlight: Often leads; last won in July 2024 but he's weighted to win again and went close over C&D in May; below best in two starts since returning from a break but the latest was better (without regular cheekpieces; blinkers now refitted) and there could be another step forward today.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Kempton last July and has had four seconds since then. He'll be back out in a couple of weeks - he banged a joint, so we had to wait a bit for him. 02-07-25

runners.comment: Two AW wins in 2024; mixed results in 2025 and well below best on turf in the autumn
runners.name: Umbria
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins in 2024, at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f) and Kempton (1m3f; made all), but mixed results since her reappearance in 2025 and well below best on turf in the autumn (first-time tongue-tie latest, retained).

runners.comment: Two Newcastle AW wins at 1m4f in 2024; won on turf last May; soundly beaten for new yard
runners.name: Something
runners.spotlight: Two front-running wins at Newcastle (AW; about 1m4f) in late 2024 and was successful on turf last May but he's been beaten too far in both runs for this yard to have much faith this time.

16:50.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Failed to build on a promising stable debut last time but wasn't well positioned
runners.name: Serengeti

prev_owners.owner: D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Peter M Brant

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Serengeti is a work in progress I'd say with loads more improvement to come and is an exciting horse. Hopefully he'll make into a stakes horse - Declan McDonogh, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Ex-Coolmore 4yo who made a good start for his new connections when second at Wolverhampton last November (7f); not seen to best effect at Chelmsford three weeks ago and may do better back on Tapeta.

runners.comment: In top form but no obvious reason why he should reverse Chelmsford placings with Blue Rc
runners.name: Two Tempting

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Earl Grosvenor Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Tempting is very uncomplicated and really tries hard. He had a fantastic year last year when he kept on winning and is lovely for the owners. We felt like he was coming back to himself now. He's operating at a career-high at the moment and that isn't in handicaps. Jonny [Portman, trainer] found a nice opportunity today and let's hope he can build on it - Rob Hornby, jockey.

quotes.race: Listen To BetMGM On talkSPORT Handicap
quotes.quote: Two Tempting never ceases to amaze me, he's just a very tough horse. He goes on any ground but I didn't want too much rain. It was on the easy side at Epsom and definitely on the easy side here, and he's shown he goes on any ground - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't think we'd got it on the line but I'd have been happy with second. I thought Two Tempting ran a blinder. He ran well here last year but we didn't expect to win. The jockey had him in the right place at the right time. He's not in the Hunt Cup - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Fine servant who arrives in top form, most recently finishing third at Chelmsford three weeks ago (1m); raced wide on that occasion but he was better positioned than Blue Rc and no obvious reason why he would turn the tables, even if enjoying a tactical advantage.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't really have the rub of the green in the Shergar Cup at Ascot with the Japanese jockey [Ryusei Sakai] on board. He broke too well and then we disappointed him by taking a pull, which made him come wide. I'm hoping there's still a good day in him. We're looking at Chester for the £100,000 handicap he won last year, which is later in the month. 20-08-25

runners.comment: Low-key stable debut behind all of today's rivals three weeks ago; risky for now
runners.name: Bravais

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.spotlight: Low-key stable debut when last of seven at Chelmsford three weeks ago; dropped 3lb and of interest on last year's Irish best but others look safer this time.

runners.comment: In front of all today's rivals when second last time; that run can be upgraded; unexposed
runners.name: Blue Rc
runners.spotlight: Progressive handicapper who had all four of today's rivals behind him when second of seven at Chelmsford three weeks ago; raced freely early on and couldn't quite peg back a more prominently ridden rival; up 1lb but we haven't seen the best of him yet.

stable_tour.quote: He's won three of his five starts. He was very immature mentally and physically - he started by being upset in the stalls and was withdrawn - and then we started off by running in a hood over 6f round a bend. Gradually we've increased his trip from 6f to a mile and removed the hood as he's grown up mentally. He's grown up physically at the same time and I'd expect another step forward. His new mark of 92 demands a step forward but I'd like to think there's more in him. 09-07-25

runners.comment: Behind two of these last time but when returning from a break; better expected here
runners.name: Popmaster

quotes.race: Howden Challenge Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Tom Marquand just thought Popmaster had a little look at the other horse and it's so unfair [to be beaten in a photo]. He's running out of his skin at the moment and he's a great servant. If he doesn't run on Champions Day I think we'll put him away for the season but I'll have to speak to Ed Walker - Laurence Bellman, owner.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I've been second in so many big handicaps, an Ayr Gold Cup with Great Ambassador and we were second in the Kensington Palace here this week, and second in a Stewards' Cup. It's so frustrating, but they're so hard to win. Popmaster was spot on for today and I remember saying to Laurence (Bellman, owner) at Chelmsford when we were beaten and so disappointed that might have just won us a Wokingham - because it got his confidence back and we didn't have a penalty. It looked like we had a good draw and Tom gave him a peach of a ride, but we've Ryan Moore to blame! We'll go for all the big sprint handicaps and we hope he's got one in him - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: Fever-Tree Handicap
quotes.quote: We think Popmaster will be better next year and he's a good fun sprinter, who has been a bit unlucky this year - Laurence Bellman, owner.

runners.spotlight: Finished behind Blue Rc and Two Tempting at Chelmsford three weeks ago but ran creditably given he had been absent for 176 days; better expected.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming high with him this season and I think he ran well in the Hungerford. We won't see him at his best until it's soft and with some cut in the ground at Doncaster, I wouldn't be surprised to see him run a huge race in the Park Stakes. 11-09-24
He's been running really well on the all- weather through the winter and has come down to a fair mark. We'll probably run him one more time then give him a break. He wants 7f to 1m. 16-04-25

runners.comment: Three more 6f wins in 2025 included one over C&D; no surprise if he returned to form here
runners.name: Aberama Gold

quotes.race: William Hill Farewell Flat Handicap
quotes.quote: Aberama Gold seems to enjoy those conditions and we're lucky to have got him really. He ended up in Goodwood on this sort of ground, he won at York before that on better ground, but these are his sort of conditions by the looks of it. I don't know if we'll run him again this year. I'm not sure he's up to Listed class. He's a very good sprint handicapper and he's had a great year. I can't imagine he's going into next year well handicapped, but on these conditions, if you handle them it's probably worth a stone. We'll probably look for valuable sprint handicaps on bottomless ground - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Owner Evan Sutherland said Aberama Gold would handle the ground better than most and he was right. It was very straightforward, he travelled well, the last half a furlong felt like a long way but the loose horse might have been a help. I have inherited a very good horse off Keith Dalgleish. It is his third start for me now, I can't take a great deal of credit for him. The Ayr Gold Cup will be a good target and between now and then I am not certain as there is a bit of time. He is not just a mudlark but he probably wouldn't want it rattling fast - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Dash Handicap
quotes.quote: That was very nice. We've not really done anything with Aberama Gold since he arrived. He ran at Ayr very quickly after coming from Keith's and even now I hardly know the horse yet. He's in the Stewards' Cup next Saturday and if he gets in, why not run? - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Aberama Gold keeps improving and who knows when we will get to the bottom of him. He doesn't do a whole lot when he gets there but he's a nice horse. I always thought a bit of him and he probably just went a bit weak between two and three. He's versatile with ground and track - Shane Gray, jockey.

quotes.race: Shadwell Stallions Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We had been disappointed with Aberama Gold but giving him time and a strong pace at six furlongs has paid off - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

runners.spotlight: A wonderful performer over the years who has been another example of his trainer's ability to keep much-raced horses sweet; three more 6f wins in 2025 included one over C&D and it would hardly surprise if he returned to form after a low-key Wolverhampton run ten days ago.

stable_tour.quote: He had a great year in 2023, but not so much last year. He runs himself in and out of form and hopefully this is an 'in' year. If it is, he's well handicapped. He likes dig in the ground and won the Stewards' Cup two years ago on almost unraceable ground. 14-04-25

runners.comment: Two wins and two narrow defeats in four C&D starts; looks sure to have a say
runners.name: Stanley Spencer
runners.spotlight: Rock solid over C&D, winning two from four starts and going down narrowly in the other two, including when inching closer with every stride in November; drawn wide again but looks sure to have a say.

stable_tour.quote: It's nice to have another horse for Anthony Hogarth and his wife Val, who have been owners here before. The dam of this colt has three black-type winners from three foals - Trillium, Mohawk King and American Kestrel - and hopefully he can make it four from four. He's going well and should be ready to go next month. I'm looking to start him off over 5f. 19-04-23

runners.comment: Quite well treated on the pick of C&D and turf form but lesser effort on AW latest
runners.name: Secret Guest

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 'Get Rewarded With Ladbucks' Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit disappointed with SECRET GUEST at Newcastle last time but I think that had something to do with him doing too well through the winter. I bought him at the breeze-up and he's done really well for us - Bryan Smart, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Quite well treated on the pick of his form over C&D and on turf in the last year or so but he's needed some excuses as well, including in two of his three AW runs in the autumn; needs revival from last time.

runners.comment: Three front-running turf wins at about 7f in 2025; high in weights having rare 6f run
runners.name: Bell Shot
runners.owner: Sbk Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd

quotes.race: Tyre Scope Handicap
quotes.quote: I probably didn't get to stack them up as much as I'd have liked but Bell Shot likes it here and he was tough - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Three front-running turf wins at about 7f in 2025 but he paid the handicapping price and his recent efforts suggest he has plenty to prove on rare 6f run off his current mark; usually in cheekpieces, visor refitted.

runners.comment: Useful C&D form; good effort at weights in a seller here latest; thereabouts
runners.name: Prince Of Pillo

quotes.race: British EBF Stallions Harry Rosebery Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The doubt was there because Prince Of Pillo had run the other day and we were backing him up quite quick. But if he hadn't been bumped at Doncaster he'd have been a comfortable third behind two very good two-year-olds. He's got so much natural pace and he's got a lovely relaxed attitude as well. I'd say he's a good one - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Ripon Hornblower Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was really happy. Prince Of Pillo has so much speed and did that easily. He was a bit green the last furlong and was having a look at the big crowd, but he won that at half-speed - Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Useful type for this C&D and although he didn't shine here two starts ago he put up a good show at the weights in a seller last time; a peak effort would see him thereabouts.

runners.comment: Useful Kempton win (6f) latest; still well treated off 4lb lower than latest turf win
runners.name: Buccabay

quotes.race: Betfred 'Join Our Sports Club' Reverence Handicap
quotes.quote: Buccabay gets hammered by the handicapper because he's so consistent. I made an error and ran him back way too quickly last time. He always runs his race. He's got a lovely turn of foot but it doesn't last very long so you have to be brave and wait for as long as possible - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Interex Group British EBF Crocker Bulteel Maiden Stakes (Not Run More Than Once) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled with Buccabay. Who knows what the form is but I've always liked him, he just needs a bit of educating. He was very green at Newbury and I was quite worried he was going to be weak. I looked at him today in the paddock and he was so up behind, I don't know where it came from, it's just happened in the past week, so I think he'll probably need a bit of time now to let his front come up to his back. Everything went wrong at Newbury. He got mullered coming out of the stalls and knocked about here, there and everywhere but it taught him, you can see he has a great mind. He settled very well, picked up and I think these Saxon Warriors have a lovely turn of foot - Eve Johnston Houghton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hampered over C&D when working up to a challenge two starts ago but he was delivered late at Kempton (6f) since to beat a useful rival in the manner of one who has more to come on sand; still 4lb lower than his latest turf win last May; solid claims.

stable_tour.quote: He won the second of his two runs as a 2yo when taking an Ascot maiden in mid-summer. Unfortunately, the handicapper was more impressed than he should have been and really punished Buccabay for that win giving him an opening mark of 87. This term he has had four runs without looking like adding to that one win and has dropped down to a mark of 81. Hopefully, we can run him in calmer waters now and give him a chance again. 11-07-23

runners.comment: Made it 3-5 in 6f AW races when Newcastle winner latest; back up 3lb; bold show expected
runners.name: Filly One

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (C/D, No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB)
quotes.quote: She's always been held in high regard, but her mind sometimes wants to do other things. Filly One isn't the easiest, so it was nice for her to back it up - Harry Russell, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Front-runs; has a fine AW record over 6f and she made it 3-5 when holding on at Newcastle in November; was a wide-margin C&D winner last May and this test might suit even better; back up 3lb; bold show expected.

runners.comment: C&D winner; down weights after a mostly quiet 2025; lacks recent run; likely other days
runners.name: Amazonian Dream
runners.spotlight: Has dropped a fair way in the weights since winning two AW races in a row, including over C&D, at the end of 2024; hard to dismiss back here but he lacks a recent run and easier races will come up later.

stable_tour.quote: He had four wins last year. When they're running well, they get full of confidence and try harder than they would do normally. He did that last season but this year he's had a disappointing campaign, although he's now come down to a nice mark. He was fourth in a £75,000 race at Windsor last month and now that he's become well handicapped I think he could easily win a couple between now and the end of the year. 27-08-25

runners.comment: Useful AW strike-rate; latest C&D win last April came in a lower grade; more to prove here
runners.name: Oriental Prince

quotes.race: Pertemps Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Oriental Prince had just held on. The race set up nicely, he relaxed and I was able to get a breather into him. He hasn't stopped improving yet - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

runners.spotlight: Leads or races prominently; useful strike-rate on AW but his latest C&D win last April came in a much lower grade and he has more to prove back at 6f after some low-key subsequent runs at the trip.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a brilliant all-weather season. We're at a crossroads with him because we're not sure if he's done enough or not, or if we need to change tactics. He's hard to catch on the all-weather but the turf is slightly different to the all-weather and we're not sure if we're going too hard or not hard enough. He's still quite an exciting horse. If you look at the sectionals at Musselburgh in a very strong race last month it was very good. We probably used up a lot of petrol with Gweedore and I think if we'd have been left alone then we'd have been first or second. That's Ayr Gold Cup form and we're taking on Class 2 handicappers, so he's interesting. He's obviously very fast. 07-05-25

runners.comment: Two 6f turf wins in 2025; capable of finding a race on AW but out of sorts of late
runners.name: Mr Cool
runners.spotlight: Two 6f turf wins in 2025 but 0-6 on AW; capable of finding a race on sand but out of sorts on his last two starts and needs a big turnaround.

runners.comment: Has won at 1m; should have the speed for first 6f run after recent 7f win for new yard
runners.name: Gunlock
runners.spotlight: Has won at 1m on Tapeta elsewhere and this is his first 6f run but he raced freely before getting a confident ride to win over 7f at Kempton on recent yard debut and he should have the speed for this trip; back up 3lb; good contender.

runners.comment: Good 6f Polytrack record; creditable 5f show after absence for new yard; first Tapeta run
runners.name: Nemov
runners.spotlight: A good record on Polytrack for Clive Cox included a 6f Kempton win; missed nearly all of 2025 but he ran well over an inadequate 5f on his yard debut in December; should improve on that back at 6f but Tapeta is an unknown.

13:49.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Apprentice Handicap

runners.comment: 0-9 since joining this yard; down in grade but still hard to warm to
runners.name: La Rochette
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f turf winner in France in the spring of 2024, but 0-9 since joining this yard and failed to beat a rival over 6f here 13 days ago; down in grade but still hard to warm to; stable also runs Invincible Annice.

stable_tour.quote: She's one to watch out for. She's been sixth and fifth at Ripon on her last two runs - you have to keep her ticking over. She has a lovely, big stride on her at home. She wants really soft ground and then she'll win. She's a lovely horse and she's my trainer's pick. 21-05-25

runners.comment: Made all over C&D 13 days ago; has been rated much higher in the past so respected
runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr

quotes.race: Book Tickets For Ladies Night @hamilton-park.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Ruth (Carr) just said to me, "I can't get Digital any better than he is, he's in real good form." - jockey Paul Mulrennan, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Made all to beat Little Mi Mi by just under a length in returning cheekpieces over C&D 13 days ago; has been rated much higher than this in the past so respected up 3lb.

stable_tour.quote: I've always held him in high regard. He jumped a little keen at Newbury and taking him back was probably the wrong thing to do. He hit the line well when third over six furlongs at Southwell so we have the option of that trip but he'll probably stay over five for now. He goes to York this week. 10-05-22

He came from Karl Burke at about this time last year and has won twice for us, both times at Hamilton, a course he likes. I was pleased with his run at Wolverhampton last week, even though he was only fifth of nine. He wants either a stiff 5f or an easy 6f. 09-04-25

runners.comment: Both wins have come over 5f so well worth a second look back in trip; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Last Outlaw

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: First time out at Doncaster I just let Last Outlaw find his feet early on and he ran on really nicely, despite hanging away from competition late on. I was confident he'd step forward from that and he was much more straightforward in the closing stages, though I'd expect him to come on again for that run - Sean Kirrane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Beaten less than 2l when fifth of 12 over 6f here 12 days ago, but both wins have come over 5f so well worth a second look back in trip off his reduced mark; cheekpieces are given a go.

runners.comment: Recent efforts need improving upon; drops to 5f for the first time; visor on
runners.name: Prince Of Bel Lir

quotes.race: Cazoo Handicap
quotes.quote: Prince Of Bel Lir enjoyed this ground better than he did at Thirsk last time and hopefully he can build on this - Daniel Muscutt, rider.

runners.spotlight: 7lb lower than when winning at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) just under a year ago, but recent efforts need improving up on while he drops to 5f for the first time on his 47th outing; first-time visor replaces the usual cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Four of his six wins have come over C&D; 2lb lower than for the latest in July
runners.name: Henery Hawk

prev_owners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt
Mrs D Dalby & Harrowgate Bloodstock Ltd

runners.spotlight: Four of his six wins have come over C&D and has dropped 2lb lower than for the latest in July; finished behind Digital and Little Mi Mi here 13 days ago but capable of bouncing back, especially if getting a solid pace to aim at; stable also runs Shatin Venture.

runners.comment: Won off 3lb lower over C&D in November, but well held in all three starts back here since
runners.name: Invincible Annice

quotes.race: Leisure Connect EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands B, C And D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Invincible Annice was idling a bit in front but it was tough conditions - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Won off 3lb lower over C&D in November, but inconsistent and has been well held in all three starts back here since; others stronger.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice filly who wants it really soft. She was a good two-year-old for Karl Burke, winning twice. I gave her a run at Ripon a couple of weeks ago but it was too fast for her. 21-05-25

runners.comment: Last three wins have come over C&D; capable of playing a part if getting a strong pace
runners.name: Latin Five

quotes.race: Killashee Hotel Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Latin Five is a horse we thought might win his maiden, but this was the first time he really raced professionally. He loved the stiff six and should go the seven at some stage. We'll see what the handicapper does - Joseph O'Brien, trainer

runners.spotlight: Last three wins have come over C&D, the latest on his return from 81 days off last month; 3lb rise still leaves him well treated on earlier form and capable of playing a part, especially if they go hard up front.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a bit frustrating. He relies on the others to set the race up for him and he's been unlucky a few times. A gap didn't come at the right time for him at Beverley, then at Ripon the one in front of him came back and he had to switch round, which is never good for him as he's better going through them. When everything sets up perfectly he wins. 14-08-25

runners.comment: C&D winner just under a year ago, but well beaten on his return here 16 days ago
runners.name: Stroxx
runners.spotlight: C&D winner just under a year ago, but has been up and down since winning at Catterick (5f, good) last April and was well beaten on his return from seven months off here 16 days ago; others preferred.

runners.comment: 0-13 and needs a bit more for last year's winning stable
runners.name: Wee Mary
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in four of her first five starts after reappearing for Rebecca Menzies in April, but well held in both starts since debuting for this yard in October (albeit caught the eye the first time); now 0-13 and needs a bit more for last year's winning stable.

runners.comment: 0-15 but runner-up in her last three starts; shouldn't be far away again
runners.name: Little Mi Mi
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but runner-up in her last three starts, the latest when beaten just under a length by Digital over C&D 13 days ago; now 3lb better off and shouldn't be far away again.

runners.breeder: Oghill House Stud & Joseph M Burke
runners.comment: 1-16; running well in handicaps lately, but a bit more is needed if he is to win one
runners.name: Shatin Venture

prev_owners.owner: John Murphy, W F Perratt,Jackton Racing

runners.spotlight: Sole success came in a 0-50 classified event over C&D last March; has run well to be placed in his last three handicaps here, but a bit more is needed if he is to win one.

runners.comment: Losing run of 17 and a record of 2-48 on the AW tempers enthusiasm
runners.name: Under Curfew

quotes.race: Best Free Tips At valuerater.co.uk Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Under Curfew travelled beautifully. I was told to follow our other horse [Bezzas Lad] but he went off too quick. We slotted in and he couldn't try any more for me ? I couldn't stop screaming from two out - Mollie Phillips, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Veteran who is 6lb lower than when winning at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last February, but a losing run of 17 and a record of 2-48 on the AW tempers enthusiasm.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Bath in May and then again at Salisbury last month.  He was second at Bath last Friday night - it looked an easy opportunity for him with just three runners, but they're never easy and 5f on very fast ground probably just caught him out - he's more a 6f horse really. The winner of the race is possibly all right. He'll run in the Bullet at Brighton on Friday. All ground comes alike to him and he's in good form. 07-08-24

14:24.race_name: Create Your Bet Builders At Midnite Restricted Novice Stakes (Horses In Bands B, C & D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Hinted at promise when a debut fourth at Southwell; he can take a step forward here
runners.name: Mr Dreamseller
runners.spotlight: 14-1, hinted at promise when a debut fourth of six in 6f Southwell novice 59 days ago, leading until 2f out; can take a step forward here.

runners.comment: Shaped well when third over C&D in September; needs considering with better to come
runners.name: Polka
runners.spotlight: 7-1 and hooded, shaped well when third of four on her debut in novice over C&D in September; off since but needs considering with better to come.

runners.comment: Encouraging debut fourth at Southwell; can do better, especially now up in trip
runners.name: Riley Rocks
runners.spotlight: 5-1, encouraging fourth of eight on his debut in 5f Southwell novice 13 days ago, running on late; can do better, especially now up in trip; considered.

runners.comment: Zoustar gelding; the market can prove a good guide for this debutant
runners.name: Stromness
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns foal, 50,000gns yearling; Zoustar gelding; dam, 6f 2yo winner (RPR 79), is a half-sister to useful 7f winner Validated; the market can prove a good guide for this debutant.

runners.comment: Made a winning start in 7f Chelmsford novice; open to progress and rates a big player
runners.name: Three Non Blondes
runners.spotlight: 7-2, made a winning start in 7f novice at Chelmsford four weeks ago, always to the fore and sticking to her task well; should prove as effective over this trip and rates a big player.

runners.comment: Green when a debut seventh over C&D; capable of a fair bit better now so not ruled out
runners.name: Evolve
runners.spotlight: 9-2 and green, showed promise when a never-dangerous debut seventh of 13 in C&D maiden 13 days ago; appeals as capable of a fair bit better with that experience behind him.

runners.comment: Cut little ice in pair of 7f novices here last month; needs to take a major step forward
runners.name: Ravens View
runners.spotlight: Cut little ice in a pair of 7f novices here last month; he needs to take a major step forward.

runners.comment: Beat just one at Beverley in September where she hung badly left; hood back on now
runners.name: Elizabetty
runners.owner: The Cat And The Mag Partnership
runners.spotlight: Looked to be progressing until beating just one in 7.5f Beverley novice in September where she hung badly left; hood goes back on after a break with more needed.

runners.comment: Never a threat in a pair of C&D novices last month; lots more is needed
runners.name: Battenburg Belle
runners.spotlight: Never a threat in a pair of C&D novices last month; has plenty to find on form.

14:59.race_name: Join The Midnite Movement Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: 2-2 over C&D; may not get his own way this time, but he remains unexposed
runners.name: Antrim
runners.spotlight: Showed ability on turf but is 2-2 over this C&D, the latest success when making all on stable/handicap debut last month; 6lb higher and may not get his own way this time with Midnight Lion in opposition, but he remains unexposed.

runners.comment: Front-runner who has won eight times here, the latest 12 days ago; can't be ruled out
runners.name: Midnight Lion

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Midnight Lion loves it round here and is thriving at the minute. He's very straightforward - he wings the gates, he doesn't pull in front and when you get stuck into him he really keeps finding - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We were hoping Midnight Lion would run like that as Paul [Mulrennan, jockey] had won on him over the course and distance. He developed a sinus problem and he's been on antibiotics so we were a bit negative about his chances. Fortunately he won, but he probably needs a tooth out, so it was quite impressive - Jim Goldie, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is versatile as regards trip, having won eight times over 7f-1m2f here, the latest over 1m 12 days ago; 3lb rise puts him on a career-high mark, but he can't be ruled out if he does manage to get to the front.

stable_tour.quote: He's been terrific. I had a chat with Mark Johnston about him and I pointed out to him that we've actually only got him back to where we had him, rated in the 80s and winning at Goodwood.
