He's a big galloper and possibly better at 1m2f than the 2m trip he ran over last time. The problem is he likes to dominate and then people can take you on and get you beat. If they leave him alone he's hard to pass and if you take him on you'll get beaten yourself, so it's a Catch 22. He seems to love the Tapeta surface, so we might head towards the Northumberland Plate or Vase. There's races for him this Saturday. We're bringing him back from a quiet spell but he's done brilliantly. 07-05-25

runners.comment: 2lb higher than when winning over C&D 13 days ago; a contested lead would aid his cause
runners.name: Machete
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner in France who was gaining his first success for this yard when getting up late over C&D 13 days ago; just 2lb higher and although further may suit ideally, a contested lead would aid his cause; respected.

runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 412131; 10lb higher but can never be ignored under these conditions
runners.name: Without Compromise
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 412131, his latest success a 6l victory over Inappropriate 19 days ago; handicapper hasn't missed him with a 10lb rise and he takes on much better rivals this time, but he can never be ignored under these conditions.

runners.comment: Five wins here and running well lately, but still 6lb above his last winning mark
runners.name: Urban Road
runners.owner: S Mcmillan, F Reay & A D Brown

prev_owners.owner: D D Oakes & A D Brown

quotes.race: Hull FC Rugby League Takeover Day Handicap
quotes.quote: The pace of the race didn't suit him last time. Urban Road is improving, the penny has only just dropped with him - Alan Brown, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner who has continued to run well since completing a hat-trick on Tapeta last February, including when a close third of ten at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) a fortnight ago; still 6lb above his last winning mark, though, so will need a bit extra.

runners.comment: Would have finished closer to Without Compromise over C&D last time with a clearer run
runners.name: Inappropriate

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Final (Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's been a real team effort to get Inappropriate here. This has been the plan for a while - his first run was excellent then we felt his subsequent two runs were ground-related and we needed to wait for better going so this race was the obvious one.  But we've had two scares. He stood on a nail with a hind foot and took a while to get over that. Then more recently he got cast and bashed a front leg and back leg. The vets and all the staff have been working so hard, he's been standing in buckets of ice for hours, and they've got him here. There was a worry for a time he wouldn't make it. It's worked out really well - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

quotes.race: Paul Ferguson's Jumpers To Follow 'Introductory' Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: We decided to have a punt at this race because we won this with a horse we bought off the Flat at the sales too. Even if we didn't win, it was a nice place to introduce Inappropriate. We've always liked him a lot at home and his jumping has been exceptional. Jumps trainers generally cannot compete buying the ones of the Flat anymore, with Australia and the Middle East getting them. We managed to find him though, and we'll let him learn his new job. It'd be nice if we can find another race with good prize-money like this - Jedd O'Keeffe, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two wins on turf and two over hurdles; beaten 6l by Without Compromise in a first-time tongue-tie over C&D 19 days ago, but would have finished closer with a clearer run; 9lb better off with the winner and can't be dismissed easily.

15:34.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap

runners.comment: Still on last winning mark, but another furlong may suit ideally having won over 6f here
runners.name: Mesaafi
runners.spotlight: Still on his last winning mark and running consistently well in defeat lately; has run well over 5f, but another furlong may suit ideally having won over that trip on his only previous visit here.

runners.comment: Well held on handicap debut at Lingfield last month; has something to prove
runners.name: Coronado King
runners.spotlight: Made a successful stable debut following a mammoth absence in a Wolverhampton maiden (6f, Tapeta) in October having been gelded in the meantime, but well held on handicap debut at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack) last month; something to prove.

runners.comment: Not shown much in just four starts since winning at Cork in April 2023; look elsewhere
runners.name: Pineapple Island
runners.spotlight: Not shown much in just four starts for three different yards since winning a Cork maiden (5f, soft to heavy) in April 2023, including when well beaten here (6f) on Monday; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Still 7lb higher than when off the mark over C&D in October
runners.name: Bonnies Boy
runners.spotlight: Made it 14th-time lucky over C&D in October, but an 8lb rise for that has appeared to find him out in both starts since; 1lb drop not enough to tempt.

runners.breeder: Executors Of The Late Mr J L C Pearce
runners.comment: Rarely seen over 5f; can go well fresh but losing run up to 25
runners.name: Juan Les Pins
runners.spotlight: Finished runner-up in a Southwell Listed race (5f, Tapeta) in February 2024, but mainly seen over further; has run well fresh in the past so a four-month absence may not be as much of a concern as a 25-race losing run.

stable_tour.quote: He was bought by his owner out of a claimer at Redcar in the summer from Ed Dunlop, so I can't take any credit for such a smart purchase. He has been a joy to train and the improvement has been very swift, as having started off on 72, he's now up to 93 as we look forward to this year. He won three on the bounce for us but his last run when third in the Ayr Gold Cup was very smart form. He has really pleased me with how he's done over the winter and I'd like to think he hasn't hit the ceiling of his ability yet. He'll be aimed at the big 6f handicaps and the Ayr Gold Cup is likely to be his main target again. 22-03-23

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner and runner-up here last month; very much respected
runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, the latest in November, while he again ran well when second of ten here 19 days ago with two of these behind; up another 3lb but still very much respected; stable also runs Darlo Pride.

stable_tour.quote: We got him earlier this season from Adrian Nicholls. He was highly tried at two and three and has now dropped to what is a good handicap mark. He started the season on 72 and is down to 62 now. When he puts it together I can't believe he won't be winning soon. He'd be my dark horse. 28-08-24

runners.comment: Both course wins have come over 6f; still needs more to defy this mark
runners.name: Dandy Magic

quotes.race: Jackie And Janet Mack 65th Anniversary Handicap
quotes.quote: I told Lauren [Young, jockey] to get cover and play Dandy Magic late. She's probably better at six furlongs and needed every yard of the five but she got there - Jim Goldie, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Both course wins have come over 6f, though she did win over this trip at Ayr (good to soft) in September; may have sat too close to the pace here 13 days ago, but still needs more in order to defy this mark for last year's winning stable.

stable_tour.quote: She won for us on the all-weather but I think she's paid for it. When you run a young horse on the all-weather they can feel it after a few runs. We've givenher a little break and we'll probably bring her back for a backend campaign. We probably ran her once or twice too often on the Tapeta. I think she's quite talented and if we can get her 100 per cent sound then she'll progress again. 07-05-25

runners.comment: 6lb below last winning mark but doesn't come into this in great form; others more solid
runners.name: Lions House
runners.spotlight: 6lb lower than when winning at Southwell (5f, Tapeta) in May, but doesn't come into this in the best of form; others more solid.

runners.comment: Two of his four wins have come over C&D; each-way player if they go hard up front
runners.name: Dark Kestrel
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have come over C&D, the latest off 2lb lower in October; each-way player, especially if they go hard up front.

runners.comment: Returned to winning form over C&D in November, but held back here 11 days later
runners.name: Blue Lakota

quotes.race: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap
quotes.quote: Blue Lakota has been running well and was just starting to find his form again. He seems to enjoy Newcastle, which is a bonus. The plan was to lead, but he ended up with a bit of cover. When I asked him to quicken the gaps opened at the right time - Jack Callan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Returned to winning form when just getting the better of a subsequent scorer over C&D in November, but held off this mark back here 11 days later; needs a resurgence.

runners.comment: 3lb higher than when winning narrowly over C&D last month; may be able to build on that
runners.name: Hover On The Wind
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who narrowly regained winning form over C&D last month; 3lb higher, but he was returning from 72 days off last time so he may be able to build on that performance.

stable_tour.quote: He hit the ground running and showed loads of speed over 6f at Thirsk, so the natural progression was to bring him back to 5f and he was very genuine when he won at Beverley. He ran a solid second at Pontefract but may have banged his head on the stalls next time - he missed the start completely and it took him quite a while to get over that. He's better than how he ran at Beverley last time. 14-08-25

runners.comment: C&D winner; ran well after a layoff when fourth behind Hover On The Wind here last month
runners.name: Darlo Pride
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And M Dods
runners.spotlight: 2lb higher than for the latest of two wins around this time last year (first was over C&D); was returning from 258 days off when beaten just over 2l into fourth of nine behind Hover On The Wind here last month; one for the shortlist with that run under his belt.

16:05.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: Off four months before an encouraging C&D third latest; one to consider now
runners.name: Callianassa
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer in the summer who resumed from four months off with an encouraging third of eight over C&D 12 days ago, fading late on; she's one to consider with that run under her belt.

runners.comment: Hinted at a revival for new yard when eighth at Wolverhampton 12 days ago; not discounted
runners.name: Qazaq
runners.spotlight: A fairly useful 1m winner at his best for Roger Varian; tongue tied and hinted at a revival for his new yard when eighth of 12 in 7f Wolverhampton handicap 12 days ago, set a lot to do; he's not discounted off a falling mark.

stable_tour.quote: If he gets in it would be his first run on turf but I like him and he won his first three on the all-weather. He probably wasn't quite right when beaten on New Year's Day, so we gave him a break and he's on the comeback trail. His work has been nice and I think the stiff seven will suit him. He should handle anything between good to firm and good to soft on turf.   09-06-25

runners.comment: Arrives in decent nick, third at Southwell 20 days ago; ought to be thereabouts once more
runners.name: Donna Nook
runners.spotlight: Yet to score for her current handler but this fair ex-Irish 7f winner arrives in decent nick, cheekpieces on when third of six in 1m Southwell handicap 20 days ago; she ought to be thereabouts once more.

runners.comment: On a losing run but he comes here in good form; one for the shortlist with cheekpieces on
runners.name: Eves Boy

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Eve's Boy is a lovely horse who ran really well first time. You can put a line through his second run because he got a bit anxious in the gate, but he's shown there what we thought he could do. He'll be a nice horse next year, a winter on his back will do him good - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: On a losing run but he comes here in good form, fifth of ten in 1m Southwell handicap 41 days ago; one for the shortlist with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Thriving for current yard and gained third win here latest; up 4lb but not taken lightly
runners.name: The Green Man

quotes.race: Clean Up With PPS Handicap
quotes.quote: The Green Man did that easily enough and he's in good order with himself, he hasn't moved as well as this in a long time. He's flourishing. He's a big horse and he's just fully maturing - Joseph Parr, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Thriving for his current yard and he bagged a third success here in 7f handicap 19 days ago; up another 4lb but not taken lightly stepped up in trip.

runners.comment: Collared only late on when second here 12 days ago; can go well again despite 2lb rise
runners.name: Bajan Bandit

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Bajan Bandit made all when he won at Haydock then we were duped by a shower of rain half an hour before the race last time there and held him up. This looked a competitive event but he won well enough. At some point we'll try him over a mile again but there's no rush - Grant Tuer, trainer.

quotes.race: Due Diligence Standing At Whitsbury Manor British EBF Blagrave Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward, very professional and Bahan Bandit travelled nicely. We thought we would sit back before getting a tone of the race but when the split came he got his head down and found the gap nicely. He was a little bit green at one stage, but his raw ability came through and he has hit the line strong. The ground is a touch quick for him so he will improve and he will come on massively from this run. He will improve with a bit more ease in the ground, but it shows that he is a good horse and he will go on anything - Cieren Fallon, rider.

runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways over 7f here in December and twice runner-up here since, collared only late on in 7f handicap 12 days ago; he can go well again despite a 2lb weights rise.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Richard Hannon's yard and when he arrived here he had a mark of 79 but his first run for us was disappointing. We felt a mile stretched him then and dropped him to 7f, which proved to be the right thing as he won at Haydock on his second run. He added to that at York in July off a mark of 80 and he's now shot up to 87. We tried him again over a mile last week at the Ebor meeting as there were no 7f alternatives and he ran a cracking race. That trip on fast ground is definitely him and it looks like there could be a big prize in him. He has a touch of class and it is onwards and upwards. Looking ahead there are options at Doncaster and York to consider. 30-08-23

runners.comment: Shaped well when C&D second 12 days ago; this course scorer merits serious consideration
runners.name: Flying Fletcher
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing sequence but he's slipped in the weights and shaped well when second of eight over C&D 12 days ago when conceding first run to the winner; this course scorer merits serious consideration off an unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Set plenty to do when good sixth here latest; ought to be in the shake-up off easing mark
runners.name: Novak
runners.spotlight: Scored over 7f here in September and has continued in good form, set plenty to do when sixth of 12 over 6f here 13 days ago; he ought to be in the shake-up off a slipping mark.

stable_tour.quote: A tough and consistent horse who'll go to the Western meeting for a 7f handicap. The owner lives near Ayr, so it would be lovely if he were to get his head in front. He just doesn't want the ground too soft. 10-09-25

runners.comment: Goes really well here and readily landed fifth win over C&D latest; good claims
runners.name: Concert Boy
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott
runners.spotlight: Goes really well here and garnered a fifth win in impressive style over C&D 23 days ago, forging clear last 1f; hiked up 9lb but still holds good claims.

stable_tour.quote: We picked him up last March for around £7,000. We kept him busy all year - I think he must have run 27 times so he won a lot of prize-money and finished in the top 20 in the All-Weather Horse of the Year bonus scheme, so I think he picked up something like £52,000 in total prize-money. He's been absolutely brilliant and his main objective this year will be to go back to the all-weather and run three times a month with half an eye on the bonus again. 17-07-25

runners.comment: In fine form for current yard, best of the front-runners when C&D third latest; a player
runners.name: Francesi

quotes.race: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals "Hands And Heels" Apprentice Handicap (Part Of RE Series)
quotes.quote: He travelled really well and when I asked Francesi he quickened nicely. I wasn't expecting it, I knew he had a small chance but with it being my first ride I wasn't 100% sure. I started off pony racing and joined Tony's (Carroll) in July. He's a brilliant boss and gives a lot of young riders chances - Myla Coppins, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Quick to make his mark for his current yard over C&D in December and he fared best of the pace-setters when third of 12 over C&D only three days ago; a player off the same mark.

16:35.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: Four-time C&D winner but essentially below his best here and elsewhere since the autumn.
runners.name: Volenti
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D winner but essentially below his best here and elsewhere since the autumn, losing his race in the preliminaries last time; weighted to strike again, if not a certainty to do so.

runners.comment: Finishing effort wasn't all it could be behind No Nay Nevermind over 7f here latest.
runners.name: Sherlock
runners.spotlight: In the frame on all four starts since an autumn break, albeit twice beaten as favourite; finishing effort wasn't all it could be behind No Nay Nevermind over 7f here latest; cheekpieces debuted then are retained.

runners.comment: November's C&D win was another personal best form effort; chance if all's well with him.
runners.name: Coramento

quotes.race: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Coramento travelled through the race really well. I probably got there a bit soon but he kept going - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Win here in early November was another clear personal best form effort (RPR 64) and took his C&D handicap record to 1341; yet to strike in better than 0-58 company and he missed his last intended engagement through lameness, but claims are obvious if all is well with him.

runners.comment: Traffic issues over 7f here latest; now at least returned to his sole winning mark.
runners.name: Miners Gamble

quotes.race: Seagreen Is Done, Canter Believe It Handicap
quotes.quote: Miners Gamble is a slow learner. Brian has nursed him throughout his career and he's starting to put everything together now. Franny Norton, who rode him at Haydock earlier in the season, said he liked him and he'd improve. He had a visor on then, whereas he's racing in cheekpieces now and that's played a part. You can't get there too soon on him. He's a bit of a thinker, but I think he'll come on even though he's had plenty of runs now. He's finally got his head in front and I think he's a horse on the up - Ben Robinson, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Traffic issues galore when dropped to a 7f trip no longer within his range here last time; will still need it to all fall right back up just a furlong, but has been returned to his sole winning mark, at least.

stable_tour.quote: He was a close third two weeks ago at Newcastle when he probably would have won had he not been squeezed at the start. We've just got to be careful with him before his races as he boiled over last year. He doesn't want to be in the paddock long, so it'll be in and out. He's entered at Chelmsford and Lingfield this Friday. 03-04-24

runners.comment: Could help himself more, but mark continues to fall; may yet have a race on Tapeta in him.
runners.name: Springbok
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Not always been helping himself of late (can take a grip; hung right latest), but now 17lb lower than for April's handicap debut and his best RPR away from turf was gained over 1m on his sole previous Tapeta start.

runners.comment: Offered little on last month's Tapeta debut at Southwell, but might prefer this course.
runners.name: Believe In Lies
runners.spotlight: Offered little on last month's Tapeta debut at Southwell, but as her strongest handicap form thus far has been recorded over galloping turf tracks the hope must be she'll find this place more to her liking.

runners.comment: Outstayed Sherlock when second over 7f in the second-time visor here latest; chance.
runners.name: No Nay Nevermind
runners.owner: S Jones, L Donaldson, K Elliott & I Codd

prev_owners.owner: S Jones, L Donaldson, I Jardine & I Codd

runners.spotlight: 0-14 but competitive again since the visor was added, staying on past Sherlock over 7f here latest in such a manner as to suggest today's trip may be within compass now; back up 2lb but likelier than many.

runners.comment: More prolific on turf; hasn't beaten a rival on two recent C&D visits; hood reached for.
runners.name: Shifter

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Shifter is going over hurdles, that's what she was bought for. I hope we might persuade them to stay a bit longer on the Flat now but she jumps like a bunny - Wilf Storey, trainer. She was gaining with every stride. You could almost step her up and go further. As soon as you pass horses on her, it lights her up - Paula Muir, jockey.

runners.spotlight: More prolific on turf but missed nearly all of that season in 2025, and hasn't beaten a rival on two recent C&D visits; hood reached for.

runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner; emerged from the doldrums when third here 12 days ago (run of race).
runners.name: Pallas Lord

quotes.race: Durdar Maiden Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: It was a taking performance by Pallas Lord as he's been on a massive learning curve from his first two runs. The stiff track and the soft ground have suited him - Harry Russell, jockey.

runners.spotlight: C&D winner off up to 6lb higher in the past, and emerged from the doldrums with a resurgent third here 12 days ago, granted the run of the race; goes close again if able to back up that effort.

runners.comment: Slow start likely cost him another C&D win latest; can figure if this is also run to suit.
runners.name: Trais Fluors

prev_owners.owner: Paul Corrigan & Miss L A Perratt

quotes.race: Play Coral "Racing-Super-Series" For Free Handicap
quotes.quote: Trais Fluors was beaten by a good horse in Brentford Hope at Nottingham last time. He was suited by the better ground here, which was key. He carried a lot of weight but felt a lot better today - Silvestre de Sousa, rider.

runners.spotlight: A nose away from a fourth C&D win last time, a slow start proving costly; always a hostage to fortune given his preferred hold-up style, but evidently in the form currently to figure again if this is run to suit.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything was perfect for Harswell Duke today. The soft ground is what he needs - Roger Fell, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Harswell Duke is a tough horse and we've waited all year for this soft ground. We've always thought a lot of him and we had a few quid on him; he was 6-1 last night. He's declared for Nottingham on Wednesday but we'll probably give him a break and go for the Spring Mile next year - Mike Kirby, part of Harswell Thoroughbred Racing, owners.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Harswell Duke found plenty and had been crying out for this softer ground. He was gutsy there to fend off the second.- Jason Hart, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Spring Mile for us last year. He's run really well when things have fallen into place for him - he needs soft or heavy ground and a good pace to aim at on a stiff track. He was only just beaten at Pontefract in April and then six days later he was just touched off again at Wetherby. He's dying to land one soon, it's just getting the ground right for him. He's never let us down on testing ground, so he could have a run at Haydock soon. His main target would be a mile handicap at Nottingham on October 2 - you'd hope he'll get his conditions then. He'll probably have a bit of a break during the summer while the ground is like it is. 21-06-24

runners.comment: 0-10 and unimproved by the step up to this C&D behind Sherlock last time out; overlooked.
runners.name: Wait For It
runners.spotlight: 0-10 and unimproved by the step up to this C&D latest, trailing Sherlock 7l; 5lb swing with that one isn't sufficiently persuasive.

17:05.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: On dangerous mark and he turned things around with close third C&D 12 days ago; respected
runners.name: Master Dandy
runners.spotlight: On lengthy losing run but he's well treated on old form and showed signs of a revival when close third over C&D 12 days ago; that was a bold bid from the front and he's a big player if he can back that up.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D last month but well held in both subsequent runs and she's now 0-13
runners.name: Sovereign Class
runners.spotlight: Reappeared with a near miss over C&D last month but she's not come close to that form in two subsequent runs and is now 0-13; down the list.

runners.comment: Inconsistent 12-race maiden who has form figures of 5488 at this trip; opposable on return
runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent 12-race maiden who was a well-held fifth of seven at Ayr (5f, good) when last seen in April; mark continues to fall but she has form figures of 5488 at this trip and looks opposable on her return.

runners.comment: 0-10 but he's unexposed on AW and wasn't beaten far over C&D two weeks ago
runners.name: Eco Power Boy
runners.spotlight: 0-10 but he's dropped a long way in the weights and wasn't beaten far on his reappearance over C&D (fifth of 14) two weeks ago; has each-way claims if he can build on that and he's unexposed on AW.

runners.comment: Both wins have come at big prices and she needs another bolt from the blue
runners.name: Green Valentine
runners.spotlight: 25-1 winner at Hamilton (6f, soft) in September and she scored at 66-1 over C&D last month; remains feasibly treated on her best form but she's been laboured in last two runs and needs another bolt from the blue; cheekpieces removed.

runners.comment: Won a classified event over C&D in March; needs watching in market on his return
runners.name: Doon The Glen
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 25th attempt when finishing well to score by a nose over C&D (classified event) in March; has 4lb rise to deal with back in a handicap but that was a personal best last time and he needs watching in market on his return.

runners.comment: 11-time course winner and he was a good second over C&D last time; in the mix
runners.name: Athollblair Boy
runners.spotlight: 12yo who has won 11 times at this track; last win was almost two years ago but that was off 16lb higher and he bounced back with a good second over C&D last month; regular cheekpieces now return and he's in the mix.

stable_tour.quote: We like to give our apprentices a good chance on him as he's such a lovely horse to ride. He always wins a couple of races a season despite being a nine-year-old and is great to have around the yard. My granddaughter, who's two, rides him around the stable as he's so nice. We'll keep looking for races where the younger jockeys can ride him. He was seventh at Doncaster last Thursday but wasn't beaten that far. 27-07-22

runners.comment: Seven-time course winner who has finished placed here in last three runs; respected
runners.name: Spartan Fighter
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner

quotes.race: Acturis Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Spartan Fighter is a nice horse. He's in the Gimcrack and I'd think it will be all geared round that. There are a couple of races in France for him but we're not in any rush, he's a horse with a future and we won't do anything hasty. He has a lot of natural ability - Declan Carroll, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Losing run is up to 22 but this seven-time course winner has finished placed here in his last three runs including when runner-up over C&D two weeks ago; that was a good effort behind a handicap blot and he's respected off unchanged mark.

runners.comment: Regressive nine-race maiden who has form figures of 400977 in handicaps; others preferred
runners.name: Brave Bob
runners.spotlight: Generally regressive nine-race maiden who has form figures of 400977 in handicaps; still unexposed on AW but mark has bottomed out now and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Some good efforts over C&D since October but she's a frequent slow starter who is now 0-18
runners.name: Yellow Lemons
runners.spotlight: Some creditable efforts over C&D since October but she's a frequent slow starter who is not easy to predict and her record now stands at 0-18.

stable_tour.quote: She is owned by Summerstorm Bloodstock, who also have Luna A Inbhir Nis with us. She was at Jim Goldie's for her last couple of runs and was just a bit disappointing, so they wanted to give her a change of scenery to see if it perked her up. She's had a wind operation and she's just back in full work. Another three or four weeks she'll be out running again and we'll see if it's helped her or not. 17-07-25

runners.comment: Just one win from 30 starts and she's struggled in her last two runs
runners.name: Shesashambles
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 30 starts and that was at Thirsk in August 2024; reached the frame a couple of times over C&D in the autumn but she's struggled in last two starts and needs a major revival; cheekpieces reapplied.

runners.comment: Last win was over two years ago and he's been out of sorts over C&D in last three runs
runners.name: Bernie The Bear
runners.spotlight: All three wins have been on Tapeta (6f/7f) but last success was over two years ago and he's been out of sorts over C&D in last three runs; passed over.

17:35.race_name: Midnite: Built For 2025 Not 2005 Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: In good form until caught wide at Chelmsford latest; likely player eased 1lb
runners.name: Diligent Henry
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (7f) in October and in good form until caught wide at Chelmsford (7f) four weeks ago; likely player eased 1lb.

runners.comment: Beat just one over C&D on his yard debut 27 days ago; needs to take a major step forward
runners.name: Classy Clarets
runners.spotlight: Ended his time with Alice Haynes well below par and beat just one over C&D on his yard debut 27 days ago; needs to take a major step forward.

runners.comment: Rusty after six months off when seventh here latest; considered with blinkers back on
runners.name: Beneficiary

prev_owners.owner: Al Mohamediya Racing & Mrs E Burke

runners.spotlight: C&D winner who looked rusty after six months off when a never-dangerous seventh of 11 in 5f handicap here 23 days ago; needs considering now with his usual blinkers also back on.

runners.comment: Not seen to ideal effect when C&D sixth latest; this C&D scorer is one for the shortlist
runners.name: Laurens Dream
runners.spotlight: It's now 15 runs since her last success but she wasn't seen to ideal effect when sixth of 14 over C&D 16 days ago, challenging wide; this C&D scorer is one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but back on track when fourth over C&D 12 days ago; needs to back it up
runners.name: Penny Mountain
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but she got back on track when fourth of 12 over C&D 12 days ago; she needs to back it up now.

runners.comment: C&D success in November but well below par here both runs since; headgear changed now
runners.name: Korroor

quotes.race: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Korroor has been a little out of form on his past few runs but he travelled lovely and did it nicely - Tom Kiely-Marshall, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Gained a second C&D success in November but has been well below par here both runs since; needs a change of headgear to spark a resurgence.

runners.comment: Course specialist who got right back on track with C&D second latest; not taken lightly
runners.name: Fircombe Hall
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run but this course specialist got right back on track when second of 12 over C&D 12 days ago; he's not taken lightly nudged up 1lb.

runners.comment: Had wind op before only 13th over C&D 16 days ago; lots more is needed to get off the mark
runners.name: Wee Nan
runners.spotlight: Had a wind op before coming in only 13th in C&D handicap 16 days ago; lots more is needed if she's to get off the mark at the sixth attempt.

runners.comment: A three-time C&D winner but he comes here well below par; others appeal more
runners.name: Nazca
runners.spotlight: A three-time C&D winner but he comes here well below par, just eighth of 14 over C&D 23 days ago; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Course scorer; not discredited when C&D fourth latest; 21 starts since that win though
runners.name: Yaahobby

prev_owners.owner: M Styler, K Chambers & A Brittain

runners.spotlight: Course winner who wasn't discredited when fourth of 14 over C&D 16 days ago; it's 21 starts since that victory though.

runners.comment: Last here in September on final run for Neil Mechie; needs yard switch to spark progress
runners.name: Auroras Doublesix
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who was tried in a hood when last of ten in 7f handicap here in September on her final run for Neil Mechie; needs this yard switch to spark major improvement.

12:35.race_name: Passage House Inn Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Needs to jump better after a disappointing chase debut, but the step up in trip may suit.
runners.name: Maximum Offers
runners.owner: L H & A Snowden & Lady Keswick

prev_owners.owner: L H & A Snowden & Late Sir Chips Keswick

quotes.race: Visit Huntingdon For Your Next Conference Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maximum Offers is a six-year-old but he's still weak and will get better with age and also get further - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Consistent form over hurdles since his 2m maiden Huntingdon (good) win but jumped poorly on November's chase debut when a well-backed favourite over a longer trip; went close on his sole point start, so this step to 3m could suit if his jumping is more fluent, with cheekpieces now added.

stable_tour.quote: He won a maiden hurdle at Huntingdon last season. He had a good blow on his first run this season over hurdles and he'll go novice chasing now. 05-11-25

runners.comment: Steps up in trip after a poor run latest but has claims if regaining her early chase form.
runners.name: Easy To Follow
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on a bright start to her campaign when finishing a distant fourth of five at Fontwell (2m3.5f, heavy) last month; has the stronger recent form on deeper ground but has won on good, and could improve for this longer trip (stayed 3m in points), if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Dual-chase winner who has failed to match that level since but still difficult to ignore.
runners.name: Jo Lescribaa
runners.spotlight: Made all for his two chase wins (3m; good to soft and heavy) but hasn't been in the same form since, admittedly most recent effort was off the back of a 277-day break; remains 6lb above his latest success but his jockey's claim negates that, and he's of interest with that run behind him.

stable_tour.quote: He was able to exploit his mark to win handicap chases at Uttoxeter and Chepstow last season and, although he was beaten a long way on his last run, I think he'll be able to step up again in staying handicap chases this term. 22-10-25

runners.comment: Well beaten in the Southern National latest but this is easier and he's worth considering.
runners.name: Born At Midnight

quotes.race: cheltenhamfestival.com Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I thought it'd be a very quick turnaround from last time but Born At Midnight only got racing over the last couple of fences. I rode him out the next day and he was bucking and kicking. We thought we'd have another go today and it worked. I think he'll be even better over an even longer trip - Bill Turner, trainer.

quotes.race: Stalbridge Jingle Bells Staying Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Born At Midnight is a progressive horse. He had a bit of a tough start, he was very unlucky to be brought down, fallen, slipped up so I'm chuffed he's won now. Hopefully there's plenty more to come from him - Bill Turner, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner (2m7f-3m2.5f; good/soft); well beaten in last month's Southern National at Fontwell but has claims if judged on his third off today's mark at Hereford (3m1f, good) in October now back in this easier grade.

runners.comment: Latest run may have been needed, but he's 3-4 over C&D and he has to enter calculations.
runners.name: Bampton Star

quotes.race: South West Rail Solutions Ltd Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Bampton Star likes to dictate things. The ground was a bit quick and we knew that before going out there, but I don't think we're going to get much softer ground with spring around the corner. He just needed encouragement throughout and once he passed one or two he found his second wind. He tried his heart out - Chad Bament, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 3-4 over C&D, including one win when ridden by Chad Bament, also placed on the other occasion, but ended last season on a low note and looked in need of November's reappearance when pulled up; likely to be sharper with that run behind him and handles most ground, so has to be considered with his record here.

runners.comment: Winning hurdler who is 1-3 since switched to fences, and the clear pick on recent form.
runners.name: Seasmoke

quotes.race: Mick And Linda Jackson Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Seasmoke showed today she had a gutsy attitude and the family has multiple winners because of that. James [Bowen, jockey] gave her a well judged ride and he said if he rode her again then he'd go that little bit quicker - Billy Aprahamian, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler who is 1-3 since switching to fences this season, the win coming over 3m (good to soft) and he finished a good second off this mark at Southwell (3m, good to soft) last month; clear pick on form and a leading contender.

runners.comment: Two poor runs since returning from a break and has yet to convince he stays this far.
runners.name: John W Creasy

prev_owners.owner: A D Mullins & Ms Margaret Mullins

quotes.race: Bespoke Horse Racing Odds At DragonBet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I didn't jump up and down at the finish, that's for sure, because I could see the other horse coming. I was holding it all inside and hoping we held on at the line. We're chuffed to bits. John W Creasy has taken a little time to come to hand and we struggled with his wind last season, but now it seems his confidence is growing and this ground and trip seem to work for him. He's a lovely fun horse and he's been great for the syndicate, and that's what it's all about. He'll be a proper staying chaser when he gets older as he's a brother to Mr Vango. I'm not sure we'll quite reach those heights but we'll definitely keep trying - Chris Honour, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual deep-ground chase winner (2m-2m3.f) last season but has run poorly on both starts back from a break this autumn and yet to convince he stays this far; others have more obvious claims.

runners.comment: Has shown only a modest level of ability so far and makes little appeal on chase debut.
runners.name: Arctic Stream
runners.spotlight: Showed little in five point starts in 2022 and in three hurdle runs after a long absence last season; pulled up on November's handicap debut following another break and makes limited appeal now switching to fences over a longer trip.

runners.comment: Dual point winner but soundly beaten on both starts since returned to regulation fences.
runners.name: Emberscombe
runners.spotlight: Won a couple of points on Exmoor but was pulled up on her return to regulation fences at Worcester (2m7f, good) in June and fared little better when a distant fourth at Hereford (3m1f, good) in November.

13:10.race_name: Happy New Year From Pricedup Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Among the better bumper performers here, but well behind Limerick Lass on hurdling debut.
runners.name: Beauty In The Park
runners.spotlight: January's Wincanton third (heavy) is close to the best bumper form here; well behind Limerick Lass when weakening on hurdling debut at the same course last time, however (good to soft; first run since wind surgery), and have to hope the drop back in trip helps.

stable_tour.quote: A well-bred mare, related to three winners, with bags of stamina in her pedigree. She showed promise in her two bumpers, although she wasn't your typical bumper horse, and is going to want a trip now she tackles mares' novice hurdles. Has done plenty of schooling and is ready to run as soon as we get more rain. 04-11-25

runners.comment: Irish point winner on good, but offered too little on either hurdles run last month.
runners.name: Bees Kiss
runners.spotlight: Return to a soundish surface may be an asset considering her good-ground Irish point success, but seismic improvement on last month's two efforts required nevertheless.

runners.comment: Not done with when unseating in Listed novice on British debut latest; must be in the mix.
runners.name: Clondaw Park
runners.spotlight: All-the-way Irish point winner last February (3m, heavy); thought highly enough of to go straight into Listed company on British debut at Newbury, unseating three out with cards yet to play, and has to be in the mix down appreciably in class if none the worse for the experience.

runners.comment: Almost got up on her final Irish point start (3m, heavy); discouraging British debut.
runners.name: Dalcassian Girl
runners.spotlight: Almost got up on her final Irish point start in February (heavy), but a very long last in a Chepstow bumper on British/stable debut.

runners.comment: Irish point winner in early 2024 (3m, soft to heavy); yet to offer sufficient over here.
runners.name: Dancing Sky
runners.spotlight: Just two outings since February 2024's Irish mares' maiden point success (3m, soft to heavy), offering little switched to hurdles latest; claims not obvious on first start since leaving Suzy Smith.

runners.comment: May make a hurdler, but hasn't lasted home in two starts over shorter trips than today's.
runners.name: Half Pint Daisy
runners.spotlight: Fair bit to offer over hurdles on breeding, but hasn't lasted home in two starts over shorter trips than today's; unpersuasive.

runners.comment: Irish/British bumper form not replicated over hurdles yet; one for modest handicaps later.
runners.name: Harleys Pride
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in Irish/British bumpers, but unable to break out of rear in two hurdles runs; maybe one for moderate handicaps later.

runners.breeder: Earl De Cordelles & Earl La Dariole
runners.comment: Just over 2l behind Limerick Lass on their respective hurdling debuts; will improve.
runners.name: Indannya
runners.spotlight: Better than the bare form of March's point third (2m4f, good; stopping error last), and only shrugged off from the final flight behind Limerick Lass switched to hurdles at Wincanton latest; highly likely improver; declared 12:52 Warwick yesterday.

runners.comment: Unseen since two 1m4f French bumper wins back in May (good/soft); may make a jumper.
runners.name: Lady Magic
runners.spotlight: All-the-way winner of her final two 1m4f bumper races in France for Adrien Fouassier (good/soft); out of a 2m1f-2m5f chase winner so may take to jumps, though may equally just need this first start since May.

runners.comment: Just missed out on Wincanton hurdling debut (2m5f); major contender.
runners.name: Limerick Lass
runners.spotlight: All-the-way Chepstow bumper winner in April (good), and showed a fine attitude in a protracted duel on last month's Wincanton hurdles debut (2m5f, good to soft), denied only close home; sets the standard on that effort and claims are no less strong today.

runners.comment: Comfortably held in two extended 2m Taunton novice hurdles (good); one for handicaps.
runners.name: Lydeard Girl
runners.spotlight: Comfortably held in a pair of extended 2m Taunton novice hurdles of late (good); yard has just enjoyed its two best ever months for winners, but likely has more of a mares' handicap prospect on its hands here.

runners.comment: 2m5f maiden second here in October; not one for blind confidence having bled twice.
runners.name: Miss Tiara
runners.spotlight: Second over 2m5f in a debuted tongue tie here in October (good to firm); yet to compile a faultless round of jumping, but it's the bleeding from the nose on her two other hurdles starts which concerns more.

runners.comment: Limited promise about her bumper debut in April, but one likely to improve for hurdles.
runners.name: Moonlight Stride
runners.spotlight: Unseen since a weakening 17l eighth of nine on April's Chepstow bumper debut (good); smart jumping performers in the family, however, and no surprise were she to fare better facing a line of hurdles.

runners.comment: Already a regular here; unimproved by tongue tie in C&D 0-105 latest; cheekpieces go on.
runners.name: Reel Orange
runners.owner: J M Dare, T Hamlin, J W Snook
runners.spotlight: Already 0-5 over hurdles around here alone; unimproved by tongue tie in a C&D 0-105 handicap latest (soft); cheekpieces go on instead.

runners.comment: Irish point winner around another undulating right-hander; check for market confidence.
runners.name: Spring Serenade
runners.spotlight: Last January's deep-ground Irish mares' maiden point win rates as unexceptional form (beaten horses collectively 2-33 subsequently), but it's encouraging in today's context that it was gained around another undulating right-hander; check for market confidence ahead of rules debut.

13:45.race_name: Thurlestone Hotel Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Going in at 300-1 over C&D (heavy) was the longest-priced win in British racing history
runners.name: Blowers

quotes.race: pricedup.bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ella Herbison was meant to ride Blowers. I was on my way to riding out on the M5 at ten past six and a random unknown Irish number rang me. Sometimes I don't answer and I didn't know who it was. It was Ella. 'Do you want to ride one in the first at Exeter?' Sadly, she got stuck in traffic and didn't make her flight. Thank you to Ella for thinking of me and for Nigel and the owners to allow me to ride. He was keen the last day so Nigel said with the ground being testing, he was worried they might crawl. Plan A was to drop in last, but then we thought he might relax better in front. He was jumping out to his left a bit so I stayed middle to outer down the back. He's clearly handled the ground, got in a nice rhythm and thank you to all connections - James Best, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a point and pulled up (under this 7lb claimer) on hurdles debut but he settled better and battled on gamely for a front-running C&D win (heavy) two weeks ago; at 300-1 that was the longest-priced win in British racing history but the hot favourite seemed to run his race in second, a long way clear of the rest; needs further improvement against an in-form Sober Glory.

runners.comment: Nothing found to explain his flop last time; earlier form gives him standout claims
runners.name: Sober Glory

quotes.race: Angela Nettlefold Memorial 'National Hunt' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a very important day and thankfully it's gone well. Sober Glory has been ready to run for close to a month but we'd just been waiting for a bit of softer ground. All his bumpers were on very soft ground, but I don't think he necessarily needs it like that. I'm sure he'll stay further, but I don't think we need to. He really is exciting and probably the best one we've had for a long time - Philip Hobbs, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Won a Listed event on final start in bumpers and scored easily at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) in November on the switch to hurdles; that made it five wins from his first five races, mostly on soft, but he flopped when 4-7 in a Listed novice event at Sandown last month; reportedly nothing found to explain that run and earlier form gives him standout claims.

stable_tour.quote: He was fantastic at Chepstow the other day in his maiden hurdle. He's a lovely horse who is going to get a lot further than two miles, but he did it so well, which was great to see. We'll stick to two miles as he is so effective over that distance, but we'd want to stick to a stiff track and he's particularly effective on soft ground. I think we'll target the Listed novice hurdle at Sandown on December 6 and then go from there. Like all of these novices, we'll go from race to race and work from there. I'm hoping he'll end up a horse for the spring festivals and in terms of trip I'm sure we'll end up over further, although he's got plenty of pace. He'll be a great, big staying chaser one day and he's an exciting prospect. 20-11-25

Won his only point-to-point in Ireland last season and got off to a great start under rules when winning his bumper at Chepstow on Tuesday. He's a relative of Fingal Bay who we trained to win some decent races. 30-10-24

runners.comment: 100-1, raced freely before fading into 7th of 16 over C&D (good to soft) four weeks ago
runners.name: Air Apparent
runners.owner: A Cocks, T Johnson & P Downing
runners.spotlight: 100-1, raced freely before fading into seventh of 16 over C&D (good to soft) four weeks ago; hard to fancy just yet.

runners.comment: Some promise on debut; beaten about 60l since at Chepstow and Exeter, hurdle debut latest
runners.name: Arnie Moon
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in his first bumper but beaten about 60l at Chepstow and Exeter (300-1 for hurdle debut) in his two races since.

runners.comment: 100-1 for bumper at Taunton (2m, good to firm) five weeks ago and faded to go down by 15l
runners.name: Devon Paige
runners.spotlight: Dam bumper, 2m hurdle and multiple point winner, out of 3m3f chase winner; 100-1 for bumper at Taunton (2m, good to firm) five weeks ago and faded to go down by 15l; best watched for the time being.

runners.comment: 28-1 for a bumper at Ascot (good) six weeks ago, fading to tail off in last of six
runners.name: Dino Moon
runners.spotlight: 28-1 for a bumper at Ascot (good) six weeks ago, fading to tail off in last of six; looks a longer-term prospect.

runners.comment: Pretty useful Irish Flat form (ran twice) demands respect and he's joined top jumping yard
runners.name: Gambino
runners.spotlight: Flat bred and raced twice in that sphere last year for Noel Meade at Gowran Park, winning a 9.5f maiden in April and second in a 1m4f handicap in August; there was promise in those performances, the pretty useful form demands respect and he's now joined top jumping yard.

stable_tour.quote: He's won on the Flat in Ireland and is a good type for two-mile novice hurdles in the spring. We'll give him plenty of time and if he were still a maiden this time next year it wouldn't be a problem. He's a progressive horse and could even go back on the Flat. 10-11-25

runners.breeder: Scea De La Sapiniere & A Chaille-Chaill
runners.comment: Irish point winner who showed modest form at triple-figure odds in three hurdle races
runners.name: Manhattan Valley
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who showed modest form at triple-figure odds in three hurdle races, two of them last month; major work to do.

runners.comment: Open to improvement after a Worcester bumper and Newbury maiden; each-way player
runners.name: Nice One Eric
runners.spotlight: Significant ability when fourth in a Worcester bumper (good) in October and his 25l defeat on hurdling debut at Newbury (2m, soft) five weeks ago came when 33-1 in strong company; open to improvement and each-way player.

runners.comment: Nothing to shout about from a bumper, four points and a C&D novice
runners.name: Tobi Kanobee
runners.spotlight: Nothing to shout about from a bumper, four points and a C&D novice.

14:20.race_name: PricedUp The Jumps Handicap Hurdle (Div I)

runners.comment: Career-high mark to defy, but should be suited by this slightly longer trip; key player.
runners.name: Our Dylan

prev_owners.owner: Mrs R Treacy & Mrs T J Kidd

runners.spotlight: Made it 4-28 over hurdles when appreciating the step back up to 2m4f and winning at Wincanton (good) in November; despite now faced with a career high mark, Joshua Newman's 5lb claim will help, and another good account can be expected over this slightly longer trip.

runners.comment: Disappointing latest, but a course winner in October and may play a role if back on song.
runners.name: Hillsin
runners.spotlight: Made a successful return to his former trainer with a win over shorter here in October, ridden by Edward Vaughan; well beaten in a more competitive handicap off this mark since but he's capable of playing a role if back on song.

runners.comment: Hard to warm to on latest efforts, but could be a threat if responding well to the visor.
runners.name: Shuil Ceoil
runners.spotlight: Hard to warm to on most recent efforts back from a break, but of interest if recapturing the form of his most recent win at Fontwell (2m5.5f, soft) nearly a year ago; still 2lb above last winning mark but could be a threat if he responds positively to the visor.

runners.comment: Up in trip off what looks a fair mark for handicaps if ready after a break; interesting.
runners.name: Benignitas
runners.spotlight: 2023 Point winner who shaped with promise over hurdles with two third-place finishes for this stable last season, latest at Chepstow (2m3.5f, good) in March; interesting now stepping up in trip off what looks a workable mark for handicap debut, further aided by Rian Corcoran's 7lb claim, though she has tended to need a run when returning from a break.

runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner who has been disappointing since joining this stable; blinkers added.
runners.name: Weseekherthere

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Weseekherthere could step up in trip and she will get a handicap mark now. Today was the plan - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner in 2023 for Gordon Elliott, but only one notable effort for this stable - and that was two years ago; absent 522 days before finishing tailed off on chase debut in November and was beaten 27l back over hurdles here (2m7f) last month; blinkers now go on and on a good mark, but has too much to prove.

runners.comment: Below best latest, but worth considering on previous efforts since switched to handicaps.
runners.name: Locked Down Lad
runners.spotlight: Point bumper winner who has been placed in five of his eight runs over hurdles, all since switching to handicaps, though below his best when a 23l third at Windsor (2m4f, good to soft) in November; likely to be thereabouts again.

runners.comment: Mixed form this season, and likely more required anyay despite a 3lb drop in the weights.
runners.name: Blue In The West
runners.spotlight: 21-race maiden under Rules, whose form has been rather mixed this season and, even on the pick of those efforts, he'll likely need to improve to win despite a 3lb drop in the weights but holds place claim.

runners.comment: Drops back in trip now reverting to hurdles off a fair mark, but he has plenty to prove.
runners.name: Moonlight Artist
runners.owner: The Cheltenham & South West Racing Club

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Moonlight Artist has gone off favourite or a short price a few times and I've always wondered why but he got it together today. This should do his confidence the world of good and hopefully there should be another race in him. Brendan Powell, rider.

runners.spotlight: It's been more miss than hit since winning over fences at Warwick (3m, good) in April, and he was most disappointing when well beaten here last month in the returning cheekpieces (retained); drops back in trip reverting to hurdles on a fair mark, aided by Ben Bromley's claim, but has plenty to prove at present.

stable_tour.quote: He was in training all of last season and ready to run but we didn't want to risk him on the ground. He'll go novice hurdling in the middle of November but works nicely. He seems like a nice horse. 31-10-22

runners.comment: Workable mark and won't mind coming back in trip, but comes in on the back of a poor run.
runners.name: The Longest Day

prev_owners.owner: New Gen Racing Group And Partner
Exors Of The Late C J Leech

runners.spotlight: 2-23 over hurdles, both coming over 3m more than two years ago; on a fair mark but has to be forgiven a poor run latest and, though the drop back in trip won't inconvenience him, he appears to have place claims at best.

runners.comment: Low mileage 8yo; worth considering after a promising fourth here latest now back in trip.
runners.name: Bollin Thou
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when favourite for seasonal/stable/handicap debut (first-time cheekpieces) in November, and didn't quite see it out the 2m7f when fourth here last month, but that was far more encouraging; stable among the winners, and easy to make a case for now back in trip, despite being 3lb wrong.

runners.comment: Failed to complete in last five runs and hard to recommend from 13lb out of the weights.
runners.name: Poets Reflection

prev_owners.owner: Exors D Cocks & S Livesey-Van Dorst
D Cocks & Mrs S Livesey-Van Dorst

runners.spotlight: Has failed to complete in his last five starts and is impossible to recommend from 13lb out of the weights.

14:55.race_name: PricedUp The Jumps Handicap Hurdle (Div II)

runners.comment: Has a bit to prove after a break, but was well backed when winning this race last year.
runners.name: Looking For Larry

quotes.race: Peter Holland Memorial Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Looking For Larry was almost doing a little bit too much early on and I was just trying to keep him under plenty of cover, but turning in I gave him a squeeze and it felt like I had plenty left. I was a little bit worried that I'd hit the front too soon but he stayed true to his job and got the job done. He's a likeable horse - Jake Bament, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Landed a gamble when winning a division of this race last year off 5lb lower, but misbehaved when pulled up on chase debut the following month and was beaten 30l back over hurdles 18-days later; has tended to need his comeback runs in the past, so returns from a 10-month break with something to prove.

runners.comment: Inconsistent but appeals most now racing off a career-low mark and dropped into a class 5.
runners.name: Pachacuti
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and an infrequent winner over both fences and hurdles, and pulled up in two of his three chase starts this season; the new headgear needs to trigger a positive response back over hurdles, but he's off a career-low mark now dropped into a class 5 further aided by Rian Corcoran's claim.

stable_tour.quote: A nice young horse who has started to really blossom since having his wind operated on in the summer. He has improved with each of his three runs this season, culminating with a gutsy win at Fakenham last time out where he and the runner-up Bashers Reflection pulled right away from the field. The north Norfolk course is quite a trek for us, so we don't send them up their lightly, particularly with fuel costs rising so much. I have a very good record there with 20 wins from 47 runners (43% strike-rate; £18.58 profit to £1 stake), so it is always worth giving ours a second glance when they run there. Hopefully it is onwards and upwards now and we will look to get three miles with him next season. 22-02-23

runners.comment: Won off this mark in April; could improve if blinkers to have the desired effect.
runners.name: Iris Des Issards
runners.spotlight: Sole win over hurdles came off this mark at Newton Abbot (2m5.5f, good) in April; may have needed the run on chase debut after a break in October and shaped with more promise returned to this discipline the following month when third, beaten 7l, in a small field at Taunton (3m, good to firm); blinkers now added.

runners.comment: Remains with stamina to prove but has to be considered after recent placed efforts.
runners.name: Storming Nelson
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground 2m maiden hurdle winner at this meeting in 2024 but well below that level since, although this seasons efforts have been more encouraging following wind surgery, latest when a close third at Fontwell (2m1.5f, heavy) last month; remains with stamina to prove, but he has to be considered.

runners.comment: Well backed to finish third in March; unexposed but needs to back it up after a break.
runners.name: Dish Of The Day
runners.spotlight: Showed his first piece of worthwhile form when well backed under an aggressive ride and finishing a 3.5l third at Stratford in March (2m2.5f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces); needs to back that up after a break with stamina still to prove at the trip, but he's not yet fully exposed

runners.comment: May figure having shaped with promise latest, having dropped significantly in the weights.
runners.name: Vengeance
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on stable debut in November but that was after a long absence, but shaped with far more encouragement when tried in a tongue-tie and upped to 3m the following month; now racing off a much reduced mark but another step forward will likely be required.

runners.comment: Improved for this stable since retunring from a long absence; looks capble of better yet.
runners.name: Man Oh Man
runners.spotlight: Modest in Irish points and over hurdles, but didn't shape badly on stable debut in October after a long absence and duly built on that to finish a 4.75l third of 13 at Taunton (2m3f, good to firm) in November; looks capable of better still.

runners.comment: Inconsistent, but latest second a solid effort, and he has claims again if repeating it.
runners.name: Watchoutitscookie

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Lyndsey Lane From Brunel Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I didn't really want to make the running. Watchoutitscookie has a tendency to go to his right, but as long as you don't fight him, he's pretty straightforward that way. So I made the running on him, he's jumped well, and he's done it well - Lorcan Murtagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Newt In Somerset Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Watchoutitscookie has been quite difficult. He's been keen and the hood has helped. It was a good run last time and he was the one today. I think he wants a bit of cut in the ground and he's in at Exeter tomorrow, but we'll see how he is in the morning. I think he'll build on this because he has been difficult and keen. With horses like that, why fight them? He's taught himself to settle if you like - Nigel Hawke, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Winning chaser and hurdler (2m7f-2m4f), both on good to soft; only just denied by Our Dylan (runs in the first division) at Wincanton (2m4f, good) in November after a break; has struggled with consistency but remains competitively treated off a 4lb rise if reproducing the effort.

runners.comment: Finished second in this race last year but hard to recommend on subsequent efforts.
runners.name: William Philo
runners.spotlight: Finished a 6l second to Looking For Larry in a division of this race last year at 125-1 off 10lb higher after a similar absence, but his form slumped badly in three runs since, including when pulled up over fences in March; capable but hard to recommend.

runners.comment: Has offered more this season and has the ability to figure if staying this longer trip.
runners.name: Freddie Fleetfoot
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden, but his first two runs back from a 544-day absence this season were encouraging before a disappointing run at Taunton (2m, good) last month; has the ability to figure if seeing out this longer trip.

15:30.race_name: PricedUp Daily Racing Boosts Handicap Chase

runners.comment: His reduced mark and C&D record (a win and two seconds) are the major positives; shortlist
runners.name: Bonza Boy
runners.spotlight: In good form in January-April 2024 but has sparked only once (last February) in his four races since; his reduced mark and C&D record (a win and two seconds) are the major positives which put him on the shortlist.

runners.comment: Yet to make serious impact in Britain (four hurdle races and two chases); unseated latest
runners.name: Hors Jeu

prev_owners.owner: Jacques Detre, Patrice Detre & Ecurie Team Spirit

runners.spotlight: French hurdle winner in May 2024; yet to make a serious impact in Britain after four hurdle races and two chases, unseating four out at Lingfield (just 5-1) 11 days ago, so he lacks any solid claims.

runners.comment: Second at Huntingdon on debut for new yard but he was not so good at Haydock 11 days later
runners.name: Carrigmoorna Rowan
runners.spotlight: Went off the boil for Harry Fry; back near his best when second at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) in November under Robbie David on debut for new yard but he was not so good at Haydock 11 days later; equipment removed for those last two starts; mixed messages.

runners.comment: C&D winner; quickly back to just 1lb above his last winning mark; case can be made
runners.name: Rangatira Jack
runners.owner: Mrs D Robinson Mrs & Mrs Livesey-Van Dorst
runners.spotlight: Twice went well (second and first) at or near the front over C&D on good ground in the spring; has not figured so prominently this term and he's quickly back to just 1lb above his last winning mark; case can be made.

runners.comment: Second in this race in 2023; 6l winner at Hereford (2m5f, good to soft) three weeks ago
runners.name: Kingcormac

prev_owners.owner: A Maddox, S Langdon & K Johns

runners.spotlight: Second in this race in 2023 but pulled up when trying 3m at the same meeting last year, both in the mud; none too consistent overall either but 6l win at Hereford (2m5f, good to soft) on reappearance three weeks ago puts him into serious calculations despite the 6lb rise since.

runners.comment: Poor shows on last two starts; has a career-low mark and takes a further drop back in trip
runners.name: Lough Owel
runners.spotlight: Second or third in smallish fields on his first three runs over fences (2m7f/3m2f) but two poor shows have followed, wearing cheekpieces on latest; has a career-low mark and takes a further drop back in trip and others are more persuasive.

stable_tour.quote: I have a feeling this is a nice Hillstar gelding. He won his point well and the second horse has since won a maiden hurdle for Emmet Mullins. 24-10-23

runners.comment: Sticky jumping soon had him on the back foot in this season's two runs over fences
runners.name: Owl Of Athens

quotes.race: Quinnbet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It'll be very interesting to know the ins and outs of it all. One of the owners had £20 each-way, so if that's what people consider a gamble these days then the game is knackered. Owl Of Athens handled the ground and he jumped for the first time in his life. It wasn't pretty but he kept plugging away. We hoped it would be hard work and it was. It enabled him to pop away and jump better - Evan Williams, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 8l winner over hurdles at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) last January and ran creditably next time, but some sticky jumping soon had him on the back foot when soundly beaten in this season's two runs over fences.

runners.comment: Maiden; latest run was a step back in the right direction and he's way below his peak mark
runners.name: Daring Plan
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.spotlight: Can front-run, as he did when well-beaten third at Fontwell last time; that was a step back in the right direction and he's way below his peak mark, but there's also his enduring maiden status to consider.

runners.breeder: Cte Michel De Gigou & F Thomas De Gigou
runners.comment: Chase debutant, probably capable of better; note market strength with his in-form yard
runners.name: Ker Doudairies
runners.spotlight: Keeping-on fifth of 11 at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) raised his profile last time, in his second handicap hurdle, and he was 66-1 that day; better should be forthcoming, including as his dam was a 2m2f-2m6f French chase winner; market strength would look significant with his in-form yard.

runners.comment: Some minor honours in first campaign (2023-24) but he's lost his form; chase debut latest
runners.name: Senor Diaz
runners.spotlight: Some minor honours in his first campaign (2023-24) but lost his form for Seamus Mullins and pulled up on this season's two runs for new stable, the latest over C&D on his chase debut.

runners.comment: Chase debut and first cheekpieces need to make a big difference; 7lb out of the handicap
runners.name: Break Heart Hill
runners.spotlight: 25l defeat was his closest finish from seven races, so today's chase debut and first cheekpieces (he's tried a hood) need to make a big difference, especially as he is 7lb out of the handicap.

runners.comment: Failed to complete in her three starts this season; hard to fancy 9lb out of the handicap
runners.name: Firefly Lane
runners.spotlight: 1-14 over fences, with best efforts in 2024 and failing to complete in her three starts this season; hard to fancy 9lb out of the handicap.

runners.comment: It's a bit bold to say he has any worthwhile form; 10lb out of the handicap
runners.name: Alderley Charlie
runners.spotlight: After six hurdle races and one (C&D on heavy) over fences, it's a bit bold to say he has any worthwhile form; 10lb out of the handicap.

16:00.race_name: Racing Blogger Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (Category 3 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Promising third on Ffos Las debut in October and he should know more this time; key player
runners.name: Big John Ollie
runners.spotlight: 55,000euros 3yo; attracted support into 13-2 at Ffos Las (2m, soft) in October and he made some good late headway into a 3l third of nine; that was a promising start and he should know more this time; key player.

runners.comment: 155,000euros 3yo; yard 17% in bumpers in recent seasons and he's an interesting newcomer
runners.name: Blackswan Doroux
runners.spotlight: 155,000euros 3yo; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Blueking D'Oroux (smart 1m7f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Path D'Oroux (bumper and useful 2m hurdle/chase); dam French 2m1f hurdle winner; yard 17% in bumpers in recent seasons and he's an interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Out of a sister to a smart jumper; wears headgear on debut and others are preferred
runners.name: Elusive Pb
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unraced sister to smart jumper Out Sam, half-sister to useful bumper/jumps winner Honest John; wears headgear on debut and is best watched unless market suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Runner-up in bot starts and latest was in a big field over C&D last month; respected
runners.name: Im Wide Awake
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on Newton Abbot debut (2m1f, good to soft) in June and he reappeared with a second of 15 over C&D (soft; 22-1) last month; just about sets the standard on that latest form and he's respected.

runners.comment: 41,000euros yearling; plenty to like on paper and he needs checking in market on debut
runners.name: Kiptanuy
runners.spotlight: 41,000euros yearling; brother to French 1m7f hurdle winner Sainte Candy, half-brother to four winners including Pic D'Orhy (high-class and prolific 1m7f-2m5f hurdle/chase), Eclair Gris (1m7f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Forsus (2m2f hurdle); dam unraced; plenty to like on paper and this Irish radier needs checking in market on debut.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Cerdeval , Mme Valerie Aumont, Mr
runners.comment: 95,000euros 3yo; yard won this in 2023 and 2024 and he needs a close look on debut
runners.name: Le Cold Grey
runners.spotlight: 95,000euros 3yo; half-brother to winners Gaillard Du Mesnil (1m5f AQPS Flat and high-class 2m4f-3m6f hurdle/chase) and Hardi Du Mesnil (French 2m1f hurdle); dam 1m3f/1m4f AQPS Flat winner; yard won this in 2023 and 2024 and he needs a close look on debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's by a top French sire who is getting stacks of winners either side of the Channel. Judged on his work this autumn he's going to be one of our better bumper prospects. Ascot on Saturday due to the ground but we'll find another race shortly. 04-11-25

runners.comment: £32,000 3yo; yard 2-13 in bumpers this season and market should guide on debut
runners.name: Valiant Soldier
runners.spotlight: £32,000 3yo; brother to point winner Cherry Brave; dam bumper winner/placed in 2m hurdles, half-sister to winners Teescomponents Lad (useful 2m3f-3m1f hurdle) and Tesscomponentsyess (bumper and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle/chase); yard 2-13 in bumpers this season and market should guide on debut.

runners.comment: Has a striking pedigree and interesting to see how she figures in market
runners.name: Fountains Gala
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; sister to winners Fountains Windfall (smart bumper and 2m1f-3m hurdle/chase), Fountains Blossom (bumper/2m4f hurdle), Fountains Blenhein (bumper/2m3f hurdle) and Fountainspinklady (bumper); dam bumper/2m6f-3m hurdle winner; has lots of bumper winners in her pedigree and interesting to see how she figures in market.

runners.comment: Yard 1-23 in bumpers in recent seasons and others are preferred
runners.name: Hotter Than Dubai
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-sister to winners Hot Ryan (2m7f hurdle) and Tile Tapper (useful bumper and 2m3f/3m chase); dam 2m6f chase winner, out of once-raced half-sister to US 1m Grade 3 winner Media Mogul; yard 1-23 in bumpers in recent seasons and others are preferred.

runners.comment: 200-1 and was tailed off on Chepstow debut (2m, soft) in November
runners.name: Robs Spirit
runners.spotlight: 200-1 and was tailed off on Chepstow debut (2m, soft) in November.

runners.comment: Struggled at a big price on C&D debut last month and was a long behind I'm Wide Awake
runners.name: Topsham Tide
runners.spotlight: Struggled at a big price on C&D debut last month and was a long behind I'm Wide Awake.

runners.comment: Yard 0-5 in bumpers in recent seasons and she could be one for later on
runners.name: Up The Hill
runners.owner: Mrs K Jeanes & Mrs P Walker
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam 2m3f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Chocca Wocca (bumper/2m1f hurdle) and As I See It (2m7f/3m1f hurdle), out of smart bumper/2m-2m5f hurdle winner; yard 0-5 in bumpers in recent seasons and she could be one for later on.

12:20.race_name: Happy New Year Novices' Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Had to work pretty hard to beat a 50-1 chance over C&D in November; penalised
runners.name: Silver Hill
runners.spotlight: Had to work pretty hard to beat a 50-1 chance over C&D in November when long odds-on; he'll need to find something on that form if he's to defy a penalty.

runners.breeder: Haras Du Hoguenet & Mr Gilles Le Baron
runners.comment: Point and Southwell bumper winner; appeared stretched by 2m7f on soft ground last time
runners.name: In The Age
runners.spotlight: Point and Southwell bumper winner (good to soft); ran as though his hurdling debut at Aintree would bring him on (2m4f) and perhaps stretched by 2m7f on soft ground at Bangor; leading claims.

runners.comment: Every chance on the form he's reached and may well improve for this longer trip
runners.name: Pioneer Pete
runners.spotlight: Consistent so far without looking overly progressive, but has bumped into some useful rivals; should have every chance on the form he's reached and may well improve for this longer trip.

stable_tour.quote: He probably wants two and a half miles, but he was a bit keen when chasing home what is a fair horse in Un Sens A La Vie at Market Rasen in October so we kept him at the minimum trip at Exeter last time. He bumped into another nice horse in Lisbane Park there, but it was another solid run. 18-11-25

runners.comment: Beaten 19l and 39l in his two bumpers and wouldn't be the obvious answer to this
runners.name: Ratemenow
runners.spotlight: Beaten 19l and 39l in his two bumpers and wouldn't be the obvious answer to this.

runners.comment: Has the stamina for hurdling but unlikely the ability to cope with today's opposition
runners.name: Inlet
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden off the Flat, though finished runner-up three times; has the stamina for hurdling but unlikely the ability to cope with today's opposition; stable debut.

runners.comment: £1,600 3yo; 250-1 when pulled up over C&D 16 days ago; no appeal
runners.name: Lady Lucky
runners.spotlight: £1,600 3yo; 250-1 when pulled up over C&D 16 days ago; no appeal.

12:55.race_name: Book The Great Value Horseshoe Package Handicap Chase

runners.comment: C&D winner; shaped well after an absence two months ago and since had wind op
runners.name: Imperial Rule
runners.owner: Mrs K Elliott, Mrs D Chapman & Partner

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.spotlight: The winner of three handicap chases at about this trip, the latest over C&D in November 2024; back from 335 days off and making stable debut when beaten about 9l behind El Muchacho at Sedgefield (2m5f, good); could be sharper now and has had a wind op.

runners.comment: Sedgefield winner in November but pretty poor either side of that; hard to trust
runners.name: El Muchacho
runners.owner: T J Stubbins And M E Sowersby

quotes.race: David Slater Big 7-0 Birthday Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've only had El Muchacho for a couple of weeks and we're learning about him all the time, but fair play to Bradley, he gave him a very good ride, and his jumping was impeccable - Harriet Dickin, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing Again 25th January Handicap Hurdle (Go North Sea Pigeon Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I thought  El Muchacho was going to win easily enough then the second horse picked up quite well when I got to him. I was a little bit short of room on the rail. He's a nice horse, Milton's done well with him and he's obviously progressed - Harry Cobden, rider.
