runners.spotlight: Narrowly won off 2lb lower at Sedgefield in November (2m5f, good; Imperial Rule third) but pretty poor either side of that; capable but too inconsistent to trust.

runners.comment: Below par since his Cartmel win in May but still commands respect in this weak a handicap
runners.name: Defence Witness
runners.spotlight: Narrowly repelled Beat The Edge at Cartmel in May (2m5f, good to soft) but below that level in two subsequent runs and his latest third here was remote; still commands respect in this weak a handicap.

stable_tour.quote: He won a 2m5f chase round Cartmel but didn't really go when we took him back there. It turned out he'd picked up an injury, so he's on rest at the moment and will be out again in January. He wants good ground, so we'll see where we can find that. 29-10-25

runners.comment: Disappointing here last Sunday, for all that he was hampered at one stage
runners.name: Beat The Edge
runners.spotlight: 0-13 since beating three rivals in this race 12 months ago and was behind both El Muchacho and Imperial Rule at Sedgefield in November; disappointing here last Sunday, for all that he was hampered at one stage.

13:30.race_name: Bet At Racing TV Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Very limited Flat maiden who was a remote fifth on hurdling debut in October
runners.name: Apache Eagle

prev_owners.owner: Paul H Redmond & T G Fitzgerald & Mrs A M Obrien & B Fowler

runners.spotlight: Very limited Flat maiden who was a remote fifth on hurdling debut in October.

runners.comment: Quite useful Flat performer (4-34) and won his penultimate race over 1m2f
runners.name: Have Secret

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mary, Lady Manton

quotes.race: Coral Kincsem Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret has run a cracking race, which he has done all season. He's a horse who is getting better with racing, but he keeps just finding one or two. But we are delighted with him - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret tends to race behind the bridle but keeps finding. The step up in trip helped him and he handled the ground. Oisin Orr, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Have Secret deserved that after he ran well at Chester last week on a course that didn't suit him. He was going to go up the ratings so we thought we'd come here and he's going to go up even further now. He'll make a nice 3yo next year - Robin O'Ryan, assistant to trainer Richard Fahey.

runners.spotlight: Quite useful Flat performer (4-34) and won his penultimate race over 1m2f in November; if he can last home over this trip then his ability is hugely respected.

runners.breeder: Mme I Garcon, Mr J-Pierre Garcon & Mr G
runners.comment: First run for this yard was encouraging but not the latest when back at Carlisle
runners.name: Inedit Damour
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over fences/hurdles in France; quite a promising third on yard debut at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) but fared less well there a month ago with cheekpieces back on; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Tailed off in a Tipperary bumper on good to yielding in May; new trainer fits a hood
runners.name: Intenzo
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a Tipperary bumper on good to yielding in May; new trainer fits a hood; would need to see some confidence behind him.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; only 100-30 when departing three out at Huntingdon
runners.name: Not For Passin
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of a five-runner Perth bumper (good ground) and later recruited for 60,000euros; only 100-30 when departing three out at Huntingdon when in midfield at the time; one of the better options.

runners.comment: Although turned over at 5-4 at Huntingdon, the winner has proven himself a good horse
runners.name: Unjeu Royal
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; had an excuse on hurdle debut and, although turned over at 5-4 at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft), the winner went on to finish second to the exciting Old Park Star at Cheltenham before finishing behind in Aintree's Grade 1 on Boxing Day; this gelding faces nothing of his calibre here.

runners.breeder: Newsells Park & Ammerland Gmbh & Co Kg
runners.comment: 0-6 on the Flat and didn't really progress; bled when pulled up on hurdling debut
runners.name: William Walton
runners.spotlight: Showed ability during six-race Flat career for Owen Burrows, though was tailed off in cheekpieces on final run for that yard; bled from the nose when pulled up on stable/hurdling debut; risky.

runners.comment: Her first real blip in bumpers when well beaten in a Listed race last time
runners.name: Dotties Promise
runners.owner: Castle View Racing & W F Corbett
runners.spotlight: Her first real blip in bumpers when well beaten in a Listed race last time; won at Kelso on good ground in September; others have greater substance to their credentials.

14:05.race_name: racingtv.com Handicap Chase (Go North One Man Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Easy winner here on Sunday and found another weak race to carry a penalty
runners.name: Supreme George
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-2 after wind surgery when beating three other finishers with ease over C&D last Sunday; must have every chance of defying a penalty in another weak race.

runners.breeder: Pierre De Maleissye Melun & Terry Amos
runners.comment: Last seen in June 2023 when doubling his tally over fences in a 2m4f handicap at Southwell
runners.name: Coupdebol
runners.spotlight: Last seen in June 2023 when doubling his tally over fences in a 2m4f handicap at Southwell (good; same mark); whether he's the same force now has to be questionable.

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon Et Al
runners.comment: 0-6 over fences; two quiet runs over hurdles since joining current yard
runners.name: Starman

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Michael Ronayne

quotes.race: Parkway Shopping Centre Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Starman is a bridle horse and finds nothing but he's won three races - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Did well in Ireland but lost his way last season and nothing positive to take from his two runs for current yard; returns to fences here (0-6) and hard to be at all confident.

runners.comment: A bit to prove after his recent efforts, but he is a dual C&D winner
runners.name: Treaty Boy
runners.spotlight: In contention when brought down at the second-last at Kelso (2m1f, good) in October; beaten 15l into second next time so that was a backward step and lesser runs followed; now has a bit to prove, but he is a dual C&D winner.

stable_tour.quote: Bought after finishing second in an Irish point in December 2022, he's taken time to settle in and find his feet. He's run in three novice hurdles this season and I'd like to think he can recapture something like his point form now he's going handicapping at his own level. He may go straight over fences. 24-01-24

runners.comment: She's due a 2lb drop and 5lb out of the weights, so essentially 7lb wrong
runners.name: Zaras Universe

prev_owners.owner: Mrs C Hopper And David Carter

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Zara's Universe won two last year and the handicapper has has given her a chance today, plus we've put that good young kid William (Maggs) on board. To be fair to Brian Hughes, he said to put the headgear on last time he rode her so we brought her down to two miles, put headgear on, and everyone's happy - Andrew Crook, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.spotlight: Ran respectably at Southwell two runs back but disappointing either side of that run; she's due a 2lb drop and 5lb out of the weights, so essentially 7lb wrong.

14:40.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Goes well here in both codes; only weakened out of late on over C&D 16 days ago
runners.name: Bollin Neil
runners.spotlight: Goes well here on the Flat and over jumps; only weakened out of late on over C&D 16 days ago; should run well.

runners.comment: Back on a good mark but will need to improve plenty on his last three efforts
runners.name: The Wise Traveller

quotes.race: Newlands Developments Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were despairing of The Wise Traveller last year and nearly sent him to the sales but this year he's done nothing but improve. It was a low-grade race but he did it well - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Has dipped 1lb beneath the mark he won off at Plumpton in September (3m1f, good) but will need to step up on his subsequent efforts under similar conditions.

runners.comment: Winning hurdler; quiet stable debut was chase debut on ground perhaps too soft
runners.name: Lathan
runners.spotlight: Won a match over hurdles for Rebecca Menzies last season and wasn't beaten too far in a 2m4f handicap; pulled up on final run for that yard and ran poorly on debut for this one, though that was his chase debut on ground perhaps too soft.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to the Scottish National winner Macdermott and, although he was very green first time out over hurdles, he shows loads of ability and looks a future chaser. He had a very good summer break and has undoubtedly improved for it. 16-10-24

runners.comment: Beaten 11l on soft last time over 3m; could last longer under these conditions
runners.name: Coral Blue

quotes.race: Summer Party Pack Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Coral Blue worked well during the week so we were quietly confident. He was getting all the concessions. We'll see what the handicapper does and there's no reason why he can't go back on the Flat - Seamus Fahey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Exposed five-time winner over hurdles; all his best form is over shorter but didn't run too badly over 3m at Musselburgh (from the front) and could last longer under these conditions.

runners.comment: Modest last run but had previously been placed in 3m1f/2m3f handicaps at Hereford
runners.name: Knightsbridge
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; placed in 3m1f/2m3f good-ground handicaps at Hereford before a lesser show at Taunton (3m); probably has a race in him off this mark.

runners.comment: Has won a 2m7f handicap but has finished tailed off in 2m5f/3m1f handicaps after year out
runners.name: Twoplacesatonetime
runners.spotlight: Has won a 2m7f handicap but has finished tailed off in 2m5f/3m1f handicaps after a year out.

runners.comment: On a good mark and finally perked up when a 4l third over C&D 16 days ago
runners.name: Rebel Intentions

quotes.race: Grundon Waste Management Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I always thought Rebel Intentions wanted this ground and Joe gave him an absolute peach and won the race from the front. I was going to go back over fences with him but, while he's winning, maybe we will stick over hurdles and see how far he can go - Emma Lavelle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Struggled on his final few runs for Emma Lavelle but finally perked up when a 4l third over C&D 16 days ago; his last win was off 15lb higher.

runners.comment: Nearly win an Irish point so could improve for this stiffer stamina test on handicap debut
runners.name: Reliance Kid
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly tailed off in his three races over hurdles at up to 2m3f, but he did nearly win an Irish point at 3m so could improve for this stiffer stamina test on handicap debut.

runners.comment: An eight-race maiden and was tailed off at Newcastle last month after a break
runners.name: King Casey
runners.spotlight: An 11l fourth of nine in a novice handicap at Market Rasen (3m, good) in June but was tailed off at Newcastle last month after a break; not that convincing.

runners.comment: 3m winner off 3lb lower; respectable efforts the last twice and has each-way claims
runners.name: East Eagle
runners.owner: Mrs Janet Cooper & M E Sowersby
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 18 starts came over 3m at Southwell last April off 3lb lower; respectable efforts the last twice and has each-way claims.

runners.comment: Seems very hit and miss and has yet to convince over this sort of trip
runners.name: Matoury
runners.spotlight: Won off a similar mark at Market Rasen in June but seems very hit and miss and has yet to convince over this sort of trip.

runners.comment: Two seconds on good ground before an excusable defeat on heavy a month ago
runners.name: Zeezee
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Perth (3m) and Sedgefield (2m5f; again on good) before an excusable defeat on heavy a month ago; definite chance back on this surface with cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Both wins under rules were in 2022 and very opposable on this season's form
runners.name: West Lawn
runners.spotlight: Both wins under rules came over slightly shorter trips at Hexham in 2022; very opposable on this season's form.

runners.breeder: E A R L Pestour, C Pestour & N Pestour
runners.comment: Has a strike-rate of 1-35, arrives here in no form and he's 2lb out of the weights
runners.name: Foxs Socks

prev_owners.owner: The Lost My Socks Racing Syndicate

runners.spotlight: Has a strike-rate of 1-35, arrives here in no form and he's 2lb out of the weights.

stable_tour.quote: I like him and he should have won a jumpers' bumper at Wolverhampton. He's coming along and loves his jumping. 09-11-20

runners.comment: No wins in ten but ran one of her better races when 8l off the winner at Wetherby
runners.name: Fancy Nancy Pants
runners.spotlight: No wins in ten but ran one of her better races when 8l off the winner at Wetherby (3m, soft) five days ago; possibilities despite being 2lb wrong.

runners.comment: This is easier than last time and he's on a good mark if able to recapture some form
runners.name: Byron Hill
runners.spotlight: Didn't last long over fences and failed to fire on a recent return to hurdling; however, this is easier and he's on a good mark if able to recapture some form.

stable_tour.quote: He's a very nice horse. He had a lovely run last time when third at Carlisle in a race that's working out well. The ground was on the soft side for him then, so we'll look for better ground. He'll go for another hurdle race over Christmas if the ground is right or he could have a run on the all-weather. We'll probably go chasing with him next season. 11-12-24

runners.comment: Went up 8lb for winning at Sedgefield but still ran well in defeat at Musselburgh
runners.name: John Betjeman

prev_owners.owner: Robin Gillard, Rory Gillard, Tim Seegar

quotes.race: Thatchers Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: John Betjeman is terrible in front but he's game and we're lucky to have him. There's been a few seconds and he's been unlucky in life, but he's run 75 times and won more than 70,000GBP in prize money, so we feel fortunate to have him around. He's been incredibly sound, we've never had a problem with him, and he'll be out in the paddock before he goes to bed. He's an amazing horse and we're delighted he's done it. My son Fergus rang me up and mentioned the visor. We've had the blinkers on and off to keep him sweet but luckily it worked. We had a bottle of champagne after he won and we'll be getting another! -  Mark Gillard, trainer.

runners.spotlight: High-mileage veteran; went up 8lb for his successful debut for this yard at Sedgefield (2m1f, soft) but still ran well at Musselburgh and could easily have finished closer; considered.

runners.comment: Form lacks substance but could still be interesting for respected yard now into handicaps
runners.name: Killycarn
runners.spotlight: Only five ran when third at Sedgefield and tailed off either side of that; could still be interesting for a respected yard now into handicaps.

runners.comment: Pulled up on return to hurdling in November but has the form to feature in this
runners.name: Bodygroove
runners.spotlight: 1m6f winner and won over hurdles at Wetherby early last year off 1lb lower; did pull up on his return to hurdling in November but couldn't rule out.

runners.comment: 0-8 over hurdles but was close up at Market Rasen last time despite racing keenly
runners.name: Wind Your Neck In
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins; 0-8 over hurdles but was close up at Market Rasen last time despite racing keenly; has some sort of chance.

runners.comment: Won only previous hurdle run in 2023; competitive on the Flat in 2025
runners.name: Gozo

quotes.race: Savills Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gozo is a nice horse and is so gifted and he knows it but he always just does enough. He'll school big and bold first time then he'll go low so I said to Dad I thought this would just be like a schooling session for him and someone must've heard it because he got backed off the boards. We'll probably give him another run, he idled rather than got tired there, but he'd probably go to Musselburgh - Ben Brookhouse, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Useful Flat maiden who won a juvenile hurdle at Plumpton in 2023 on sole previous run over jumps; not at his best on the Flat in 2025 but ran okay; wouldn't be without hope on this belated return to jumping and handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He had a small setback after his Plumpton win, where he idled late on having gone from the front. We were going to run him in the Triumph Hurdle trial at Cheltenham ithis month but he'll probably be back out early next year. He can dominate small fields but whether he's good enough to be competitive in the big leagues remains to be seen. There's a chance we could send him to the US in late spring to try to pick up some prize-money over hurdles and potentially sell him on. 30-11-23

runners.comment: Never figured last time after a wind operation and he's moved yards for 5,500gns
runners.name: Character Testing

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Character Testing has bumped into a few nice horses and it's great to get his nose in front. He'd been doing absolutely nothing wrong in defeat. We wanted to get the ball rolling on the all-weather, so it's great to get on the board as quickly as we could. You're back to zero on the first of January and we want to kick on for hopefully another good year - Tom Clover, trainer.

runners.spotlight: AW winner; has placed form over hurdles but never figured last time after a wind operation and he's moved yards for 5,500gns.

runners.comment: Latest below-par run was only a day after winning at Uttoxeter; still on a good mark
runners.name: Cawthorne Banker
runners.spotlight: Has won handicaps at Fontwell and Uttoxeter this season; his lesser effort at Stratford (subsequently disqualified after rider failed to weigh in) was just one day after that last success and can be forgiven; remains well handicapped on older form.

stable_tour.quote: A nice individual who is a half-brother to Nina The Terrier. He surprised us with how well he ran on his debut in a bumper at Worcester. The penny was starting to drop at the end and you'd hope he'd go close in a bumper next time. I'd imagine we'll stick in bumpers this season as he still has some filling out to do. 25-10-22

runners.comment: Well held on recent Flat start; only 1-13 over hurdles but he's down to very workable mark
runners.name: Lahire
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on the Flat 13 days ago after two months off; only 1-13 over hurdles but he's down to a very workable mark.

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner but has an unconvincing record over hurdles (0-6) and others preferred
runners.name: Susiesparkle

prev_owners.owner: J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L Mcgurty
J Fyffe, A Edmondson & L Mcgurty

runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner but has an unconvincing record over hurdles (0-6) and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Poor on heavy at Clonmel; better ground will suit but vulnerable to less exposed rivals
runners.name: Eco Pete

quotes.race: Molson Coors Beverage Company INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Eco Pete was quite good. He stayed well and he's fit. We might put him away and bring him back in the spring - John McConnell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper winner but 0-16 over jumps; went close when third at Downpatrick last May (2m3f, good); third at Cork (18.5f) in August; tailed off on heavy at Clonmel last month; better ground will suit but vulnerable to less exposed rivals.

runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner; each-way possibilities if he takes to hurdling at the first try
runners.name: Ehteyat
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner; bolted up in Listowel handicap (1m6f, heavy) in September and in good form off higher marks since; each-way possibilities if he takes to hurdling at the first time of asking.

runners.comment: Has a squeak here judged on his sixth to Jasmin De Vaux in Navan maiden hurdle last winter
runners.name: Mr Rango

quotes.race: Play Novileague At Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Rango is tough and loves the ground, he just stays and gallops all day. He might jump a hurdle on the back of that - Katie O'Sullivan, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Gormanlough Apprentice Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were waiting on the rain all year, he is a grand type but he needs the rain for his stamina to kick in. It is great for his owners and hopefully he can do it again - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer Mr Rango

runners.spotlight: Rated 72 on the Flat and 3-31; would have a squeak here judged on his sixth to Jasmin De Vaux in Navan maiden hurdle last winter; has changed yards since down the field in Curragh premier handicap; Darragh O'Keeffe a noteworthy booking.

runners.comment: Runner-up to hotpot at Ayr last month (2m, heavy); yard in exceptional form; player
runners.name: Stede Bonnet
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner in the summer on decent ground; disappointed on hurdles bow at Galway in August; big step forward when runner-up to hotpot at Ayr last month (2m, heavy); yard in exceptional form; player.

stable_tour.quote: He won bumpers at Clonmel and Bellewstown. Galway didn't go to plan on his hurdles debut, but he's better than that. He wants nice ground. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Form of his thirds in a bumper and hurdle has worked out well; drop in trip can suit
runners.name: Arslan
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point; third in a strong Fairyhouse bumper on rules debut last February (form has worked out); led for most of the way when third at Thurles on hurdles bow (2m4f, good to yielding); the runner-up has since won a maiden hurdle by 16l; leading contender down in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't win a bumper, although he shaped quite nicely in one at Fairyhouse in February. He wants a trip and was second in his point for Richard Black. He'll head straight over jumps with a view to starting him off in staying maiden hurdle. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Third in Clonmel bumper; never a factor on hurdles bow at Wexford on return in October
runners.name: Ballyteigue Bay
runners.spotlight: Beaten 16l into third in Clonmel bumper on debut; never a factor on hurdles bow at Wexford on return in October; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Only modest late headway when midfield at Naas (2m3f) last month; needs to find plenty
runners.name: Jaynemax
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in bumper and first hurdles start; only modest late headway when midfield at Naas (2m3f) last month; needs to find plenty.

runners.comment: Dam bumper/2m hurdle winner, sister to 2m hurdle/2m4f chase winner; market can reveal more
runners.name: Marian Avenue
runners.spotlight: Dam bumper/2m hurdle winner, sister to 2m hurdle/2m4f chase winner Rose Alice, half-sister to winners Aodhan May (2m4f-3m1f hurdle/chase) and Mary B (bumper), out of 2m6f hurdle winner; market will reveal expectations.

runners.comment: Runner-up in Tipperary bumper last May; betting will reveal clues on stable/hurdles debut
runners.name: Only For Our Man
runners.spotlight: Won Kirkistown maiden point in November 2024, the sole win of five point starts; runner-up in Tipperary bumper (2m2f, good to yielding) last May; betting will reveal clues on stable/hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Placed in 2-6 point-to-points; first run for Eoin Doyle; hurdles bow; absence to overcome
runners.name: Poppycon
runners.spotlight: Placed in 2-6 point-to-points; first run for Eoin Doyle; hurdles bow; absence to overcome.

runners.comment: Pulled up at Clonmel on debut; out of sight behind Arslan last month; safe to rule out
runners.name: Quietrunsthedon
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at Clonmel on debut; beaten out of sight behind Arslan last month; safe to rule out.

runners.comment: Dam 2m/2m4f hurdle winner, sister to bumper/2m5f hurdle winner Pure Anticipation; watch
runners.name: Awaywith The Mixer
runners.spotlight: Dam 2m/2m4f hurdle winner, sister to bumper/2m5f hurdle winner Pure Anticipation, half-sister to 2m5f hurdle winner Pure Genius, out of 3m-3m4f hurdle/chase winner; likely best watched.

runners.comment: Always behind in two maiden hurdles to date; others preferred
runners.name: The Cobblers Wife
runners.spotlight: Big price when in rear in the maiden won by the smart Koktail Brut at Punchestown in November; always behind at same venue three weeks ago.

runners.comment: Bumper/maiden hurdle winner; best form on soft or heavy; in poor form; handicap debut
runners.name: Icare Daubrelle

quotes.race: Jordan's Centra Supporting Kill GAA (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Icare D'Aubrelle has a great constitution for work, he has a great body and you can throw anything at him and it doesn't matter to him. He's not a horse that needs time, he's just a racehorse and I'm lucky to have him - Tom Cooper, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Bumper winner in 2022 twice went missing since but returned last season, winning a maiden hurdle at Fairyhouse; however, has been poor in three runs this season (including two chase starts); wouldn't want the ground to dry out; cheekpieces; handicap bow.

runners.comment: Can refuse to race; Sean Flanagan back on a plus; fair mark back hurdling; chance
runners.name: Luminous Light

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

quotes.race: Albert Bartlett Triple Crown Series At Punchestown Festival 2025 Qualifier Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Luminous Light is a bit forward and keen-going. I couldn't really get him switched off and a couple fell in front of him which buzzed him up. I thought he had a bit left in the locker over hurdles and if the ground is suitable for the final at Punchestown hopefully he'd have a chance - Sean Flanagan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Dermot Casey Tree Care Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Luminous Light is a horse we thought a bit of. I think he'll handle any ground but you will see the best of him on better ground - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Can give trouble at the start (refused to line up twice in October); took well to fences, landing Punchestown novice in November (2m, heavy); always behind at Newbury on latest; Sean Flanagan back on is a plus (aboard for all four wins over jumps); fair mark back hurdling.

runners.comment: Won maiden hurdle over C&D in August; form of latest handicap run looks very strong
runners.name: Captain Ryan Matt
runners.spotlight: Won maiden hurdle over C&D in August (16.5f, good); improved form in handicaps when third at Punchestown in November; the winner landed a hat-trick in style since, while the runner-up would probably have won a Limerick Grade 2 during Christmas but for a mistake at the last; leading contender.

runners.comment: Form regressed for the Moores last season; makes Irish/stable debut after layoff; watch
runners.name: Jupiter Du Gite

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Jupiter Du Gite is  an interesting character and has his own way of doing things but Niall [Houlihan] has played a big role with him. He rides him out every day and has tried various things to try and get him to switch off. He has a lot of ability but it's a case of trying to get him to channel it the right way - Hayley Moore, stable representative.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club Join For Free 'Introductory' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I'm totally shellshocked. Jupiter Du Gite is cranky - he's mad in the head. He'd behaved himself impeccably today except when I saddled him and he went through the roof twice in the saddling box. Whether he's got an easy lead up front or loves bad, bad ground, I don't know -  Gary Moore, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Front-runner who can race keenly; went close on chase reappearance for the Moores last season at Fontwell (2m3f, good to soft); headed at final fence at Sandown next time; pulled up at Windsor and Sandown since; market will reveal expectations after layoff on Irish/stable debut back hurdling.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well on his comeback at Fontwell and showed he's better off being left to bowl along. He needs a bit of time between his races and slow ground but he jumps well and we'll try to make the most of this season with him. 29-10-24

runners.comment: Weakened at Navan on latest (2m5f, heavy) but well treated relative to chase mark of 135
runners.name: Fighting Fit

quotes.race: Lord Hemphill Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Fighting Fit had niggly problems and it was great to get him back to his best. He got a little break since Punchestown and he could go on to Listowel - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fighting Fit built on his Punchestown win although I don't know how strong a race it was. He's a horse who you wouldn't pull out too quickly and wants space between his runs - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

quotes.race: Punchestown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fighting Fit was suited by coming back in trip. He travelled well today and jumped well, his jumping can be overly exuberant at times - Philip Dempsey, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Better chaser; generally well below best last season; performed encouragingly in Galway handicap hurdle (2m6f, yielding) on return despite slipped saddle; led most of the way when weakening at Navan on latest (2m5f, heavy); well treated relative to chase mark of 135.

runners.comment: Point/maiden hurdle winner; rookie trainer had gamble foiled at Leopardstown on Monday
runners.name: Black Soul
runners.spotlight: Won point-to-point and Down Royal maiden hurdle in the spring on good ground; made it 0-16 on the Flat when never a factor at Navan in October; first run for rookie trainer who had major gamble foiled at Leopardstown on Monday so market watch advised.

runners.breeder: M Jean-Louis Berger, M Cesare Gallorini-Berger & Mme Alexand
runners.comment: In good form, second to a progressive rival at Fairyhouse last month; bang there again
runners.name: Kentucky Beach
runners.spotlight: Some fair runs in maidens; ran a cracker when just denied on handicap debut at Gowran (2m, heavy); second to progressive rival at Fairyhouse last month (2m, soft) with the pair well clear; jumping can be sketchy but the one to beat providing he handles drying ground.

runners.comment: Needs to improve markedly on his most recent efforts at Punchestown and Thurles
runners.name: My Gaffer

quotes.race: Killarney Oaks Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: On a track like this over 2m4f, we hoped it would suit My Gaffer. You'd imagine he would be able to pick up another hurdle, some of the summer tracks will suit him for picking up another chase - Danny Mullins, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Monksgrange Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: My Gaffer promised a lot. We ran in in some big handicap hurdles and he was too small, he got crowded out. He's a brilliant little jumper and I would say some of those summer Nationals around the likes of Ballinrobe will be the races for him. He's a nice little horse - John Ryan, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: He was gutsy and tenacious and even when the horse came to him My Gaffer kind of picked up a bit - Walter O'Connor, representing the owner.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles and chase winner is rated 11lb lower over timber although needs to improve markedly on his most recent efforts at Punchestown and Thurles; rider's claim a positive.

runners.comment: Pulled up at both Leopardstown and Limerick last March; best form is over much further
runners.name: Toofareastiswest

quotes.race: Molony Cup Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: This is my first winner now for a good few years. Toofareastiswest deserved his turn, he's improved every day he's ran. He had a good long break before he came back and he's improved every day so we'll go for something similar. We need to get the right ground and distance for him so we'll see what's available - Arthur O'Grady, trainer.

quotes.race: Locke Burger (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Toofareastiswest had a couple of good runs. The better ground here seemed to suit him better than when pulling up last time. We'll keep him going for the summer and he'll go over fences sooner rather than later - Eoghan O'Grady, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Pulled up at both Leopardstown and Limerick last March; best form is over much further than this; veteran is hard to fancy on his return.

runners.comment: All three wins over hurdles; not ruled out back over timber; never won off mark this high
runners.name: Duke Otto
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer is 3-22 over hurdles, including a handicap here in 2023 over 2m; fair run on AW when last seen in November; not ruled out back over timber but has never won off mark this high.

runners.comment: Fourth in 2m Cork handicap hurdle in November but needs to raise his game further
runners.name: Ellaat

quotes.race: Two-Mile Borris Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ellaat has had too tough runs here in a fortnight so we'll see how he comes out of it, but we'll try and get another run into him before the ground goes - Noel Kelly, trainer.

quotes.race: Leugh Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ellaat is a game, wee buck. I thought the ground was going to be too soft for him but he got away with it - Noel Kelly, trainer.

quotes.race: Bay Leaf Handicap
quotes.quote: Ellatt normally wings the gates but he walked out of the stalls today and I had stopped watching to be honest. He's a big weak horse and Killian thinks the track didn't suit him. He's improving all the time and we'll probably take our time with him - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 4-22 over hurdles, but has not been in great form in either code for a while; okay effort when fourth in Cork handicap hurdle in November (2m, yielding to soft) but needs to raise his game further.

runners.comment: She had been running well in defeat on the Flat last year; yet to convince over timber
runners.name: Beautiful Chaos
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-29 on Flat; 0-5 over hurdles; her win came over three years ago which doesn't inspire, but she had been running well in defeat on the Flat last year; yet to convince over timber.

runners.comment: Point/bumper winner is yet to convince in three hurdles starts but has a chance in this
runners.name: St Lawrences Well
runners.spotlight: Point winner; off the mark on second bumper run at Kilbeggan; forced pace on hurdles debut in 3m Cork novice, ultimately no match for lesser-fancied stablemate; disappointing next time at Clonmel; weakening when a faller (sent off favourite) at Thurles on latest; this looks easier.

runners.comment: Best bumper run was on yielding ground; last two runs forgiven in the mud; stable flying
runners.name: American Jukebox
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to the yard's useful American Mike; best of three bumper runs when second in 2m4f event at Leopardstown (yielding) last Christmas; poor on next two outings on soft/heavy, including on hurdles bow when behind Pookie Holler; much better expected on drying ground in first-time cheekpieces up in trip; stable in tremendous form.

stable_tour.quote: I liked the look of him when he finished second in his point for Donnchadh Doyle at Stowlin. He looked like he might win that day for a long way and from what we've seen from him he seems nice. He'll be ready to run in a bumper over the next month. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Has had his issues but the form of his last two hurdle starts looks strong; big player
runners.name: Did I Ask You That
runners.spotlight: Second in a bumper in 2022; third to The Big Westerner in Punchestown maiden hurdle over this trip in November 2024; slipped up before three out when travelling well in that same race on return from absence (form franked); clearly has had his issues but must be considered.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he ran a cracker in the maiden hurdle at Punchestown on Sunday. He travelled well for a long way and left his bumper form behind. That sets him up for a nice season and we'll try to find a suitable maiden hurdle for him now. I was delighted with him. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Good bumper run here; step up in trip could unlock more but might be one for handicaps
runners.name: Moon Mission
runners.owner: J T Oconnor & M P Gleeson & P M Fortune & A Mcgonigle
runners.spotlight: Ran in four bumpers, best effort a fair third here in October; well beaten in first two hurdles starts; step up in trip could unlock more but might be one for handicaps.

runners.comment: Back from absence with staying-on fourth of 18 at Punchestown, ahead of American Jukebox
runners.name: Pookie Holler
runners.spotlight: Placed in sole point start; failed to make much impression in Naas maiden hurdle last December; back from absence with staying-on fourth of 18 at Punchestown (2m3f, heavy) last month, ahead of American Jukebox; player.

runners.comment: Never a factor on bumper debut at Clonmel in November; hard to recommend on hurdles bow
runners.name: River Kingdom
runners.spotlight: Never a factor on bumper debut at Clonmel in November; difficult to recommend on hurdles bow.

runners.comment: Modest record of 1-10 in points; tailed off in all three starts under rules; can rule out
runners.name: The Last Minute
runners.spotlight: Modest record of 1-10 in points; tailed off in all three starts under rules; safe to rule out.

runners.comment: Flat-bred; dam placed 5f/6f, out of 5f Group 3 winner; market can reveal expectations
runners.name: Two Can Plan
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred; eighth foal; half-brother to 1m AW winner Miniskirt (RPR 86) and Greek 6f winner Tulloona; dam placed 5f/6f (58), out of 5f Group 3 winner; market will reveal expectations.

runners.comment: Never a factor in two bumpers and on hurdles debut at Wexford; impossible to recommend
runners.name: Hunters Girl
runners.spotlight: Never a factor in two bumpers and on hurdles debut at Wexford; impossible to recommend on that evidence.

runners.comment: Won C&D chase in November; good form since; lower hurdles mark here turned out quickly
runners.name: Aclass
runners.spotlight: Good form over fences of late, winning C&D beginners' in November (soft) before runner-up in Thurles handicap (25.5f); solid fourth at Limerick (22.5f, soft to heavy) three days ago; contender turned out quickly off lower hurdles mark.

runners.comment: Sligo is his favoured track; in good form but might want further than this
runners.name: Ilbdare
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Sligo back in May from 10lb lower (3m2f, good); bounced back from two tame efforts when runner-up at his local track in October (25.5f); up 2lb for that; might want further than this judged on his remote C&D third last April.

runners.comment: Got up late to land a gamble here last time and the form has been franked; big chance
runners.name: Pebble Bleu
runners.spotlight: Chase runner-up at this track last May and landed a late gamble when getting up late here (2m5f, soft) off 90 in November; the third won a Limerick handicap during Christmas to boost the form; big player from 4lb higher.

runners.comment: Has fared best in bumpers; finished a long way behind in two handicaps; new headgear now
runners.name: Ardera Gun
runners.spotlight: Has fared best in bumpers; finished a long way behind in two handicaps; new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Non-stayer in Thurles chase (25.5f) on latest; dual winner around here; not ruled out
runners.name: Maciver

quotes.race: Copper Coast Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maciver was sharpened up by the cheekpieces. He was very lethargic last time, he jumped well and stayed well - Phillip Enright, rider.

runners.spotlight: Reeled off a four-timer (three chases and one handicap hurdle) earlier this year; good second at Clonmel last month; looked a non-stayer in Thurles chase (25.5f) on latest; dual winner around here; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Went close in C&D handicap last April off 91 but no sign of that form since
runners.name: Mullanour
runners.spotlight: Went close in C&D handicap last April off 91 but no sign of that form since; pulled up at Fairyhouse last month; comes with risks attached.

runners.comment: Tailed off last time at Limerick (heavy) but could figure on better ground; new headgear
runners.name: Chasing Crowns
runners.spotlight: Dropped a total of 9lb before finding her level in finishing close-up third in 20-runner contest at Down Royal in October (24.5f, good to yielding); tailed off last time at Limerick (heavy) but could figure on better ground; new headgear combination.

runners.comment: Visor applied on second run for shrewd local yard so watch the betting closely
runners.name: Lady Nightingale
runners.spotlight: Shown very little this season, including when tailed off on stable debut over fences at Thurles in November; visor applied on second run for shrewd local yard so watch the betting closely.

runners.comment: Good third here on penultimate so he's in the mix if he can bounce back from awful effort
runners.name: Oogum Boogum
runners.spotlight: Maiden had been running well in defeat prior to bombing out when joint-favourite at Punchestown three weeks ago; good third here on penultimate (2m5f, soft) so he's in the mix if he can bounce back.

runners.comment: Plugged on well when 5.5l sixth of 16 at Clonmel (19.5f, heavy) last month; considered
runners.name: Roccabaker
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-9 under rules but fine effort when 2l runner-up at Wexford (2m4f, yielding) in October and plugged on well when 5.5l sixth of 16 at Clonmel (19.5f, heavy) last month; considered.

runners.comment: Runner-up here (2m5f, soft) in November, one place ahead of Oogum Boogum; each-way chance
runners.name: Pleasureofpressure
runners.spotlight: Maiden but consistent of late, staying on for fourth over 2m4f at Punchestown (good to yielding) before good runner-up here (2m5f, soft) in November, one place ahead of Oogum Boogum; each-way possibilities.

runners.comment: 4l fourth to Pebble Bleu here on latest, every chance until furlong marker; same mark
runners.name: Amburana
runners.spotlight: Maiden never counted on October's handicap debut at Sligo (2m) but outran 50-1 odds and improved for step up in trip when 4l fourth of 13 behind Pebble Bleu here on latest, there with every chance up to the furlong marker; unchanged mark; in the mix.

runners.breeder: Mme Irene Scheldt & M Andrew Scheldt
runners.comment: No win since here (2m5f, soft) in November 2023 off this mark; penultimate run offers hope
runners.name: Blossom De Mai
runners.owner: J Humphreys/Exors Of The Late F Byrne/N Courtney/D Odwyer

prev_owners.owner: J Humphreys & F Byrne & N Courtney & D O Dwyer
Jonathan Humphreys & Felix Byrne & Nick Courtney
J Humphreys & F Byrne & N Courtney & P J Rothwell

runners.spotlight: On a losing run since winning here (2m5f, soft) in November 2023 off this mark; stayed on nicely over 2m6f at Listowel to take third in September; didn't appreciate shorter trip at Wexford on latest; could improve.

runners.comment: Remote 5th in this race last year; well beaten on return at Punchestown; others preferred
runners.name: Fancy Prospect
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; point winner has been disappointing over hurdles; finished a remote fifth in this race last year; well beaten on return at Punchestown; others preferred.

runners.comment: Won twice in the summer of 2024 but hard to fancy on what she's shown so far this season
runners.name: Cruisin Susan
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner, including over C&D; won twice in the summer of 2024 but is hard to fancy on what she has shown so far this season.

runners.comment: Still a maiden after 40 attempts under rules; makes no appeal; blinkers
runners.name: Glorious Singer
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 40 attempts under rules; placed five times over hurdles but not recently; makes no appeal; blinkers.

runners.comment: Caught the eye at Naas last month; fascinating handicap debutant if he gets in; reserve
runners.name: Fairlander
runners.owner: David Lestrange & Eric Newnham & William Esdaile
runners.spotlight: First reserve; one of three for yard; first sign of promise when fourth of 16 in Naas maiden hurdle last month (2m3f, soft to heavy), pushed out under hands and heels; fascinating handicap debutant if he gets a run.

runners.comment: Beaten out of sight on all 4 outings for this yard; hard to make a case for him; reserve
runners.name: Ballyredinkingston
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; beaten out of sight on all four outings for this yard; hard to make a case for him.

runners.comment: Weakened late when 7th at Limerick over this trip (soft to heavy) four days ago; reserve
runners.name: Drumcliff Bay
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; one of two for yard; weakened late when seventh at Limerick over this trip (soft to heavy) four days ago.

14:25.race_name: O'Driscoll's Irish Whiskey New Year's Day Chase (Grade 3)

runners.comment: Grade 1 novice winner turned out again after clipping heels at Leop'town four days ago
runners.name: Champ Kiely

quotes.race: Dooley Insurance Group Champion Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: From halfway down the back I knew I was going to play a big part in the race, from there it was a case of keeping a good jumping rhythm. Champ Kiely put his head down between the last two and a good jump at the last sealed it. It was his first run at that trip and that's probably where you're going to see the best of him - Danny Mulllins, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: I was always going to keep it as simple as I could. Champ Kiely loves jumping fences. To be honest, I thought we built up nicely from leaving the back straight and every time he heard the other horse coming he pulled out loads. I was always in control - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Bellshill Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely did everything as it should have been done; he galloped and jumped. Paul [Townend, jockey] was very happy that he was far more relaxed over fences than he had been over hurdles, which will hopefully bring about more improvement. The two miles and five furlongs Grade 1 at the Dublin Racing Festival is a race we will probably look at. He could easily step up in trip now he's much more relaxed - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: The Royal Bond was a bit of a messy race but Champ Kiely was only beaten four-and-a-bit lengths so I believed he had something like that in him - Danny Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Fitzgerald's Woodlands House Hotel Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely was very good, he showed stamina at Galway and he backed that up with speed today. He ticks a lot of boxes and he quickened here off a strong pace. Not many can do that - Danny Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Galway Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I was hoping Champ Kiely would win but didn't think he'd do anything like that. He's moved up a few places in our novice hurdlers for this season. That looked very good. He looks a real jumping sort. I know he is only starting his novice hurdle career, but I'm already looking forward to him going over fences. I think there was a lot of confidence behind the favourite, so to come out and beat a 102-rated Flat horse like that was very good. I'll have a chat with Michael [Masterson, owner] and go through all the rest of the horses for the year before making a plan, but he looks a smart type - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: Athea INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Champ Kiely is a big boy for a small girl. He was in my hands the whole way but when I went for him it took him a while to quicken up and he's still a bit green. He was doing all the right things at home and please God he is another nice one - Jody Townend, rider.

runners.spotlight: Grade 1 novice hurdle winner came back from a long absence last season and began a novice chase campaign; ended it with a Grade 1 win at Punchestown over 3m1f; a cracking second on return trying to give the classy Only By Night 11lb over 2m at Naas; turned out quickly after clipping heels early on at Leopardstown four days ago; the pick of Townend from the Mullins four; big chance.

stable_tour.quote: You would have to be delighted with the way he ran at Naas over a trip that would have been tight for him and giving plenty of weight to the winner. He's not going to be the easiest to place this season, but he's in the John Durkan and might go there. I'm sure we'll find something for him around Christmas as well. He won a Grade 1 race over three miles, so he's quite versatile with regard to trip. 17-11-25

He's not done a lot wrong since joining us, with four wins from five. The defeat was when fourth to Marine Nationale in the Royal Bond at Fairyhouse and that was a good run, only weakening after the last. He won his Grade 1 last time out when beating Irish Point to take the Lawlor's of Naas in early January. He's improving with every run and at the moment I think he'll be best suited by the Ballymore. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Dual Grade 1 novice winner; not at his best twice this term; needs more; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Croke Park

quotes.race: Racing Post Long Distance Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: To be completely honest, Croke Park disappointed me so much as a hurdler last year. I expected more from him. We had big expectations for him early on, but he was probably just so big and weak and needed time. He's come back in and gone chasing and has now won two Grade 1s already this season, so I'm delighted for Michael and Eddie [O'Leary]. Maybe he didn't jump as well as he did the last day. Sam [Ewing] said he slipped going into the first, but he won and that's the main thing. He's been busy enough and probably doesn't need to run again before Cheltenham. I don't think he wants real winter-heavy ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Croke Park won an average enough beginners chase here the last day. I didn't know if the form was strong enough for him to run here but he has run a great race. I imagine he will go to Leopardstown now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Croke Park has a lot of improvement in him. It wouldn't be a shock if he was to come back here for the Drinmore - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets & Flooring Monksfield Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Croke Park is a lovely horse. He didn't do much when he got there and he will probably enjoy stepping up to 3m - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Crottys Lake Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Croke Park jumped great. He loved that ground and you'll probably see the best of him when he goes out in trip and over fences in time. He's a massive horse and Kilbeggan wouldn't have suited him well so he didn't run a bad race that day. He was always going to be a winter type on big, galloping tracks. He jumped the two hurdles in the straight to his left the first time around but straightened out afterwards. The stable yard is down around there so he was probably looking at that - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Three wins over fences last season, including two Grade 1s, the Drinmore at Fairyhouse and Racing Post Long Distance Novice Chase at Leopardstown; ended the season on a low note at Aintree and hasn't recaptured his best in two starts this term; has to do better with cheekpieces added.

stable_tour.quote: We thought he might get tired at Punchestown and that's what he did. He'll improve enormously from that and over the next few days we have to decide whether to have a crack at the Grade 1 at Down Royal on Saturday or the Grade 2 for second-season novices instead. His next run will tell us whether he's one for the top staying chases or the big handicaps. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Grade 2 winner but well beaten at Thurles on return so has to get back to his best
runners.name: Classic Getaway

quotes.race: Red Mills Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Classic Getaway has been improving all season. Danny [Mullins, jockey] was keen to stress that the three fences in the straight made a big difference as his jumping brought him into the race without any effort and he had that final kick. It's nice for Cheveley Park to have a Red Mills winner. He ran well at Thurles on very quick ground and the different going here helped him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Make Your Best Bet At BetVictor Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Classic Getaway had some very good form last year. We were hoping he could do something like that. His jumping was so good and he is very agile for a horse of his size - Danny Mullins, rider

quotes.race: Noreside Catering Irish EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: b\Classic Getaway didn't fulfil potential last year, but to see him put his head down today and gallop to the line was nice - Danny Mullins, jockey.

quotes.race: Festival Hospitality (C & G) Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Classic Getaway was workmanlike. The hood had the desired effect in settling him and maybe it worked too well. He was probably just lazy in front and he had a good blow afterwards. There should be plenty of improvement in him - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Junction INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Classic Getaway is a beautiful horse with a great walk. He was a bit more expensive than a Rolls-Royce Phantom but I'm pretty sure Mrs Thompson will get more fun out of him than a Rolls Royce. This horse is a big baby for a five-year-old with a point-to-point run and that's why I was keen to teach him to stride out. He's not really a bumper horse and I'd imagine he'll go jumping. When the ground was so wet, we thought we'd get a run into him. Willie hasn't rushed him and let him settle in. I think he'll continue to improve mentally - Patrick Mullins, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; three chase wins including a Grade 2 at Gowran last year; however, wasn't as good since and was well beaten at Thurles on return so has to get back to his best.

stable_tour.quote: He had a setback after he beat Minella Cocooner in a beginners' chase at Gowran Park in the early part of last season and missed most of the campaign. We managed to get him back to run at Punchestown but it was a big ask for him there. He jumps well and looks like he has the makings of a nice staying chaser if we get a clean run with him. 13-11-23

He's not so highly tried as many of his stablemates, but he won comfortably at Punchestown last time. I feel he wants a trip which could mean the Ballymore for him as I wouldn't think he has enough experience for a race like the Albert Bartlett. 09-03-22

runners.comment: Has had jumping issues and has a lot of ground to make up on Champ Kiely from his return
runners.name: Ile Atlantique

quotes.race: Racing Post Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Ile Atlantique is a lot stronger horse since last season, which is a big help. We can go 2m or 2m4f with him now, so we will look at the Dublin Racing Festival and decide which way we will go - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Ile Atlantique has a real cut at his fences. I let him learn on the job too, I let him figure it out for himself once or twice. I could have let him out and wing everything but he learned a lot more the way things went today. He rides a much stronger horse this year. Last season he wasn't seeing out his races but I think he has just needed time and a fence will help there too. I like him a lot - Paul Townend, rider.

quotes.race: Gallagher Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (Registered As The Baring Bingham Novices' Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ile Atlantique has run well but I think he's a better horse than the bare form. I think maybe going over fences and coming back to two miles we could let him use his stride and that might be better for him - Patrick Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: I thought Ile Atlantique was very brave. Paul was very happy with him at all stages. He did all the donkey work and gave Daryl a tow the whole way, Daryl just really outstayed him late and the two of them stretched clear the whole way to the line. They are two good horses and the two of them handle good ground too. I said before the race that I thought it was the top novice hurdle run over the Christmas and New Year period in Ireland or Britain, and that it was going to tell everybody where they stood, so I am very happy that I had the first and second and that they all ran very well. Looking at that, Ile Atlantique could be a Supreme horse - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; was second in a Grade 1 as a hurdler and took well to fences last season, winning a Grade 2 at Naas over 2m; not as good since and has had jumping issues; has a lot of ground to make up on Champ Kiely from his return at Naas.

stable_tour.quote: He will come on massively for his comeback at Naas. Anyone who saw him walking round the parade ring beforehand would know he wasn't 100 per cent fit. That run will bring him on loads and I'd like to think you will see a different horse next time. I'm not sure he's a three-miler, so we'll stick to two or two and a half miles. Hopefully we can get his confidence back. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Grade 1-placed; a distant fourth in the John Durkan last time; go close if back to best
runners.name: Heart Wood

quotes.race: BetVictor Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Darragh [O'Keeffe] said Heart Wood will improve plenty and he really saw it out in the end. It probably just looked like he wasn't seeing out the three miles last year, but it's tempting to try it again. He travels so well and he's pacey. I was thinking about Kempton for him before today, the King George might suit. Today was to get started and we know he'll come on for it so we'll see. He's entered at Down Royal in a few weeks but I'd say that was unlikely. It's lovely to get his head in front today - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Ryanair Chase (Registered As The Festival Trophy) (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Heart Wood ran a cracker and he is only a baby and he is coming along really nicely. It was a really good race, and they went a savage pace, and the winner is obviously very good. I think this is the right trip for Heart Wood as I've tried him over three miles a couple of times and he just wasn't getting home, however he is only seven so we will see - Henry De Bromhead, trainer.

quotes.race: Michael Hickey Memorial Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Heart Wood. Darragh [O'Keefe, jockey] did great and I thought he did everything right. His jumping was a little sticky at the start, but he certainly warmed up to it and I loved the way he picked up - he looked great. He's definitely pacey, but I wouldn't want to discount three miles just on his Aintree run - we'll have a look at it again. We think he's still eligible for the Drinmore, so if he is we'll have a look at that. He's still a young horse who could keep improving - Henry De Bromhead, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: O'Driscolls Irish Whiskey Leopardstown Handicap Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Heart Wood had a couple of nice runs in beginners chases and in all fairness it seemed a reasonable mark. We said we'd aim for here today and we're delighted to win this. We'll see what the handicapper thinks and then sit down and decide where we go - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner, including a Punchestown Grade 3 on return this term; has run well in defeat in Grade 1 contests including the Ryanair at Cheltenham and a distant fourth in the John Durkan last time; should go close today if back to his best; local yard has won three of the last nine runnings.

stable_tour.quote: Second in last season's Ryanair, he won nicely at Punchestown in a Grade 3 chase on his return and should improve for the run. He'll be aimed at either the 1965 Chase at Ascot or the John Durkan, which are on the same weekend. I'd love to see him over three miles again - I find it hard to believe he doesn't stay. Hopefully, he might see it out a bit better this season. We'll see. 11-11-25

runners.breeder: A M Pommerai, Mme A Pommerai Et Al
runners.comment: Dual Grade 1 winner won the Topham at Aintree last term; poor at Clonmel but can do better
runners.name: Gentleman De Mee

quotes.race: Randox Supporting Prostate Cancer UK Topham Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: They went a very strong gallop the whole way. I missed the start - I wanted to pop Gentleman De Mee out handy, but the way things worked out, he stood at the start a little bit and I was at the back most of the way, but when I turned away from the stands going down to Bechers, he just started winging fences and getting himself a nice position. I knew they had gone quick and I was happy sitting there going into the fourth-last and the third-last, and going to the second-last I was lucky enough that a gap came off the rail, and I was able to scoot up there. The loose horse was no help to Johnny Burke, but made no real difference to me. This horse won a Grade One a couple of seasons ago and was second in the Champion Chase, so that was a fair performance off 11st 11lb. This is his time of year - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Betway Queen Mother Champion Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee has run a cracker. I'm delighted for Henry, delighted for Rachael, and our fellow has run a cracker, so we're delighted - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Dublin Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It's fantastic for Gentleman De Mee and great for Danny. I thought Danny was very brave on him and he was asking him everywhere the whole way down the back. The horse was loving it and responding to him. I thought it was a terrific performance. I was very happy with his last bit of work the other morning, I thought it was as good a gallop as I've ever seen him do. Things didn't go right for him at Christmas, possibly a little bit of drier ground here played to his strengths rather than Blue Lord's - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Tingle Creek Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Gentleman De Mee ran well and hit the line. We went a good, even gallop and I got a good spin. He stayed on again from the back of the last so it was a good run - Aidan Coleman, rider.

quotes.race: Poundland Maghull Novices' Chase (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were fresh coming here and we were hoping our freshness might be the right card to play and it looked like that. Mark was very good on Gentleman De Mee, he got him out and got him jumping. He was giving him a breather when he made a mistake at the fourth-last but Mark felt he was always in charge. He's improved in the last six or eight weeks, probably for a change of tactics and getting confidence winning races, rather than being held up and getting beaten earlier in the season. He's maturing and growing into himself, he's a big horse. I'm hoping there's more to come, we'll see if Mr McManus wants to go to Punchestown. He's entitled to be a contender in the Champion Chase. He's improved hugely - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Flyingbolt Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee is settling better, jumping better and settling into his game. He likes to get on with the job but Mark just thought he settled a fair bit better today, after the first two fences he said he was grand - Willie Mullins, trainer

quotes.race: BetVictor Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee did that very well and we will probably keep him at that trip. I imagine he is one we will keep at home for the nicer prizes - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Naas Business Club Members Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Gentleman De Mee had a setback early in the season so I hadn't done as much with him as I would have liked, his sheer ability got him through there. He would look more like a Ballymore horse to me, I think he will improve as he goes up in trip - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Fourth runner for yard; a dual Grade 1 winner over 2m earlier in his career, he put up a fine weight-carrying performance to win the Topham Trophy (2m5f) at Aintree last spring; beaten a long way at Clonmel on return but can do better today.

stable_tour.quote: He always needs his first run of the season and tends to come alive in the spring. He won the Topham last season so obviously likes Aintree, so we'll aim to get back there with him next April. 17-11-25

His first runs this season hardly set the world alight but he did a piece of work the week before the Dublin Racing Festival that was probably the best I'd ever seen him do. So we went for the Dublin Chase hoping he could translate that to the track as he was clearly in good form. We had Blue Lord in the race, who had attracted all the attention, and as a result Gentleman De Mee was like the forgotten horse. As it was Danny [Mullins] was very brave on him as he asked him everywhere down the back straight, and the horse answered every time. It was a very good performance and he heads for the Champion Chase. Obviously Energumene is the one to beat from our team but this fellow is thoroughly entitled to his place. 08-03-23

runners.comment: Won chase debut in 2023 but was poor in two further runs in this sphere; plenty to find
runners.name: Maxxum

quotes.race: Rathbarry & Glenview Studs Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Danny [Gilligan, jockey] is top class and gave Maxxum a beautiful ride. He missed the third last and apart from that it was poetry in motion. He suits this horse very well. It just didn't happen for him at Cheltenham, he was slow away at the start so we put a line through it. He's probably better in a smaller field and could be a horse to go for a race in France - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Boyne Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Maxxum had a good run at Gowran over 3m last time when he didn't get home. We thought dropping back to this trip would work well if he got a soft enough lead. Danny (Gilligan) was able to get a breather into him at the right time and he did it well. He'll go for the Coral Cup now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Race And Stay At Leopardstown Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Maxxum is a bit hot and cold and I thought the ground might have gone a bit soft for him. When you are in these handicaps you never know. We said we'd keep it simple, pop him out handy and see what happens - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Storm The Stars @ Coolagown Stud Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: It was a bit sticky and Maxxum was getting in tight, it was slow and he had no momentum going in and was backing off a bit. In fairness when we went on a stride he jumped better. Danny (Mullins) missed the fourth last and I actually jumped it well and I knew my lad would say so I said I'd keep the pressure on. I wanted to be clear going to the last in case he was going to be slow at it. He pricked his ears going to the line, he was just doing enough - Keith Donoghue, jockey, talking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Handicap Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: We thought Maxxum was well handicapped when he came to us. We're very happy with him - he was good today. He's going the right way so we'll see where we are. He shouldn't have much problem getting into the Pertemps Final now! He was probably a bit unlucky when beaten on his first start for us, and ours were all coming on for their runs at that stage. It was the inside track at Punchestown too that might just have been a bit tight - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tynan's Bridge House Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maxxum has a good race in him. We will have to think of something different next day - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Knocklofty Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Maxxum is a nice horse. We'll give him one more run before we put him away - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; seven hurdle wins including two at Grade 2 level last season; won chase debut in 2023 but was poor in two further runs in this sphere; has plenty to find in this company.

stable_tour.quote: He's won eight races now and picked up a couple of Grade 2s in the second half of last season. We'll probably start him back in the Lismullen Hurdle at Navan next month and take it from there. He's got a high rating, so he can be tricky to place, but he keeps winning nice races. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Was pulled up in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury on return; has questions to answer now
runners.name: Perceval Legallois

prev_owners.owner: Ms Kiva Obrien & Mrs J M Walker

quotes.race: Race And Stay At Leopardstown Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Perceval Legallois was very nimble over hurdles. I thought coming here he's a better chaser than he is a hurdler but he was good there. He's in the Grand National so we'll have to consider it - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

quotes.race: Paddy Power Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Perceval Legallois got me out of trouble! It didn't go to plan. I didn't want to be as far back as I was. They kicked on down the back straight and I was a good bit back, further than I wanted to be, but I weaved my way through and he winged the last. I thought coming down to the second-last I had a chance if he kept going the way he was going. I got a great kick out of that because the horse deserved it. He's been unlucky on his last few runs. I knew the ability was there but nothing went right on his last few runs - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: P.J. Foley Memorial INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: That was great from Percival Legallois. We've liked him and I was fairly confident he'd handle conditions. Obviously we were very afraid of Willie's horse coming here but I'm not one bit surprised because he has shown us plenty at home - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Six wins in all spheres, including the Paddy Power Chase at Leopardstown in 2024; fell early on in the Grand National then was pulled up in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury on return; has questions to answer now.

stable_tour.quote: He did well last season, winning the Paddy Power at Leopardstown over Christmas and then going back there to win over hurdles at the Dublin Racing Festival. He has an entry in the Coral Gold Cup. There's nothing set in stone - he could also go back over hurdles at some stage. 04-11-25

He's been a bit frustrating and the handicapper keeps pushing him up a little bit despite him not winning. He might just not be well handicapped anymore but hopefully he'll have a good chance in one of those staying handicap chases if things fall his way. 13-11-24

15:00.race_name: SIS Supporting Irish Racing Rated Novice Chase

runners.comment: Rated 120 over hurdles but poor in two British h'cap chases; can do better for this yard
runners.name: Blue Hop
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper and three hurdle races when trained in Britain; however, wasn't nearly as good in two handicap chase starts in 2024; could do better for a new yard; the market could be revealing.

stable_tour.quote: He's just had a wind operation, which we felt would help him after last season. He won a maiden hurdle at Ayr in February and then got outpaced on good ground at Cheltenham last season but we ran him there as we want to go back there with him this season. He's entered at Doncaster on Saturday but could run at Cheltenham in a beginners' chase in December. He's been schooling very well and doing everything really nicely. He'll likely have a bit to find on ratings at Cheltenham but that's only because he's unexposed. He was always going to be a much better chaser than hurdler. 30-11-23

runners.comment: Brought down early last time but was a close fifth at Punchestown before that; a player
runners.name: Cappucino

quotes.race: Farm & Home Store (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Cappucino has to race in front. Today he got a freebie. He is a speed horse so was able to use that on the good ground - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won a Listowel bumper and Punchestown maiden hurdle last season but failed to add to his tally in handicaps; three chase runs; brought down early last time but was a close fifth at Punchestown before that; a player.

runners.comment: Rated 109 over hurdles after easy win last time; a shout if jumping soundly on chasing bow
runners.name: Cowper Hall
runners.spotlight: Showed much-improved form to easily get off the mark over hurdles at Fairyhouse last time; now rated 109 in that sphere so has a shout if his jumping holds up on chasing debut.

runners.comment: Has run well over hurdles at this track so a shout if her jumping holds up on chasing bow
runners.name: Eye Of A Tiger
runners.spotlight: Kilbeggan maiden hurdle winner was out of her depth in stronger company three times since; has run well over hurdles at this track so a shout if her jumping holds up on chasing bow.

runners.comment: Third in a Clonmel novice handicap last time; one to consider for a local yard
runners.name: Femme Magnifique

prev_owners.owner: Sullivan Group Limited & Shane Hughes & Neill Hughes
Sullivan Bloodstock Limited & Shane Hughes & Neill Hughes
Sullivan Bloodstock Limited & Shane Hughes & Neill Hughes

runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner for Willie Mullins; best run in four chase starts for this local yard was a third in a Clonmel novice handicap last time; one to consider.

runners.comment: Not a lot of encouragement in six chase starts so others are preferred
runners.name: Little Mixup

quotes.race: Spring Festival Trials At Naas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Little Mixup had been freshened up nicely for this race. We weren't so sure about the ground but he relished it and he could win another - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Record of 4-32 over hurdles and has run well in defeat at this track; not a lot of encouragement in six chase starts so others are preferred.

runners.comment: Below form last two starts for Gordon Elliott; others preferred on debut for a local yard
runners.name: Ossifer Hops

prev_owners.owner: Cullentra Racing, J Mooney, Ray Moore Jnr
J A Mooney/Raymond Moore Jnr/Exors Of Late Raymond C Moore
J A Mooney & Raymond Moore Jnr & Raymond C Moore

runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner for Gordon Elliott but a maiden over fences and lost his form last two starts; others preferred on debut for a local yard.

stable_tour.quote: He's not the easiest horse to keep sound, but he's got a nice mark and could win a nice handicap somewhere along the line, probably over two and a half miles. 24-10-23

runners.comment: Third in a Navan handicap last time over this trip; the cheekpieces are retained; a squeak
runners.name: Rockbrook
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner including at this meeting a year ago; by far the best of three chase starts when third in a Navan handicap last time over this trip; the cheekpieces worn then are retained; a squeak.

runners.comment: Well beaten on his two completed chase starts lately; others have better credentials today
runners.name: Butter Fingers
runners.spotlight: Juvenile hurdle winner in 2024 has been well beaten on his two completed chase starts lately; others have better credentials today.

runners.comment: Hurdle winner made a solid start to chasing last time; drying ground can help; local yard
runners.name: Ag Obair Go Crua
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when winning over hurdles at Gowran (yielding); solid run on heavy ground making chasing debut at Clonmel; can improve from that and drying ground can help; local yard does well here.

runners.comment: Modest second in a Limerick maiden hurdle last time; has to jump better back over fences
runners.name: Castle Croiuil
runners.spotlight: Point winner was poor on handicap chase debut at Clonmel but a better effort when a modest second in a Limerick maiden hurdle since; has to jump better back over fences.

runners.comment: Won over this trip at Limerick 3 days ago; big chance of following up with a 7lb penalty
runners.name: Duffys Hodey

quotes.race: Vision Contracting Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He jumped much better today. I said to Shane to keep Duffys Hodey out wide because with the four fences up the back here if you can get into a rhythm it gives you a good chance. He jumped a bit high the last day in Fairyhouse, with his tail up in the air. It was lack of experience, I guess, and he was much more professional today. He's entered in Tramore and we'll see what happens - Philip Rothwell, trainer

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Play "1 - 2 - Free" On Football Novice Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffys Hodey got a 9lb penalty for the last day and I thought we might be goosed coming here. But with only seven runners and being able to drop him in, I thought we might have a chance - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilsheelan Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duffys Hodey had been placed a few times but it just wasn't happening, so deserved this. We'll head to Limerick at Christmas for another handicap and hopefully he isn't murdered for winning today - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: 112-rated hurdler took advantage of a much lower chase mark when winning over this trip at Limerick three days ago; has a big chance of following up with a 7lb penalty if he has recovered sufficiently.

runners.comment: Pulled up when last seen but had been runner-up twice prior to that; a squeak if ready
runners.name: College Causeway
runners.spotlight: Maiden was pulled up when last seen but had been runner-up over further twice prior to that on good ground; a squeak if ready on return; ran well over hurdles here.

runners.comment: A bit better over a furlong shorter than this here last time on handicap debut
runners.name: Nolans Rocco
runners.spotlight: Point winner was well beaten first three chase runs; was a bit better over a furlong shorter than this here last time on handicap debut; can do better.

runners.comment: Well beaten on second comeback run at Punchestown last time but can come on from that
runners.name: Ardaghs Choice

prev_owners.owner: Patrick Joseph Oshea & John N Gahan

quotes.race: Randox Health Rated Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ardaghs Choice just stays, he won over 3m1f the last day. He has been improving and he improved again. They went a good gallop which suited me because all he does is stay galloping - Kevin Sexton, rider.

runners.spotlight: Has a record of 1-22 over fences; well beaten on second comeback run at Punchestown last time but can come on from that.
