runners.comment: A record of 1-11 over fences but has been pulled up the last twice and isn't easy to fancy
runners.name: Mahler Appeal
runners.spotlight: A record of 1-11 over fences but has been pulled up the last twice and isn't easy to fancy.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way on chase debut at Thurles and pulled up back over hurdles since
runners.name: Volez Vous
runners.spotlight: Won twice over hurdles earlier last year; however, was beaten a long way on chase debut at Thurles and pulled up back over hurdles since so questions now; blinkers replace cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Runner-up all three chase starts including here last time; cheekpieces are added; run well
runners.name: Toor Moon
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden over hurdles but has been runner-up on all three chase starts recently, including over a bit shorter here last time; cheekpieces are added and should run well; locally trained.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden; refused to race at this venue last time; best to look elsewhere
runners.name: Fox Le Bel
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden over hurdles and fences; refused to race at this venue last time; best to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: C&D winner in August; poor back here in November but a solid hurdles run four days ago
runners.name: Likable Chancer
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner, the latest over C&D in August; disappointing back here in November but a solid hurdles run at Limerick four days ago; chance.

runners.comment: Lost his form for Phillip Rothwell over the summer; best watched on return for a new yard
runners.name: Cullenwaine
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-16 over fences; lost his form for Phillip Rothwell over the summer and best watched on return for a new yard.

runners.comment: Maiden over hurdles ran respectably sole chase start almost a year ago; others preferred
runners.name: Wild As Fire
runners.spotlight: Maiden over hurdles ran respectably on sole chase start almost a year ago; others preferred.

runners.comment: Is 0-17 over fences; beaten 18l at Thurles last time and needs much more
runners.name: Game And Glory
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; dual hurdle winner but is 0-17 over fences; beaten 18l at Thurles last time and needs much more.

runners.comment: Promise on handicap chase debut at this track last time; a player if getting in; reserve
runners.name: Notimelikedpresent
runners.spotlight: First reserve; unplaced in maiden hurdles and beginners' chases but there was more promise on handicap chase debut at this track last time; a player if getting a run.

runners.comment: Three of four chase wins have been here; better the ground the better his chance; reserve
runners.name: Lake Chad

quotes.race: Racing Again February 20th Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad winged the third last and I didn't want to disappoint him and I kept him rolling. He knows his job and he is some servant. He just sees out his races and he was always doing enough to win - Niall Moore, rider

quotes.race: McCarthy's Irish Bar Lexington Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad is better around here than anywhere else. He has won here before and has always run a good race here. He ran terrible the last day and I don't know why he ran so poor. The ground was soft in Roscommon that day. It was a big improvement today - Philip Fenton, trainer.

quotes.race: Waterford Chamber Of Commerce Beginners' Chase
quotes.quote: Lake Chad will maybe get a little break now and come back here for the August meeting - Philip Fenton, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Second reserve; three of his four chase wins have been here, albeit on better ground; not a bad run on soft back here last time; the more the track dries the better his chance.

runners.comment: Third at Naas over 2m before pulled up over 3m at Thurles; chance if rebounding; reserve
runners.name: Love Like This
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; longstanding maiden but has been placed several times over hurdles and fences; third at Naas over 2m before pulled up over 3m at Thurles lately; chance if rebounding.

runners.breeder: S A S Ecurie X & Mr Yannick Fouin
runners.comment: Last year's Triumph Hurdle fifth, a bit laboured at Clonmel; capable of raising her game
runners.name: Place De La Nation

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Place De La Nation was jumping so well early, but I didn't want to use that because I didn't want to let her on and end up giving her a grueller. There's plenty of improvement in her. She jumps like a buck, and I wasn't able to use my ace card today - Paul Townend, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.spotlight: Third at Auteuil (2m2f, very soft) on only French start; chased home odds-on stablemate Karoline Banbou over C&D in January; never far from the pace when fifth (third-best of her trainer's squad behind stablemate Poniros in the Triumph Hurdle); somewhat laboured when landing the odds over a staying trip at Clonmel six weeks ago; capable of raising her game.

stable_tour.quote: She wasn't beaten far in the Triumph Hurdle when fifth to Poniros and she's still a novice for this season, which is an added bonus. She has invaluable experience of Cheltenham, so I imagine she'll be a live one for the Mares' Novices' Hurdle at the festival in March. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Fair third over C&D on hurdling debut, appeared not to stay in a 2m5f Tramore maiden
runners.name: Moody Girl
runners.spotlight: Fair third over C&D on hurdling debut; appeared not to stay in a 2m5f Tramore maiden; tough task in this company.

runners.comment: Promise in bumpers before tailed off in Grade 2 Leopardstown event, no hurdling experience
runners.name: Shesakindofmagic
runners.spotlight: Promise in bumpers last season, notably when winning at Limerick's Christmas fixture; tailed off in Grade 2 Leopardstown event and absent since; lack of hurdling experience is a drawback.

runners.comment: Ordinary form in bumpers, this looks much too demanding for her hurdling debut
runners.name: Talas Kera
runners.spotlight: Ordinary form in bumpers; this looks much too demanding for her hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Expensive purchase after 2022 point win, Tramore third a small step in the right direction
runners.name: Working Away
runners.spotlight: Purchased for 330,000GBP after winning a point-to-point in October 2022; back from a prolonged absence with a modest effort in a Cork maiden hurdle (2m4f, yielding); Tramore third was a small step in the right direction; cheekpieces now added to to tongue-tie worn then.

stable_tour.quote: She's a mare who has been hard to train but she's back in good shape now and working well. Keep an eye on her. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Wide-margin winner of an academy hurdle on debut, looked smart at Newbury, interesting
runners.name: Highland Crystal

quotes.race: Coral "Daily Rewards Shaker" Fillies' Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Highland Crystal looks like all she'll do is stay. It all happened very quickly and I'd say she was a bit green but the further she went, the better she was. Wodhooh is like a big old-fashioned chaser but this one is more like a Flat horse going jumping, despite being National Hunt bred, but she has an engine. I'll go back and look at what Wodhooh did two years ago and work back from there. We'll get her home and see how she is. She's had two runs very quickly so I'd be shocked if you see her this side of Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Dam half-sister to high-class Envoi Allen; wide-margin winner of an academy hurdle on debut; looked smart at Newbury when beating three-time Flat winner Tralee Girl in a Listed juvenile hurdle; interesting here with Paddy Cleary's claim a factor.

13:00.race_name: Easter Festival Early Bird Tickets On Sale Now Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Three-figure odds when posing no threat first time out at Punchestown, one to rule out
runners.name: Any Chance
runners.spotlight: Three-figure odds when posing no threat first time out at Punchestown; one to rule out.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a point, one fair bumper run, jumped badly and tailed off in a maiden hurdle
runners.name: Better Times
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point; one fair bumper run when fourth of eight at Tipperary; jumped badly and tailed off in a maiden hurdle at Thurles; hooded now.

runners.comment: Mid-field in two maiden hurdle outings, will probably need to get a handicap mark
runners.name: Danny The Champ
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably here at the festival on the first of two bumper runs; mid-field in two runs over hurdles; likely to need a handicap mark.

runners.comment: Plenty of stamina in the pedigree so the trip should be fine, likely to need experience
runners.name: Deise Crystal
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-brother to winners Twilight Glory (2m7f/3m2f chase) and Solstice Twilight (point); Plenty of stamina in the pedigree. so the trip should be fine; likely to need experience.

runners.comment: Beat a Dan Skelton-trained subsequent winner in a bumper at Plumpton, strong chance
runners.name: Emerald Poet
runners.spotlight: Beat Le Beau Madrik, a Dan Skelton-trained subsequent winner, in a bumper at Plumpton in April; strong chance if taking to hurdles at the first attempt.

runners.comment: Course bumper winner, also second over hurdles here before unplaced favourite in April
runners.name: Good Deal
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner in January disappointed next time after doing too much in front; made some mistakes on hurdling debut over C&D in April but still a fine effort to take second; unplaced favourite over 2m at the same venue before a break.

runners.comment: Half-brother to a French hurdle winner, dam French maiden Flat/jumps, best watched
runners.name: Jesse James Howard
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to a French hurdle winner; dam French maiden Flat/jumps. best watched.

runners.comment: Dam point/hurdle/chase winner and a sister to useful hurdle/chase winner Balbriggan
runners.name: Lenis Law
runners.spotlight: Dam point/hurdle/chase winner and a sister to useful hurdle/chase winner Balbriggan, a Troytown Chase winner for Gordon Elliott.

runners.comment: Point-to-point winner last January, soundly beaten in two maiden hurdle outings
runners.name: Patsys Pride
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner last January; modest overall form in points; soundly beaten in two maiden hurdle outings

runners.comment: Two bumper runs, makes hurdling debut, trainer has a stronger candidate in Treasure Memory
runners.name: Poets Gale
runners.spotlight: Two bumper runs at Galway; makes hurdling debut; trainer has a stronger candidate in Treasure Memory.

runners.breeder: Mme Marguerite De Tarragon & M David Taylor
runners.comment: Remote fifth behind a stablemate here in November, Spinningayarn is the yard's number one
runners.name: Reckless
runners.spotlight: Remote fifth behind a stablemate here in November, Spinningayarn is the yard's number one.

stable_tour.quote: He was too weak to do himself justice in bumpers last season. He's got a lot stronger since you saw him last, so you can expect to see an improved performance when he shows up in a bumper soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Faded from two out on debut at Punchestown, likely to need more experience
runners.name: Rough N Smooth
runners.spotlight: Faded from two out on debut at Punchestown; likely to need more experience.

runners.comment: Pulled up in a point, remote fifth in a bumper, unlikely to feature on hurdles debut
runners.name: Royal Soldier
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in a point, remote fifth in a bumper at Navan; unlikely to feature on hurdles debut.

runners.comment: Point and bumper winner, can be expected to build on a satisfactory hurdles run at Clonmel
runners.name: Spinningayarn

quotes.race: Racing Again February 9th (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Spinningayarn is a nice horse and he's going to come on plenty from that. I wouldn't be shocked if he ended up going for the Cheltenham Bumper. He's very nice. He's definitely going to stay down the bumper route this season, and there's a lot of improvement in him. He will go up in trip down the line and will make a lovely stayer. He's nice and I like him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won his point for Sean Doyle in March 2024; Navan bumper winner last January on stable debut; subsequent Naas bumper run was too bad to be true; beaten favourite, but ran creditably nonetheless when third on his hurdling introduction at Clonmel (2m3f, heavy); leading contender with the yard in brilliant form.

stable_tour.quote: This is a lovely horse with a bright future. Forget his final run at Naas because he wasn't right. He had a bit of a hold-up but he's going to make a nice staying novice hurdler this season. He's got a great attitude and won what looked a really good bumper at Navan in January. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Locally-trained gelding is the first foal out of a winning chaser who stayed well, hooded
runners.name: Thatsmyroadie
runners.spotlight: Locally-trained gelding is the first foal out of a winning chaser who stayed well; hooded for debut.

runners.comment: Second in a point and a maiden hurdle, back hurdling with a good chance after a bumper run
runners.name: Treasure Memory
runners.spotlight: Second to subsequent Listowel bumper winner Apache Tribe in a point-to-point last February; promising third in a 2m Galway maiden hurdle in October (yielding) before solid third of six in a Punchestown bumper, staying on without troubling front two; this longer trip should suit

runners.comment: Fair bumper run last season on debut, tailed off at Navan last month on reappearance
runners.name: Clash Gold
runners.spotlight: Fair bumper run last season on debut; tailed off at Navan last month on reappearance.

runners.comment: Two Flat wins for Jessica Harrington, has hurdling experience, may need a handicap mark
runners.name: Gangster Granny

quotes.race: Killarney Welcomes Bordeaux Racecourse Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: The step up in trip and the nice ground really suited Gangster Granny and she had blinkers on too. Keithen (Kennedy) gave her a great ride. I think everyone knows whom the filly is named after (Mrs Harrington), and stepping her up to two miles would suit too. We'll look at the Ulster Cesarewitch now - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer

runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins for Jessica Harrington; has hurdling experience; may need a handicap mark judged on two Thurles runs.

runners.comment: Won a two-finisher point, early faller on hurdling debut, tailed off on second attempt
runners.name: Walk In The Clouds
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fifth attempt in a two-finisher point-to-point in October; fell at the first on hurdles debut; tailed off on second attempt.

runners.breeder: M Michel Larobe, M Philippe Thiriet, M Vincent Le Roy & M Ma
runners.comment: Had this rider aboard when winning a Sligo maiden on yard debut, could be on the upgrade
runners.name: Insouciant Dallier
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a course bumper and 3m2f maiden hurdle in 2023 for Liz Doyle; no sign of that form until yard debut when landing a Sligo maiden in October with this rider aboard; could be on the upgrade.

runners.comment: Ordinary maiden form, worth a market check now that he steps up in trip for handicap debut
runners.name: The Guinness Boys
runners.spotlight: Ordinary maiden form; possibly worth a market check now that he steps up in trip for handicap debut.

runners.breeder: Mrs M Milition & Mr M Passalacqua
runners.comment: Shaped well after a long absence when fourth over 2m here on stable debut, definite chance
runners.name: Dollar Nolimit
runners.owner: Molly Willis & Paul Willis & Mark Phillips
runners.spotlight: Showed potential for handicap success when trained by Joseph O'Brien; shaped well after a long absence when fourth over 2m here 19 days ago on stable debut; definite chance with normal improvement and avoiding bounce.

runners.comment: Bumper and Flat winner, getting on in years, pulled up on his most recent hurdles outing
runners.name: Mon Coeur
runners.owner: Karl Davis & T Egan & Mrs Bridget Dillon & Seamus Domegan

prev_owners.owner: D Glennane/T Egan/S Obrien/Mrs B Dillon

runners.spotlight: Bumper and Flat winner; getting on in years now; pulled up at this venue on his most recent hurdles outing.

runners.comment: Wins were gained back-to-back in April 2024, cheekpieces tried after moderate Limerick run
runners.name: Oneforgonzo

quotes.race: Buy The Centenary Of Naas Racecourse Book By Turtle Bunbury Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Oneforgonzo is a nice horse, in that grade anyway. Hopefully when he strengthens up and develops he'll go on to do something better - Sean Aherne, trainer

runners.spotlight: Wins were gained back-to-back in April 2024, cheekpieces tried after a moderate Limerick run five days ago; plenty of others preferred.

runners.comment: Won at Gowran on handicap debut, two fourth placings since then, needs to raise her game
runners.name: Watching The Clock

quotes.race: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Watching The Clock stayed at it well. Aidan [Kelly, jockey] said the race fell apart a bit. It's great to get a winner, she's a home-bred of Noreen's [McManus]. It's always nice when the fillies win. She just about handled the ground. We'll see what the handicapper does and look for something similar. This [William Hill] series is a great incentive, so fair play to them - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won at Gowran on handicap debut; two fourth placings since then; needs to raise her game to win off this mark.

runners.comment: Point winner, most recent maiden outing was poor, up in trip now, may find his level
runners.name: Fedneys Park
runners.spotlight: Point winner for Mick Goff last January; most recent maiden outing was poor; up in trip now; may find his level with the stable in form.

runners.comment: Bumper winner, 0-14 over hurdles, runner-up four times, place chance at best
runners.name: Mi Lucky Cailin

quotes.race: Front Door 4-Y-O Fillies (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Mi Lucky Cailin is a smart mare and this wasn't really a surprise. She was very impressive in a schooling bumper at Tipperary ten days ago. She's tough, genuine and loves pleasing you - William McLernon, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Yet to add to bumper victory in 2022; has run well in defeat a few times over hurdles, including when third in a Punchestown maiden on penultimate start.

runners.comment: Has yet to recapture the form that saw him beat a useful yardstick at Limerick last March
runners.name: Siege Ofjadotville
runners.spotlight: Has yet to recapture the form that saw him beat useful yardstick The Nagger Reidy (recent Leopardstown winner) at Limerick last March; down the field at that venue four days ago.

runners.comment: Nothing in her four 2025 starts encourages support, down the field at Navan last month
runners.name: Lady Bluebird
runners.spotlight: Nothing in her four 2025 starts encourages support; down the field at Navan last month.

runners.comment: Ran well over C&D in April considering she made mistakes and finished lame, off since June
runners.name: Queen Nel

quotes.race: Best Of Luck To The Irish At Cheltenham Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It's a nice surprise. Queen Nel is not the quickest but in that ground she didn't need to be and she kept galloping. She's a home-bred so it's great. On better ground I'd say she'll go up in trip -  Ray Cody, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Made mistakes and finished lame when fourth in a 20-runner contest at Fairyhouse in April; that was a decent effort in the circumstances; not without a chance if her fitness holds up.

runners.comment: Best known as a four-time AW winner, 1-17 over hurdles, no recent form, has changed stable
runners.name: Arabian King

quotes.race: Treo Eile Retraining Ireland's Racehorses Handicap
quotes.quote: Arabian King has been running well all along but didn't get luck in running and Colin was very good on him. He is a big, fun horse who will mix between flat and hurdles now - Cian Michael Collins, trainer.

quotes.race: Kerry Drain Services Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We were confident coming here, Arabian King's work had been good. We were a little worried about his jumping, but I thought with a clear round he'd have a chance. He made a few novicey mistakes but he jumped the last well and probably won a shade snugly in the end - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Best known as a four-time AW winner whose sole hurdles success from 17 attempts came in a 2m4f Killarney maiden in 2022; no recent form, has changed stable.

runners.comment: Would have finished closer at Navan but for a bad mistake at the last, each-way chance
runners.name: Nelsons Dawn
runners.spotlight: Huge odds for opening four maiden hurdle runs and well beaten; would have finished closer at Navan on handicap debut but for a bad mistake at the last; each-way chance for local trainer who won this race last year.

runners.comment: Fair third in a small-field handicap last time, will need to raise her game to feature
runners.name: Classy Cc
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in both 2024 runs; dropped away to be last of six finishers on handicap debut at Punchestown; last month's third at Limerick provides some encouragement; will need to raise her game to feature.

runners.comment: Not much merit in this season's form but worth noting she won a C&D maiden last January
runners.name: Leahs Contessa
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D maiden (soft) in January and placed in handicap here later in campaign; not much merit in this season's form; return to best is feasible given her linking for the track.

runners.comment: 16-race maiden, stays well enough but hard to be confident about his prospects
runners.name: Schiehallion
runners.spotlight: A 16-race maiden; has shown his best form at Down Royal; stays well enough but hard to be confident about his prospects; an early faller her last time.

runners.comment: Placed in a small-field bumper, has struggled in three starts since joining this stable
runners.name: Buckaway Freddie
runners.spotlight: Placed in a small-field bumper, for Gordon Elliott; has struggled in three starts since joining this stable

stable_tour.quote: He's had a nice break and he should be well up to winning a bumper judging by the way he ran first time out at Naas. 28-10-24

runners.comment: Makes a quick reappearance after unplaced Limerick run, better judged on Navan third
runners.name: Midleton Rare
runners.spotlight: Makes a quick reappearance after an unplaced Limerick run; better judged on previous Navan third; new headgear combination  now.

runners.comment: Beaten over 20l in seventh over C&D last time, chance based on Gowran second in October
runners.name: Another Girl
runners.spotlight: Raced too keenly and pulled up at Gowran in November; beaten over 20l in seventh over C&D last time; each-way possibility for local trainer based on Gowran second in October.

runners.comment: Fortunate winner at Thurles in October, no doubt about the merit of Tramore win, respected
runners.name: Alright Darling
runners.spotlight: Fortunate winner at Thurles (2m6f) in October when left in the lead by two fallers at the last; solid run when third (some way off the front two) at Gowran over 2m4f; no doubt about the merit of 2m5f Tramore win; definite chance despite 8lb rise.

runners.comment: Two Flat wins, 1-17 over hurdles, last month's Clonmel second suggests he can go close
runners.name: Spanish John

quotes.race: Broderick's Electric Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I didn't expect it. I rode Spanish John work lately, he was quite raw and he still was today. He had plenty left - Michael O'Sullivan, jockey.

runners.spotlight: Flat winner at Bellewstown in October; solid effort on return to hurdling at Punchestown and last month's Clonmel second implies he can go close; 1-17 record over hurdles is a concern.

runners.comment: Good chance based on his third placing here in November, appeared not to stay 3m on latest
runners.name: Teds Corner
runners.spotlight: Decent chance based on his third placing in a 15-runner contest here in November; appeared not to stay 3m when unplaced favourite at Punchestown three weeks ago.

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Vallee De Lorne
runners.comment: Only one win from 18 starts over hurdles, mild encouragement from recent Punchestown run
runners.name: Johnny Cakes
runners.owner: Frederick Pardy & Thomas Ohara & Peter Dawes & Crispin Wall

prev_owners.owner: Frederick Pardy/Thomas Ohara/Peter Dawe/ P J Rothwell

runners.spotlight: Only one win from 18 starts over hurdles; that came over this trio on heavy ground last winter at Punchestown; mild encouragement from recent run at same venue, when fourth of seven finishers over 3m in testing conditions.

runners.comment: Down the field in two handicap outings over C&D last season, needs massive improvement
runners.name: Shanroe Nancy
runners.spotlight: Down the field in two handicap outings over C&D last season; needs massive improvement

runners.comment: Weak form in maidens, perhaps some chance she will find her level now, cheekpieces added
runners.name: Venturevango
runners.spotlight: Weak form in maidens. perhaps some chance she will find her level now in handicaps; cheekpieces added.

14:10.race_name: Take A Pull Podcast Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Recent Navan second drops in grade and has to considered a major player
runners.name: The Miracle Man
runners.owner: A Trappe, D Trappe, G Trappe & Exors Of Late J J Gallagher

prev_owners.owner: A Trappe & Declan Trappe & Garry Trappe & James J Gallagher

quotes.race: Whistlin' Donkeys @ Fairyhouse Easter Saturday Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Miracle Man is a tough horse, he's from that Carrigeen [Kamala] family and they stay. He seems to like that ground. At one stage I was thinking we might let him off but they wouldn't be running on faster than that during the summer so we'll keep him out for a while - Arthur Moore, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two wins include here over 3m in April off 101; light campaign since and back to that level of form over 3m1f at Navan last month, untidy at last in finishing a clear second in testing conditions; fitted with an eye-shield for the first time (has been tried in cheekpieces once); drops in grade and has to considered a major player.

runners.comment: Encouraging Cork handicap debut and could have more to offer now upped further in trip
runners.name: Jukebox Johnny
runners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan
runners.spotlight: Well held in 2m maidens but showed promise on handicap debut last month over 2m4f at Cork; could have more to offer now upped further in trip (brother Tune A Box won over 3m).

runners.comment: Out of form this season, hard to fancy despite declining mark
runners.name: West Is Awake
runners.spotlight: Without a win over timber since 3m success here in October 2023 off 102; out of form this season, tailed off at Cork on latest; hard to fancy despite declining mark.

runners.comment: Unexposed on handicap hurdle debut after just three runs, showing promise each time
runners.name: Glenmalure Lady
runners.spotlight: Three point-to-point wins and unexposed here on handicap hurdle debut after just three runs, showing promise each time.

runners.comment: Without a win since landing the 2022 Irish Grand National; probably best watched for now
runners.name: Lord Lariat

quotes.race: BoyleSports Irish Grand National Chase (Extended Handicap Chase) (Grade A)
quotes.quote: Our plan was to jump Lord Lariat out, but I was a bit concerned about getting the trip. We wanted to utilise his jumping as he is a good jumper. Paddy said he got plenty of breathers into him and it all worked out well - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Jackpot Is Back Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lord Lariat surprised me as I was a bit anxious carrying top-weight on that ground. He's won on proper good ground before. It's probably looser than we thought and he kept galloping. He's improving and maybe he's a bit stronger now to handle that ground - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Ladies Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lord Lariat stayed at it well and the girl used her head. He's been thereabouts for a while and deserved to get over the line. He likes that ground and there might be something for him at Leopardstown - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: He's a big baby and he's going on his holidays now. He's only five and he'll grow into himself. He jumped super - Karl Thornton, trainer of Lord Lariat

quotes.race: Junction Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: He's just a big, raw horse and probably won't be a horse until next year. He's by Golden Lariat, a show jumping stallion who doesn't have many horses but everything he has is okay. He's a grand, fun horse. He'll come back here on Wednesday. He probably wants that nicer ground as well - Karl Thornton, trainer of Lord Lariat

runners.spotlight: Without a win since landing the 2022 Irish Grand National; unable to take advantage of much lower hurdles mark at Navan when last seen in September and probably best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: I think he'll go for the Porterstown Handicap Chase at Fairyhouse next month. He could have one run in the new year before we give him a break and it'll be all systems go for the Grand National at Aintree. He didn't run badly on his comeback at Punchestown ? it was a nice starting point in a small field. 20-11-22

runners.comment: Heavy ground at Navan didn't suit but return to better ground could see improved showing
runners.name: Sights Unseen
runners.spotlight: Downpatrick handicap hurdle winner in May off 94 (2m6f, good) and ran her best race since when taking the runner-up spot at Listowel in September over same trip; heavy ground at Navan last time didn't suit but return to better ground could well see an improved showing.

runners.comment: Placed in bumpers but 0-7 hurdling and opening handicap efforts don't inspire confidence
runners.name: Matter Of Opinion
runners.spotlight: Placed in two bumpers but is 0-7 hurdling and opening handicap efforts don't inspire confidence.

runners.comment: Long absent but booking of Jack Kennedy certainly takes the eye
runners.name: Pictures Of Home

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better @Fairyhouse Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pictures Of Home stays going. He's had a few bits of problems. He might win another one and he might not, he might win a three-mile chase - Ted Walsh, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins include here over 2m7f two years ago (heavy) off 99; struggling to get off the mark over fences when last seen in autumn of 2024; cheekpieces now tried on return and jockey booking takes the eye.

runners.comment: Winless in over two years but down to decent mark and recent form encouraging
runners.name: Ballyglass Beauty

quotes.race: Devon Inn Hotel Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We said we'd take a chance of getting in the bottom of a handicap off a light weight with Ballyglass Beauty. It was a classy-looking race but the horses coming out helped. I said to Charlie to get him settled, creep away and ride him to get a bit of money and it worked out lovely. He's a Westerner and most of them handle heavy. He's a small, light type, so we thought we'd get away with soft. He stays and is consistent - Liam Cusack, trainer.

quotes.race: Celebrating The Life Of Sean Daly Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballyglass Beauty had a lovely run here the last day and the extra distance helped him today. He was quite keen when he came and was a bit of a runaway. He might go to Listowel - Liam Cusack, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Three wins all at 3m, most recently Listowel festival in 2023; back down to competitive mark on evidence of clear second over same trip at Limerick in October; following month in contention when brought down two out at Cork; one to consider.

runners.comment: Good recent runs here over 3m put him firmly in the mix despite higher mark
runners.name: Lough Nigara
runners.spotlight: Maiden has been running well in defeat in 3m handicaps of late in a hood, latest two at this venue; has crept up 4lb for those efforts but remains very much a player.

runners.breeder: Scea Haras Du Ma,Marc Dumont,Daniele Boin
runners.comment: Hasn't added to his maiden win nearly four years ago; recent 2m4f efforts here poor
runners.name: Rajsalad

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rajsalad really deserved that. Since we bought him he has been a real superstar and has just run into a couple along the way. He has just taken his time to come to hand this year. He might run in a good handicap this year and go chasing next season - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Hasn't added to his maiden win nearly four years ago; recent 2m4f efforts here have been poor.

runners.comment: Soft ground may not have suited at Tramore; return to better ground to suit
runners.name: Great Bird
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced mare took a step forward on return when clear second over 2m7f at Clonmel (yielding) in October;  fortnight later held every chance when faller at last in Thurles mares' handicap, not so strong at the finish on softer ground at Tramore latest; return to better ground to suit.

runners.comment: 4-5 since joining this yard; back hurdling off 15lb lower mark than over fences
runners.name: Hitthehayson
runners.spotlight: In terrific form since joining this yard in September, winning four of five starts; handicap hurdles at Roscommon and Downpatrick and most recently first two attempts chasing in handicaps here (3m) and at Haydock (left in lead last); back hurdling here off 15lb lower mark than over fences and huge player.

runners.comment: Now 0-7 hurdling, absent since well held in midfield at Limerick in March; best watched
runners.name: A Year Older
runners.spotlight: Now 0-7 hurdling, absent since well held in midfield at Limerick in March; seems best watched.

runners.comment: No impression over 2m4f here last month; step up in trip will need to bring improvement
runners.name: Shanroe Nelson
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo made little impression in 2m4f handicap here last month; step up in trip will need to bring serious improvement to play a role here.

runners.comment: Recent third here over 2m4f suggests this longer trip could suit
runners.name: Marine Ranger
runners.spotlight: Recent staying-on third here over 2m4f mildly encouraging; relatively unexposed so step up in trip could see improvement.

runners.comment: Mixing disciplines of late to no great effect; 1lb wrong and opposable
runners.name: He Fitz In

quotes.race: Navan Racing Festival November 18th & 19th Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He Fitz In did it well and the visor helped. He had cheekpieces on the last day in Kilbeggan and wasn't doing a whole pile, and stayed on well. He keeps a bit to himself - Shane O'Callaghan, rider.

quotes.race: KilbegganRaces.com Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: He Fitz In needs a bit of space. Going to the last I thought he had a chance. He's a tough horse and battles hard - Danny Mullins, rider.

runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner and most recent success came in 3m1f Limerick handicap chase in March 2024; mixing disciplines of late to no great effect; 1lb wrong and opposable.

runners.comment: 9yo maiden pulled up in a point-to-point on October return; impossible to make a case for
runners.name: Mustameet Secret
runners.spotlight: Mare remains a maiden, well held over fences at Thurles just over a year ago; pulled up in a point-to-point on October return; 1lb wrong and blinkers tried; impossible to make a case for.

14:45.race_name: YellowFord & Drumlin John & Chich Fowler Memorial Irish EBF Mares Chase (Grade 3)

runners.comment: Below best so far this term; lots to find with same owner's Dinoblue on ratings
runners.name: Bioluminescence

quotes.race: McMahons Builders Providers Irish EBF Dawn Run Mares Novice Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Bioluminescence's jumping is unbelievable. She's a big mare with a huge jump to match ? it's her forte. A trip on soft ground is her ideal. I rode her in her point-to-point and she was flawless that day, too. Gavin [Cromwell] has trained her exceptionally well, winning a Grade 3 over hurdles and now a Grade 2 over fences. It's a fair step to go into a Grade 2 first time over fences. She's a ferocious galloper, stayer and jumper and because she's so big, there's a little bit left there - Derek O'Connor, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Shannon Spray Mares Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Bioluminescence is a fine, big mare with lots to like about her. I was a bit anxious to try to get her rolling in the straight and she had two good jumps at the last two. By the look of her chasing will be her game - Simon Torrens, rider.

quotes.race: Download The BetVictor App Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bioluminescence is a galloper. She ploughed through that ground and is a three-mile chaser in the making - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Won Grade 3 novice hurdle and Grade 2 novice chase, both 2m6f Limerick mares' events; last season's highlight a second in C&D Listed mares' chase, pulled up in Irish National (early interference didn't help); both runs this term below best, latest when never counting in 3m2f Becher Chase at Aintree last month; lots to find with same owner's Dinoblue on ratings.

stable_tour.quote: She had some very good runs over fences last season, winning a Grade 2 at Limerick before finishing runner-up at Naas and Fairyhouse. It didn't happen for her in the Irish National, but she's ready to start back again now. She has an entry in the Listed mares' chase at Clonmel on Thursday. If the ground came up soft, she could run. 04-11-25
A lovely, big mare who won two over hurdles, including a Grade 3 at Limerick. She's going chasing now and we're happy with her, but she won't start off until we have proper soft ground. 13-11-24

runners.comment: Fortria second a bit below best but remains the standout of this quartet
runners.name: Dinoblue

quotes.race: Hanlon Concrete Irish EBF Glencarraig Lady Francis Flood Mares Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Dinoblue is a great bit of stuff and you could set your clock by her everyday. She jumped great and is just a pleasure to have around: she never lets you down. I'd say it's her best year and she's better than ever. She'll have another season and will stick to those mares races - Frank Berry, racing manager.

quotes.race: Mrs Paddy Power Mares' Chase (Registered As The Liberthine Mares' Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dinoblue ran a great race last year and it didn't work out, today everything worked out for her. I'm just sorry for Allegorie De Vassy, she'd run a cracker of a race. She was jumping too big, would have preferred a bit of company up the front with her, I think. Might have just had her a little bit sharper. She was just ballooning fences and once I saw her doing that early in play, I didn't think she could be still challenging going to the last, because that takes a lot of energy out of them - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: BBA Ireland Limited Opera Hat Mares Chase (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Dinoblue and Allegorie De Vassy went a great gallop and there was no hiding place, despite there only being the two of them involved. I imagine they will reoppose at Cheltenham. I'm very happy with both of them and they will meet off levels at Cheltenham. It will be interesting - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy's Rewards Club Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Dinoblue looks a real decent mare and I'm very happy with that. Gentleman De Mee set a great pace and jumped fantastic. I wondered at one stage would she be able to stay jumping with him but she held her jumping together and, when he took a blow, she just stayed galloping. She is improving all the time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Barberstown Castle Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Jumping is Dinoblue's biggest asset and you would have to be delighted with that. Hopefully she can be the type for the Mares' Chase at Cheltenham - Mark Walsh, jockey.

quotes.race: Pigsback.com Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Dinoblue seems to be improving. She is an admirable mare and very tough. She is a brilliant jumper - David Casey, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Ryanair Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The Dawn Run Mares' Novices' Hurdle) (GBB)
quotes.quote: I asked Mark (Walsh) to be positive on Dinoblue but maybe that wasn't the way to ride her in this contest. We were probably doing too much up the front. I don't think lack of experience counted against her as she jumped as well as any mare. She just got tired up front between the last two - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilsheelan Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dinoblue was very good. She wasn't keen but I let her use her stride down the back and she jumped brilliant - Mark Walsh, rider.

runners.spotlight: High-class mare is 8-17 chasing, notably Grade 1 Leopardstown contest two years ago and three mares' events last season including Grade 2 at Cheltenham over 2m5f and hollow win over 2m4f at Punchestown festival; not at best on seasonal return in November but Fortria second was a solid run over an inadequate 2m nowadays; much the best of these and hard to oppose at the weights although this is her first attempt at this trip.

stable_tour.quote: She starts off at Navan in the rescheduled Fortria Chase and, as usual, her ultimate aim will be getting back to the Mares' Chase at Cheltenham. We won't deviate too much from what we did last season with her. 17-11-25

She has always looked nice at home, but it was nice to see her show it on the racecourse when coming home 15 lengths clear at Clonmel in January. That was on heavy ground, and she looked very good and things have gone well since. Her work has been pleasing and she'll make up my quartet in the Mares' Novices' Hurdle. 09-03-22

runners.comment: Amiss at Listowel; back from a break with questions to answer
runners.name: Shecouldbeanything

quotes.race: Mrs Paddy Power Mares' Chase (Registered As The Liberthine Mares' Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything ran a great race again and I'm very happy. She does fall slightly short of those top mares, but she has loads of experience now. I thought she ran above herself and we will probably go to the Irish Grand National now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Mahon Falls Mares Chase
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is a clever and straightforward mare. She is genuine as you can get and jumps for fun - Sam Ewing, rider

quotes.race: O'Dwyer Steel Dundrum Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is very tough and very genuine. She won going away at the line. I was after my one early but she finds so much I was never really too worried to be honest - Sam Ewing, rider.

quotes.race: Ballygarry Estate Hotel & Spa Mares Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything did it well. She's a tough mare, enjoyed the ground, and she jumped very well - Sam Ewing, rider

quotes.race: Anglo Printers Remembering John H. Kierans Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went a really good gallop, so I had to bide my time and Shecouldbeanything stayed on gamely. She's a solid mare and today showed she will definitely stay further. She's very versatile ground-wise, ran well at Cheltenham on soft and, while she has form on all different types of ground, that nicer surface brings out the best in her - Sam Ewing, jockey.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything did it very well. We went a good gallop the whole way and she was probably just in her comfort zone where she was. As soon as we straightened up and I got after her, she picked up fierce well. She's decent and hopefully can keep progressing. She handled that ground fine as well - Jack Kennedy, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Easyclean Tourist Attraction Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything went a nice, even gallop and grinded it out really well. She found plenty and made my job a good bit easier - Donagh Meyler, rider

quotes.race: Howden Insurance Brokers Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is a good mare. She ran well in Cheltenham, probably did plenty and was keen enough so we said we'd have one run going to the last. She has a great attitude and she will definitely jump a fence. She won a point-to-point and winged from fence to fence so she will be grand.  We'll give her a break now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Goggin Buckley Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything was very good. She was keen and didn't help herself. I held onto her for as long as I could and she quickened away smartly - Jordan Gainford, rider.

runners.spotlight: Had a good season as a novice last term, four wins included 2m4f Grade 3 Tipperary novice and finished third to Dinoblue at Cheltenham; reappeared with fine third in Galway Plate in July but two months later pulled up in Kerry National when diagnosed with atrial fibrillation and signs of being in season; questions to answer now.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a smashing mare over the last few years. Imagine she has won ten times. That's some record. There aren't many horses who won so much. She wasn't herself in the Kerry National at Listowel. She'll be back and we'll try win a big handicap with her. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Almost certainly has more to offer this season but this looks a stiff ask on return
runners.name: Look To The West

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Look To The West had some lovely runs over hurdles so it was great to do that over fences, her jumping was very good. She's very straightforward, loves her jumping and is an easy ride - Rachael Blackmore, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Look To The West came to me well recommended. She had been working well and we hoped she would do something like that. She gallops and jumps - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo reached a decent standard over hurdles and off the mark at second attempt chasing when ready winner of 2m4f Kilbeggan mares beginners' in April (yielding), jumping well; almost certainly has more to offer this season but this looks a stiff ask, albeit getting a nice bit of weight.

stable_tour.quote: She ran just twice last season but won her second chase at Kilbeggan in April. She's back working away, jumps fences very well and is a nice mare. We're looking forward to starting her off. 11-11-25

runners.comment: Won twice as a novice hurdler, two chase runs, looks inferior to stablemate Wingmen
runners.name: Ballybow

quotes.race: Surehaul Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Ballybow drops head and showed a good attitude, that's what I liked about this performance. He'll go for the Albert Bartlett now - Gordon Elliott, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballybow loved that ground today. He's a nice horse and can step up in trip no problem - Sam Ewing, rider.

runners.spotlight: Decent 128-rated novice hurdler last season, winning 2m2f Naas maiden and 3m Grade 3 Clonmel novice (soft); two chase runs; looks significantly inferior to stablemate Wingmen.

stable_tour.quote: He won a Grade 3 at Clonmel last season, so we had a crack at the Albert Bartlett with him. That didn't work out for him but I've a feeling you'll see a different horse over fences. You'll see him in a beginners' chase once we get a bit of rain. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Very disappointing on chase debut, beaten 40l in a strong contest here on second attempt
runners.name: Beckett Rock
runners.spotlight: 2-7 over hurdles and rated 138; bitterly disappointing when a beaten favourite on chase debut/seasonal return at Naas (2m, soft) 20 days ago; beaten 40l in fifth (16l behind fourth-placed Joystick) in a strong contest here on second attempt

stable_tour.quote: He was reported to have an atrial fibrillation after his run at Naas on Sunday, so while we were a bit disappointed, there was obviously a reason for it. We'll have to check that out now. 11-11-25

runners.comment: 133-rated hurdler, in rear at this venue on chasing debut, stable has stronger candidates
runners.name: Dr Eggman
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; 1-9 over hurdles and rated 133; in rear at this venue on chasing debut, stable has stronger candidates.

stable_tour.quote: A Ballinrobe bumper winner who is still a maiden over hurdles. Maybe I should be heading straight over fences with him now, but I would like to win a maiden hurdle with him before I do. 25-11-24

runners.comment: Course maiden hurdle winner, may need a confidence boost after a heavy fall at Punchestown
runners.name: Fishery Lane

quotes.race: Jump Into January Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fishery Lane is a strong stayer I would say. He will improve on the job regarding his jumping, and I would see him going up in trip rather than dropping back - Paul Townend.

runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f maiden here in January (soft); pulled up in the Albert Bartlett, same fate in a 2m7f handicap here; made little impact on first start over fences; may need a confidence boost after a heavy fall at Punchestown.

stable_tour.quote: Given the work he did at home here last season, he's one I hope will be able to hold his own at the top level in novice hurdles this season. We'll try to find a maiden hurdle for him shortly and I'm looking forward to getting him out and getting him jumping. He's got lots of potential. 25-11-24

runners.comment: In front of Beckett Rock on chase debut, unlikely to match stablemate Kaid D'Authie
runners.name: Joystick
runners.spotlight: 1-5 over hurdles and rated 129; in front of Beckett Rock when fourth in a strong beginners' event here on chase debut; can be expected to improve but unlikely to match stablemate Kaid D'Authie.

stable_tour.quote: He never looked like a hurdler and always gave the impression he would do better over fences. He'll go down the staying novice chase route, that looks his bag. 17-11-25

runners.comment: Fine start to his chasing career at Punchestown, form franked by the winner at Kempton
runners.name: Kaid Dauthie

quotes.race: Conway Piling Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Kaid D'Authie ran well and I'd say a longer trip. He jumps well, gallops, and covers a lot of ground. He just needed the run as well - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Savills Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kaid d'Authie is a lovely big, long-striding horse who has very little respect for his hurdles and looks like he could be more of a chaser. He's a big chasing type and is similar to Majborough. They both cover a huge amount of ground when they gallop.  I'd say he'll come back here for the Dublin Racing Festival and take on the top two-milers and we'll see where he is then - Willie Mullins, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Leopardstown last season before a distant fourth behind Kopek Des Bordes at the DRF; pulled up in the Turners before signing off with a front-running course win at the Punchestown festival; made a fiine start to his chasing career when second to stabelmate Kitzbuhel at the same venue; form franked by the winner in the Kauto Star.

runners.comment: Useful hurdler, nothing of note over fences yet, not in the same league as yard's Wingmen
runners.name: Lucky Lyreen

quotes.race: SBK Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lucky Lyreen stays strong, idled in front but when something came to him he went on again. He lets you down a small bit with his jumping but I think he just loses concentration a little bit at a hurdle - Jack Kennedy, rider.

runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler, nothing of note over fences yet; not in the same league as yard's Wingmen.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably gone as far as he can go over hurdles, so we'll go novice chasing with him and see where that takes us. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Hurdles winner at a modest level, could make a handicap candidate with more experience
runners.name: So They Tell Me

quotes.race: K-Mech Mechanical Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: So They Tell Me was a bit disappointing the last day. It was his first handicap and they went a bit quick for him. He travelled well today and maybe the step up in trip helped - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Handicap hurdle winner over a staying trip at Punchestown early last season; could make a handicap chase candidate with more experience.

runners.comment: No match for the smart Final Demand at Navan, a shade disappointing at same venue since
runners.name: Wingmen

quotes.race: Nathaniel Lacy & Partners Solicitors Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: It was a great run. I'm very happy with that and Wingmen will go to the Albert Bartlett now. Stepping up in trip will suit him - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Kilberry Pub & Kitchen Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Wingmen is a smart horse. His jumping got better when Jack let him on a bit. He could be better going the other way. He's a big chasing type for next season - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: JP & M Doyle (C & G) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Wingmen is a very good horse we think. He's a very quick horse but he will stay further - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Never added to his maiden hurdle win last season; however, had smart form in Graded novice races; promising chase debut when chasing home the high-class Final Demand at Navan, putting it up to the winner until a mistake last when tiring; failed to make the progress anticipated when third behind the Mullins-trained Predators Gold on latest Navan run.

stable_tour.quote: He's schooled great over fences. He was a classy enough novice hurdler last season but just didn't relax as much as he should. He's settling so much better at home now and he's going to make a smashing staying novice chaser. We'll get him out soon in a beginners' chase. 26-10-25

15:45.race_name: ITM Stallion Trail January 16th & 17th (Pro/Am) Flat Race

runners.comment: Plenty green on debut when third in C&D sales bumper in April; top amateur takes over now
runners.name: Early Dawning
runners.spotlight: 60,000euros 3yo; closely related to Turkish 1m-10.5f winner Tanerhan and half-brother to two other Flat winners; dam unraced half-sister to dam of 2m4f Group 1 winner Princess Zoe; weak in the market when making promising debut in valuable C&D sales bumper in April, plenty green once hitting the front when eventually finishing third (winner has won over hurdles since); top amateur takes over here and obvious chance.

runners.comment: Bought for small money as a yearling; market best guide on debut
runners.name: Home By The Sea
runners.spotlight: Bought for small money as a yearling; fifth foal; dam maiden from 5f-1m1f (RPR 48), out of 7f/1m2f winner; market best guide on debut.

runners.comment: Godolphin cast-off; heavy ground not ideal latest, return to better ground should suit
runners.name: Native Deal
runners.spotlight: Bred by Godolphin and bought for 13,500GBP as 3yo; brother to 7f-9.5f winner Laser Show (inc 2yo/UAE dirt;), half-brother to French 5.5f-8.5f winner Egot (inc 2yo/AW/Group 3); dam Australian Group-placed 6.7f-1m1f winner; didn't go unbacked when fair fifth on Down Royal debut in May, dropped out tamely on much more testing ground on last month's Navan return; better ground here should suit.

runners.comment: Points' runner-up has joined top yard and market should be informative on rules debut
runners.name: Seven Towers
runners.spotlight: Walk In The Park 5yo cost 42,000euros as a foal and 52,000GBP as a 3yo; half-brother to 2m hurdle winner Glimpse Of Gold; dam 2m5f hurdle winner, sister to Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Lord Windermere; promising second run in point-to-points when runner-up in Loughbrickland 4yo maiden in March for Gerald Quinn; joined top yard and market should be informative on rules debut.

runners.comment: Never counted in midfield under today's rider at Naas last month; may need more time
runners.name: Some See Stars
runners.spotlight: Made his debut in March 2024 in a Fairyhouse bumper won by Kopek Des Bordes; absent until last month when never counting in midfield under today's rider at Naas; may need more time.

runners.comment: Testing ground may not have suited at Navan, possible improver on this better ground
runners.name: With Nolimit
runners.spotlight: Hacked up in a Liscarroll point-to-point (3m, yielding) in March and bought for 250,000GBP at the Aintree sales in April; favourite, travelled well but didn't appear to get home in testing conditions on last month's Navan debut, could be a different proposition on this better ground.

stable_tour.quote: A fine, big horse who won a four-year-old maiden point at Liscarroll for Jonathan Fogarty. He's working well and catching the eye. We'll find a bumper for him soon. 26-10-25

runners.comment: Won at Happy Valley towards end of last season but hasn't offered much this term
runners.name: Smiling Emperor
runners.spotlight: Extended mile winner at Happy Valley on his penultimate outing last season; hasn't offered much in four starts this term and needs to raise his game to get seriously involved.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D last season but hasn't threatened in four outings this term
runners.name: Jolly Jumper
runners.owner: 23/24 Cody Mo Wai Kit Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate
23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate

runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D last season but hasn't threatened in four outings this term; now 5lb below his last winning mark but hard to support on current evidence.

runners.comment: Didn't fire last time but was in good form beforehand; dangerous if bouncing back
runners.name: Panda Legend
runners.spotlight: Knocking on the door in his first three starts this term; took a backward step last time but will be dangerous if bouncing straight back.

runners.comment: Nine-race maiden; not devoid of ability but latest 2lb drop not enough to tempt
runners.name: Iron Legion
runners.owner: The Hon & Mrs Kenneth Lau Ip Keung
runners.spotlight: Yet to seriously threaten in nine career starts, though his efforts this term have shown slight promise; still falls short of what's required to play a leading role.

runners.comment: Generally disappointing since arrival in Hong Kong; can only be watched again
runners.name: Smart Trio
runners.owner: Peter Lee Kwok Wah, Tony Lau Hon Kwan & Kenny Cheng Tsin Ki

prev_owners.owner: Tfi Syndicate & Go Bloodstock Australia Syndicate

runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing since arrival in Hong Kong, with little to recommend in 13 local starts; can only be watched again.

runners.comment: Needs to better recent efforts but is well handicapped and Zac Purton rides
runners.name: Windicator Family
runners.owner: Thomas Poon Ho Wing & Poon Chi Keung
runners.spotlight: Extended mile winner at Happy Valley last season; form has dipped since pleasing reappearance in September but he's on a good mark now and Zac Purton takes the ride today.

runners.comment: Offered glimpses of ability last season but has struggled to get involved this term
runners.name: Shine Bright
runners.spotlight: Offered glimpses of ability last season but has struggled to get involved in three runs since the break; needs to up his game.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but hinted at a breakthrough when third in twice in October/November
runners.name: Draco
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but hinted at a breakthrough when third in consecutive starts in October/November; disappointing last time but not ruled out if back on song.

runners.comment: Winless in 14 starts, though he ran well when sixth on his penultimate outing
runners.name: Dragon Sunrise
runners.owner: Sunny Wong Chi Tat & Wong Tsz Wah
runners.spotlight: Winless in 14 starts, though he ran well when sixth on his penultimate outing; others look stronger on balance.

runners.comment: Unlucky not to score when third in a tight finish over C&D in November; high on the list
runners.name: Gangnam Star
runners.owner: Francis Chan, Louise Chan & Aaron Chan
runners.spotlight: Unlucky not to score when third in a tight finish over C&D in November; remains on a winnable mark and holds strong claims if reproducing that effort.

runners.comment: Last win came in November 2024, and he has offered little in five starts this term
runners.name: Island Golden
runners.spotlight: Last win came in November 2024, and he has offered little in five starts this term; now well handicapped but needs to rediscover some spark.

runners.comment: Has shown no encouragement in four outings this season; look elsewhere
runners.name: Silver King
runners.spotlight: Has failed to seriously threaten since his debut effort back in Novemeber 2023; has shown no encouragement in four outings this season; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Won over 7f here last season and has posted several solid efforts this term; considered
runners.name: Harrys Hero
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f here last season and has posted several solid efforts this term, including a creditable fourth over C&D in November; one to consider.

runners.comment: On a lengthy losing run but latest run was a step back in the right direction; a possible
runners.name: Strongest Boy
runners.owner: Ricky Wong Kin Chat & Helen Leung Yee Wan
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing run but took a step back in the right direction when fourth over the extended mile at Happy Valley last month; not without hope off current mark.

runners.comment: Shaped with some promise when sixth over C&D in November but hasn't backed it up
runners.name: Cosmo Light
runners.spotlight: Shaped with some promise when sixth over C&D in November but hasn't backed it up in two subsequent starts; others arrive in better form.

runners.comment: Modest in novice company and hasn't made much of an impact since switching to handicaps
runners.name: Supreme Winner
runners.spotlight: Modest in novice company and hasn't made much of an impact since switching to handicaps; very difficult to fancy.

runners.comment: Followed Happy Valley win with commendable second from stall 12 there
runners.name: Meowth
runners.spotlight: Scored over today's trip at Happy Valley in November and was commendable second from stall 12 off revised mark there last time; drawn wide again here but still commands respect.

runners.comment: Little to show from four local starts so far, safely held each time
runners.name: Bigtime Generation
runners.spotlight: Little to show from four local starts so far, safely held each time; can't be recommended at present.

runners.comment: Won twice in October/November but held off this mark since; needs to kick on again
runners.name: King Oberon
runners.spotlight: Recorded back-to-back victories at Happy Valley in October/November but was safely held off his revised mark last time and needs to kick on again here.

runners.comment: Out of a speedy mare and caught the eye on his penultimate trial; interesting newcomer
runners.name: Beauty Gemini
runners.owner: Yuki Kong Yuk Ki & Patrick Kwok Ho Chuen
runners.spotlight: Dam was a speedy type with all wins at 6f or shorter and her foals have also been sprinters; caught the eye on his penultimate trial; interesting newcomer.

runners.comment: Sent off at 35-1 on official debut in November and ran accordingly
runners.name: Joy Capital
runners.owner: Jessica Man Yi Lee & Gregory Chi Ho Ho
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 35-1 on official debut in November and ran accordingly; will probably need more time and experience.

runners.comment: Yet to show a great deal in local trials and has awkward draw on official debut
runners.name: Power Patch
runners.spotlight: Fetched NZD$375,000 at the Ready To Run Sale after a sharp breeze-up; yet to show a great deal in local trials and has awkward draw on official debut.

runners.comment: Failed to land a blow over C&D on recent debut and has stall 14 today
runners.name: Stormy Knight
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs James Tien Pei Chun
runners.spotlight: Failed to land a blow over C&D on recent debut; should have learned plenty from that experience but faces a tough task from stall 14 today.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 4yo who stayed on well for fourth at Happy Valley last month; in the mix
runners.name: Prestige Hall
runners.spotlight: Plenty to like about his early form, staying on well when fourth over today's trip at Happy Valley last month; entitled to be in the mix again.

runners.comment: Made promising return when fourth over 5f here in September but hasn't built on that
runners.name: Watch This One
runners.spotlight: Made promising return when fourth over 5f here in September but hasn't built on that in four subsequent starts; drawn wide; others preferred.

runners.comment: Yet to threaten in three starts, though wasn't beaten far when seventh over C&D last time
runners.name: Brave Win
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Matthew Lam Kin Hong
runners.spotlight: Yet to seriously threaten in three starts, though he wasn't beaten far when seventh over C&D last time; improvement required.

runners.comment: Won over C&D in September on seasonal return; holding form well but needs to find extra
runners.name: Same To You
runners.owner: Colin Cheung Kwok Lam, Amos Cheung Sai Keung & Gary H K Yau
runners.spotlight: Struck over C&D in September on seasonal return; has held form well since without quite threatening again; needs to find extra off current mark.

runners.comment: Shaped with promise on seasonal/handicap debut but hasn't kicked on since
runners.name: Winning Champion
runners.spotlight: Fair in novice events last season and shaped with promise on seasonal/handicap debut in September; hasn't kicked on since and needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: C&D winner last season but all three runs this term have been below par
runners.name: Sea Sapphire
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last season but all three runs this term have been below par; needs a revival.

runners.comment: Little to recommend from four runs this term; needs a drop in grade.
runners.name: Circuit Duffy
runners.owner: Cheung Ka Shing & Jason Cheung Cho Yee
runners.spotlight: Scored early in his career but has been on a downward curve since; little to recommend from four runs this term and needs a drop in grade.

runners.comment: On his last winning mark but out of form and hard to support with confidence
runners.name: Lean Master
runners.owner: Cheng Wan Wai & Cheng Tsz Yan
runners.spotlight: Winless at this track and form has dipped in recent months; now back on his last winning mark but hard to support with confidence.

runners.comment: Scored twice last season including over C&D; has fitness to prove after 176-day break
runners.name: Country Dancer
runners.spotlight: Scored twice last season including over C&D; may need this run to blow away the cobwebs following an extended break.

runners.comment: 0-14 in Hong Kong but offered hope when fourth in Class 4 company last time
runners.name: I P O Bros
runners.spotlight: Yet to get off the mark in 14 local starts but offered hope when fourth in Class 4 company last time; now drops into this lower grade and enters calculations.

runners.comment: Up 5lb for Happy Valley win in November but remains lightly raced
runners.name: Legend Star
runners.spotlight: Opened account over this trip at Happy Valley in November; 5lb rise demands more but he remains lightly raced and is open to further progress.

runners.breeder: Ms D M Cuthbert & P J Smith
runners.comment: No real impact in seven career starts and has struggled in four runs this term
runners.name: Come Fast Fay Fay
runners.spotlight: No real impact in seven career starts and has struggled in four runs this term; needs to take a big step forward on today's drop in grade.

runners.comment: C&D winner last season but hasn't shown a great deal since returning in September
runners.name: Circuit Victory
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in this grade last season but hasn't shown a great deal since returning in September; hard to fancy on current form.

runners.breeder: G W Holdings A T F The Edwina Trust
runners.comment: Knocking firmly on the door early this season before below-par run last time at short odds
runners.name: Run Run Timing
runners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

runners.spotlight: Knocking firmly on the door early this season before a below-par run last time at short odds; capable of bouncing back quickly.

runners.comment: Narrowly denied over this trip in November and again found only one too good last time
runners.name: Riding High

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied over this trip in November and again found only one too good last time; a breakthrough win looks imminent.

runners.comment: Failed to land a blow when dropped into this grade most recently, others preferred
runners.name: Turf Phoenix
runners.owner: Dr John Shum Ding Ping & Dr Lawrence Chan Pui Wing
runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing in 14 local starts; failed to land a blow when dropped into this grade most recently, others preferred.

runners.comment: Yet to get seriously involved in ten starts but has hinted at ability
runners.name: Majestic Delight
runners.spotlight: Yet to get seriously involved in ten starts but has hinted at ability; must bounce back from a poor run last month.

runners.comment: Little encouragement to be drawn from 12 local outings; hard to recommend
runners.name: Rich Horse
runners.spotlight: Little encouragement to be drawn from 12 local outings; hard to recommend.

runners.comment: Close third over 5f at Happy Valley last month and looks a player once more
runners.name: Oriental Surprise
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden after 16 starts but running well this season; close third over 5f at Happy Valley last month and looks a player once more.

runners.comment: Dual 6f winner at Happy Valley last season but yet to fire in four starts since returning
runners.name: Super Charizzard
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f winner at Happy Valley last season but yet to fire in four starts since returning; needs to recapture old spark.

runners.comment: Dual 6f dirt winner here last season but hasn't threatened in three starts this term
runners.name: Excellent Daddy
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f dirt winner here last season but hasn't threatened in three starts this term; switches back to turf and swaps usual cheekpieces for first-time blinkers today.

runners.comment: Belatedly off the mark with a win over this trip at Happy Valley last month; respected
runners.name: Lucky Generations
runners.spotlight: Belatedly off the mark with a win over this trip at Happy Valley last month; up 6lb but respected if backing that up.

runners.comment: Second over C&D in October; needs to find a bit more to open account
runners.name: Noble Deluxe
runners.spotlight: Posted improved efforts this season, notably when second over C&D in October; needs to find a bit more to open account.

runners.comment: Best effort this term when second over 7f in October but form has dipped since
runners.name: The Way We Win
runners.spotlight: Best effort this term when second over 7f in October but form has dipped since; hard to predict.

runners.comment: No impact in six career starts; improvement required before serious consideration
runners.name: One And Only
runners.spotlight: No impact in six career starts; improvement required before serious consideration.

runners.comment: Won over 5f here off 7lb higher mark on seasonal debut but has failed to maintain his form
runners.name: Flowing Riches
runners.spotlight: Won over 5f here off a 7lb higher mark on seasonal debut but has failed to maintain his form; seems best when fresh and a 32-day break since last run may not be long enough.

runners.comment: Ran okay on penultimate outing and has much better draw than last time
runners.name: Light Years Glory
runners.spotlight: Posted fine C&D efforts on both starts last season; not so strong in three recent runs but 3.25l sixth on penultimate start was decent and he has a much better draw than last time.

runners.comment: C&D scorer in July but has started this campaign with four lesser efforts
runners.name: Alabama Song
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer in July but has started this campaign with four lesser efforts; no sign of a revival when 6l tenth at Happy Valley a fortnight ago and has outside draw here.

runners.comment: Sent off at odds of 135-1 on his C&D debut 39 days ago and beat only two home
runners.name: Adorable Smile
runners.spotlight: After poor showings in trials, was sent off at odds of 135-1 on his C&D debut 39 days ago and beat only two home.

runners.comment: Kept on well for third over C&D on debut; drawn wide today but still a big player
runners.name: Amazing Partners
runners.owner: Thomas Liang Cheung Biu & Elizabeth Lee Wong Sing Fung
runners.spotlight: Attracted some market support before finishing a promising, never-nearer 1.5l third on C&D debut 12 days ago; drawn wide today but should have come on for that experience; big player.

runners.comment: Unable to justify favouritism when fifth on debut (5f) but still showed clear promise
runners.name: Smart Golf
runners.spotlight: Showed plenty of ability and speed in trials; never able to get to the lead but still posted a commendable debut run in fifth when favourite over 5f here a month ago; will know more this time and extra furlong could suit.

runners.comment: Has not shown enough in four local trials to make him of much interest on this debut
runners.name: Speedy Patch
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to four winners; cost NZ$160,000 as a yearling; has not shown enough in four local trials to make him of much interest on debut.

runners.comment: Came second in a trial in Australia but local trials have been less encouraging
runners.name: Supreme Feeling
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Anthony W K Chow & Justin Chow
runners.spotlight: Runner-up, having made the running, in a trial in Australia but has not shown that kind of ability in four local trials so is likely to need this initial run.

runners.comment: Performances in four local trials do not suggest he will be ready to win first time out
runners.name: Victor Supreme
runners.spotlight: Speedily bred (both older half-siblings have won sprints, one of them nine times) but his performances in four local trials do not suggest he will be ready to win first time out.

runners.comment: 12th of 14 over C&D as a 56-1 outsider on his debut 18 days ago
runners.name: Zephyr
runners.spotlight: Well bred and cost plenty as a yearling but has not shown much either in three trials or when 12th of 14 over C&D as a 56-1 outsider on his debut 18 days ago.

runners.comment: Began career with three good runs in September/October but form has slumped since
runners.name: Good Fortune
runners.spotlight: Began career with three solid C&D runs (favourite once) without managing a place in September/October; stone last in each of his subsequent runs suggesting something may be amiss.

runners.breeder: Mrs V A & W K Pike
runners.comment: Consistent 6yo is features prominently in calculations in this rather weak race
runners.name: Speedy Smartie
runners.owner: Dr Andrew Yu, Dr Alvin Yu Man Ho & Dr Bernice Yu Man Yan
runners.spotlight: Had three wins and three seconds in his previous six outings prior to a solid 2.5l fourth over this C&D 18 days ago; still 6lb below his highest winning mark and this does not look like a strong race.

runners.comment: Gained all five wins over 5f at Happy Valley and has been badly out of form lately
runners.name: Sergeant Pepper
runners.spotlight: Has now gone 13 months since the most recent of his five career victories and they were all over 5f at Happy Valley; badly out of form.

runners.comment: Ran as though something was amiss last time but earlier form gives him strong claims
runners.name: Sparkle And Gold
runners.spotlight: Ran unaccountably badly when last seen 39 days ago but a repetition of either of his two previous runs (both over C&D) would give him a good chance in today's modest company.

runners.comment: Came good at Happy Valley in November and held his own off new mark there last month
runners.name: Lakeshore Hero
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 11th attempt, by 0.5l on comeback in November (6f, Happy Valley); fair fifth off this revised mark last time so has place claims if getting a run today.

runners.comment: Three times a 6f Happy Valley winner off much higher marks than this but not since 2024
runners.name: California Deeply
runners.spotlight: Three times a 6f Happy Valley winner off much higher marks than this but not since 2024; unplaced in each of his last eight outings; revival needed.

runners.comment: Went close over C&D in November but has run poorly since and remains a maiden
runners.name: Supreme Mastermind
runners.spotlight: Now 8lb better off for the 0.5l Double Win beat him over C&D in November but has run poorly since (albeit in higher-grade company) and remains a maiden after ten tries.

runners.comment: Won twice prior to running rather flat behind a couple of these rivals last time
runners.name: Double Win
runners.owner: Dr Kelvin Chong Man Yuk & Ma Yuen Yu
runners.spotlight: Bagged back-to-back victories (C&D/1m3f) prior to running rather flat behind a couple of these rivals last time; sometimes breaks slowly; needs to be at his very best to defy this career-high mark.

runners.comment: Ran well on both starts for new stable last month and now 6lb below last winning mark
runners.name: Sharpen Bright
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent for former trainer but posted two good efforts for new stable at Happy Valley last month (1m3f/1m1f); 6lb below his highest winning mark so merits respect.

runners.comment: Losing run stands at 18 starts, and he has stamina to prove on first venture beyond 1m1f
runners.name: Chain Of Gold
runners.spotlight: His current losing run stands at 18 starts and he has stamina to prove on first venture beyond 1m1f.

runners.comment: Three wins at Happy Valley this season; could be dangerous if granted an unconstested lead
runners.name: Hakka Radiance
runners.spotlight: Raised 20lb in total for three straight 1m1f Happy Valley victories this season; caught 100yds from the line and had to settle for fifth there last time but could be dangerous again if allowed an uncontested lead.

stable_tour.quote: I have always liked this horse since the day he first set foot in the yard. He opened his account on his third outing, a 1m2f novice stakes at Chelmsford, although he is actually bred to be a miler. Next time out at Goodwood was a bit of an experiment but he failed to stay the extra trip of the Cocked Hat and didn't enjoy the undulations of the South Downs. He goes for the Britannia next week where the straight mile will suit. He is still on the upgrade, his work on fast ground has been good and we are looking forward to next week with him. 14-06-23

runners.comment: Triple C&D winner; on a long losing run but can't be ruled out off current mark
runners.name: Packing Hurricane
