runners.spotlight: Triple C&D scorer off considerably higher marks who is now on a losing streak that runs to almost two years; fair 2.5l seventh last time and repetition of previous 0.5l second would give him sound claims.

runners.comment: Ran well behind Double Win on penultimate start but was much less convincing last time
runners.name: Serangoon

prev_owners.owner: D Mason, Dr C A Broxham Et Al

runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a handy mark and ran very well behind Double Win on penultimate start but was much less convincing when only seventh as the favourite behind the same rival last time.

runners.comment: Inconsistent and arrives here after 12 consecutive defeats but still has possibilities
runners.name: Forever Glorious
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and arrives here on the back of 12 consecutive defeats but still could go close if putting his best foot forward today.

runners.comment: Once ran well on dirt but his other form leaves him with plenty to find
runners.name: Viva Taste
runners.owner: Jimmy Chung Kwok Man & Dominic Chung Won Lok
runners.spotlight: Did once run well (on dirt over 1m1f on seasonal debut in October) but the form of his other four starts leaves him with plenty to find.

runners.comment: Placed in new blinkers two runs ago but well held since and now 0-5
runners.name: Glorious Ryder
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and going beyond 1m for the first time here; 1.5l third at Happy Valley in October (first-time blinkers) is much the best of his five career runs; back from seven weeks away.

runners.comment: Does not win as often as he should but is usually involved in the finish
runners.name: Management Folks
runners.spotlight: Does not win as often as he should but is usually involved in the finish and is just 1lb above his highest winning mark.

runners.comment: Not beaten far on last two outings and this move back up in trip could be in his favour
runners.name: Volcanic Spark
runners.spotlight: Has not won since July 2024 but has been beaten by under 3l in each of his last two races and this return to a longer trip could be in his favour.

runners.comment: Broke his duck at 16th try over 1m two starts ago; held since; up in trip today
runners.name: Yiu Cheung Victory
runners.spotlight: Broke his duck at 16th try over 1m two starts ago; only fair effort when seventh off this mark last time and today's extra 2f is not sure to suit him.

runners.comment: Best effort since win in May when 0.5l second a fortnight ago; one for the shortlist.
runners.name: Perfect Pairing
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Jerry Chow Shiu Ming
runners.spotlight: On same mark now as for his only win, at Happy Valley (1m3f) in May; best effort since when 0.5l second a fortnight ago; back up in grade today but one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Nothing like the force of old but went very close two starts ago (1m3f)
runners.name: Nearly Fine
runners.owner: Lim U Po Chu & Lester Lam Hau Yin
runners.spotlight: Nothing like the force of old and only sixth last time but his previous short-head second to Double Win suggested he is capable of breaking a three-year losing sequence off this reduced mark.

runners.comment: Gained reward for a string of fine efforts when winning at Happy Valley (1m3f) last month
runners.name: Star Brose

prev_owners.owner: Peter Young Wai Po & David Young Yuk Chuen

runners.spotlight: Gained reward for a string of fine efforts when beating Perfect Pairing by 0.5l last time (1m3f, Happy Valley); upped 5lb for that success.

runners.comment: Runner-up over 1m on two of last three starts; big player if coping with drop back in trip
runners.name: Sundays Serenade
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m Happy Valley winner in the spring; runner-up twice in his last three starts and should run a big race provided he copes with this drop in trip; booking of Zac Purton is a positive.

runners.comment: Three-time Irish scorer but has yet to get to grips with the Hong Kong style of racing
runners.name: Sea Chariot

quotes.race: Torc Travel Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Chariot doesn't have many miles on the clock. We weren't sure about the ground today, but when I gave him a chance he got into a nice rhythm. He didn't ride like a slow horse - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sea Chariot was fresh today but they went a good gallop which suited. He's a horse that will pay his way up here for the winter - Shane Foley, rider.

runners.spotlight: Three-time Irish scorer but has yet to get to grips with the Hong Kong style of racing, and his last two runs have been particularly poor.

runners.comment: C&D winner in September and moves back up in trip after very respectable 6f run
runners.name: The Heir
runners.spotlight: Has a modest 1-24 strike rate in Hong Kong but that win was over C&D, and fair 2l sixth over 6f last time suggested he may be returning to form.

runners.comment: Has slipped to a tempting mark and this drop back in trip could be just what he needs
runners.name: Beauty Viva

quotes.race: Federation Of Bloodstock Agents Handicap
quotes.quote: Validated was a straight forward ride, There was a no pace on early but he picked up nicely out of the Dip - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Validated would be a nice horse since we got him. He looks a picture and I was thinking of going for a novice contest next as it would've been a free hit, but his handicap mark might be affected now - Joseph Parr, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Two second places shine out among 13 lesser efforts since arriving from Britain; has dropped 16lb from his opening Hong Kong mark and this drop back in trip could be just what he needs.

runners.comment: Fair 2.5l fourth last time but wide draw makes things harder today
runners.name: Raging Rapids
runners.spotlight: Only win from 13 races came off 5lb lower mark over C&D in July; fair 2.5l fourth last time but wide draw makes things harder here.

runners.comment: Has yet to manage a top-nine finish after seven Hong Kong starts
runners.name: Star Glow
runners.spotlight: Has yet to manage a top-nine finish after seven Hong Kong starts, and the addition of blinkers appeared to make little difference last time.

runners.breeder: H J Mitchell & Yarraman Park Partnership
runners.comment: Needs to step up appreciably on a pair of seventh places (both 6f) on first two outings
runners.name: Circuit Gogo
runners.owner: Cheung Kwok Ping & Ho Yin Sang
runners.spotlight: Much less exposed than some of today's rivals but needs to step up appreciably on the pair of seventh places (both 6f) that he has achieved so far.

runners.comment: Steps up from 6f having twice plugged on late to finish in midfield; possible dark horse
runners.name: Golden Dream
runners.spotlight: Stepping up from 6f having twice plugged on late to finish in midfield; also switching from cheekpieces to blinkers; possible dark horse.

runners.comment: Second over 6f on debut in September but both runs since have been much less encouraging
runners.name: Proud Box
runners.owner: Leung Lun Ping & Asther Leung Wing Yi
runners.spotlight: Began his career with a solid 2l second over 6f back in September but his two subsequent starts have been much less encouraging; has an extra furlong to cover here.

runners.comment: Yet to make the top two but has run well in the majority of his eight outings; respected
runners.name: Better And Better
runners.spotlight: Yet to make the top two but has run well in the majority of his eight outings, beaten by less than 2l over C&D in each of his last four; possible front-runner; leading contender

runners.comment: Finished eighth or worse at long odds on all three starts; cannot be recommended
runners.name: Golden Fortune
runners.spotlight: Finished eighth or worse at long odds on all three starts; cannot be recommended.

runners.comment: Safely held on all three starts; moves up from 6f today
runners.name: The All Rounder
runners.spotlight: May not have been suited by dirt last time but still has plenty to prove having been well beaten on both previous turf runs; up from 6f.

runners.comment: Yet to build upon debut effort but might surprise on first try at 7f
runners.name: Winning Diamond
runners.spotlight: Yet to build on his 2l debut fifth (5f) but has dropped 2lb since finishing 5l tenth last time and might surprise on first try at 7f.

runners.comment: Only 1lb above his winning mark but was well beaten on last month's seasonal/stable debut
runners.name: Win Speed
runners.spotlight: Now back to within 1lb of the mark off which he scored his only victory over C&D 14 months ago; back from five months away for a new trainer when well beaten last month; visored for the first time.

runners.comment: Scored over C&D in November but safely held off new mark since
runners.name: Super Love
runners.spotlight: Failed to build on his 0.75l C&D November victory when only eight off this revised mark 12 days ago and looks to hold place claims at best.

runners.comment: Both his victories (from 26 tries) were over this C&D but the latest was almost a year ago
runners.name: Forerunner
runners.owner: Ng Tai Wing, Anson Or Yiu Wah & Henry Yeung Mun Kin
runners.spotlight: Both his victories (from 26 tries) were over this C&D but the latest was almost a year ago, and he was found to have a heart irregularity after his most recent start.

runners.comment: Stayed on for close second over 7f on last month's stable debut; high on the list
runners.name: Endued
runners.spotlight: Just 1-13 in Hong Kong but stayed on well for close second over 7f here on last month's stable debut and, on that evidence, he's well worth another crack at 1m.

runners.comment: In-form 4yo who dips back into Class 4 after making the frame in Class 3 in December (7f)
runners.name: Etalon Or
runners.spotlight: Won readily over 7f on seasonal debut in October and made the frame on both subsequent outings, more recently when upped to Class 3 last month; dips back into Class 4 today and the extra furlong won't be a problem; likely contender.

runners.comment: 0-6 in Hong Kong but belied huge odds when fourth over C&D last month
runners.name: The Lion King

prev_owners.owner: M L R Whittaker, Mrs E M K Whittaker Et Al

runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six Hong Kong starts but belied huge odds when fourth over C&D in November and his prospects look brighter now.

runners.comment: Won comfortably when upped to 7f last month and is open to more improvement over 1m
runners.name: Rising Phoenix
runners.owner: James Kwan Wai Ming & Leung Kam Chuen
runners.spotlight: 0-8 as a sprinter but looked very well suited by step up to 7f when winning comfortably here last month, and could easily have further improvement to come over 1m.

runners.comment: Ended last season with a C&D win and placed on two of three C&D runs this term
runners.name: Happy Universe
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a C&D win and was placed over C&D on first two outings this term; just below that form when last in action but still enters calculations.

runners.comment: Placed twice over 7f this season; hit traffic before finishing strongly over C&D last time
runners.name: The Golden Knight
runners.owner: Wilson Ngan Ping Shing, Katherine Ngan Mei Sze Et Al
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who was placed over 7f here on first two starts this season and encountered traffic before finishing strongly for fifth over C&D last time; still unexposed over 1m; must be considered.

runners.comment: Regressive 7yo who finished well down the field on first two starts this season
runners.name: Frantanck
runners.spotlight: Regressive 7yo who finished well down the field on first two starts this season; revival needed.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who was placed over C&D two runs ago; a possible if aided by blinkers
runners.name: Gloriastar
runners.owner: Chan Shiu Shan & Yeung Wan Yiu
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who was placed over C&D in November, his second run, and ended up poorly positioned on wide outside of field when only eighth here three weeks later; a possible if first-time blinkers have positive effect.

runners.comment: Went close over 7f in October but didn't fire last time and is now 0-13
runners.name: California Banner
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden; suggested his turn might be near when close second over 7f here in October but didn't fire over that trip last month; others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Twice showed promise over 7f towards end of last year but needs to improve today
runners.name: Kyrus Treasure
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only three runs and twice displayed clear promise over 7f towards end of last year, but has the outside draw for this first attempt at 1m and needs some improvement.

runners.comment: Not firing on all cylinders this season and still on a fairly tough mark
runners.name: Kingly Demeanor
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m1f (once here) towards end of last season, but not firing on all cylinders this term and still on a fairly tough mark.

runners.comment: Well beaten on all three starts for David Eustace last season; now with new stable
runners.name: Sandman
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all three starts for David Eustace last season (7f-1m1f) and makes stable debut after seven-month break.

runners.comment: Worth a go over 1m but has very mixed record since 5f win on debut in July 2024
runners.name: Amazing Fun
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for fifth over 7f here last month and is probably worth a go over 1m, but has very mixed record since winning over 5f on his debut in July 2024.

runners.comment: Second at Happy Valley in October but two lesser efforts followed; now 0-8
runners.name: Conspiracy Witness
runners.owner: Arthur Antonio Da Silva, Betty Da Silva & Teresa Da Silva
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; stayed on for second at Happy Valley (1m) in October but two lesser efforts have followed (blinkers added last time); not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Ran okay over 6f in October but has now been unplaced all five starts
runners.name: Lucky King
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all five starts; kept on for respectable fifth over 6f at Happy Valley in October but needs to kick on again on this return to 1m.

runners.comment: Stayed on for third over C&D in October but safely held twice since and now 0-8
runners.name: Inno Super
runners.owner: Dr Ng Chi Ho, Steve Chuang Tzu Hsiung Et Al
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for third over C&D in October but safely held twice since and now 0-8; needs to up his game.

08:05.race_name: Chinese Club Challenge Cup (Group 3 Handicap) (3yo+) (Course B+2) (Turf)

runners.comment: Late-maturing 7yo who won 6f Group 2 handicap in October; respected
runners.name: Tomodachi Kokoroe
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 7yo who has taken his form to a whole new level this season, with the latest of three 6f wins gained in a Group 2 handicap in October; not disgraced in Group 1 Hong Kong Sprint last month and should be fine back over 7f; respected.

runners.comment: Won this in 2025 and will find this easier than recent assignments; likely contender
runners.name: Patch Of Theta
runners.spotlight: Career highlight when winning this race off 4lb lower a year ago; unlucky not to finish closer than sixth over C&D on seasonal debut in September and faced tough tasks on next two outings; ought to play a major role.

runners.comment: Made the frame in Group handicaps on both starts this season; good chance
runners.name: Packing Hermod
runners.spotlight: Won four times (6f-7f) last season and has made the frame in Group handicaps on both starts this term (7f/6f), more recently when third behind Tomodachi Kokoroe in October; better off at the weights with that rival today; might be the answer.

runners.comment: Held in 1m Group 2 last time but was very progressive in 7f handicaps beforehand
runners.name: Light Years Charm
runners.spotlight: Found level-weights 1m Group 2 too hot in November but was very progressive in 7f handicaps beforehand, winning four of his previous five races; may still have more improvement to come; shortlisted.

runners.comment: 1m Group 1 winner in his prime but very much on the downgrade now
runners.name: Beauty Eternal

quotes.race: FWD Champions Mile (Group 1) (3yo+) (Course A) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It was the only hope we had to go forward from Beauty Eternal's draw as there was no speed in the race. They gave us the opportunity to lead and he got into a lovely rhythm and controlled the race. I thought this was the only way we could beat Golden Sixty. I've always felt there was a bit more there, and we saw his full potential - Zac Purton, jockey.

runners.spotlight: 1m Group 1 winner in his prime but very much on the downgrade now and finished last in Class 2 handicap over C&D 18 days ago.

runners.comment: Placed in last season's Classic Cup but very little has gone to plan this term
runners.name: Johannes Brahms
runners.spotlight: Placed in last season's Classic Cup (1m1f) before creditable sixth in Hong Kong Derby (1m2f) but very little has gone to plan this term and he needs to get his career back on track.

stable_tour.quote: He's in good shape and had a couple of nice runs last season and likes a nice bit of ground. We'll start him off in a Guineas trial and go from there. He could stretch out to a mile at most. We view him as a miler at the moment but he could be a sprinter. 03-04-24

runners.comment: In good form for new stable this season, including narrow C&D win last month
runners.name: Aeris Nova

prev_owners.owner: C Bennett, Flying Start Fine Scent Et Al

runners.spotlight: In good form for new stable this season, most notably when driven out to score by a neck over C&D last month; up in grade and 6lb higher today but ought to run his race again.

runners.comment: Won on turf in 2023 but is best known as a dirt specialist; can be opposed over this C&D
runners.name: Capital Delight
runners.spotlight: Won on turf in 2023 but is best known as a dirt specialist and can be opposed over this C&D.

runners.comment: Holds no secrets from the handicapper but this consistent 7yo probably won't be far away
runners.name: Dancing Code

prev_owners.owner: L A Miller, Mrs M L Morrison Et Al

runners.spotlight: Consistent 7yo who was beaten under 1l when fifth in C&D handicap won by Aeris Nova last month; holds no secrets from the handicapper but probably won't be far away.

runners.comment: Career-best form when winning over 6f 12 days ago; 8lb higher mark leaves him vulnerable
runners.name: Sky Trust
runners.owner: Bryan Kwan Hon Ming, Jessica Kwan Mun Hang Et Al
runners.spotlight: Career-best form when winning readily over 6f here 12 days ago; also suited by 7f and evidently in very good nick, but effectively 8lb higher from just out of the weights today and might be vulnerable in this company.

runners.comment: Held on well for 6f win in November but up against it from 4lb out of weights today
runners.name: Storm Rider
runners.spotlight: Looked as good as ever when clinging on by a neck here (6f) in November; also suited by 7f but was safely held off new mark a fortnight later and is effectively another 4lb higher from out of the weights today.

runners.comment: Ran well over C&D last month but 8lb wrong today and not the most obvious answer
runners.name: Gustosisimo
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when seventh in recent C&D race won by Aeris Nova, but effectively 5lb higher from further out of the weights today and not the most obvious answer.

08:40.race_name: Cha Kwo Ling Handicap (Div I) (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course B+2) (Turf)

runners.comment: Well drawn today but has been badly out of form this season and needs to turn a corner
runners.name: Call Me Glorious
runners.spotlight: Well drawn today but has been badly out of form this season and needs to turn a corner.

runners.comment: Triple C&D winner in early 2025; absent since May, though, and drawn wide today
runners.name: Crossborderpegasus
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who won three times over C&D in early part of last year, despite not always looking straightforward; absent since 7f fourth here in May, though, and has wide draw to contend with.

runners.comment: In-form front-runner who is 2-3 over C&D this season; wide draw a big negative today
runners.name: Matters Most

quotes.race: Byerley Stud British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We hadn't got Matters Most on the grass before his first run and he was green and got squeezed, but today he was very professional. He wants a sixth furlong and I don't know where we'll go, but there might be a race at Pontefract coming up, which could suit him. He's very straightforward and we like him. He's out of a Pastoral Pursuits mare so he's bred to handle this ground, but he moves like he'd handle quicker ground and I've have no qualms about trying him on a faster surface - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

runners.spotlight: In-form front-runner who is 2-3 over C&D this season; combination of wide draw and of latest 6lb rise asks a lot of him today, though.

runners.comment: Unlucky not to finish closer than sixth over C&D last month and Zac Purton rides today
runners.name: Savvy Brilliant
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on seasonal debut in October but was unlucky not to finish closer than sixth over C&D last month (denied clear run) and the booking of Zac Purton catches the eye today; hood removed after one use.

runners.comment: 3-4 in South Africa in 2024; makes Hong Kong debut after long absence
runners.name: Aerodynamics
runners.owner: Daniel Yeung Ngai & Gwenny Wu Pui Kwan
runners.spotlight: 3-4 in South Africa in 2024, the latest win gained in a 7.3f handicap; makes Hong Kong debut after long absence and probably best watched.

runners.comment: 2-11 in Australia; absent since down-the-field run in July (7.5f); Hong Kong debut today
runners.name: Happy Index
runners.spotlight: Won just twice from 11 starts in Australia; absent since down-the-field finish in 7.5f handicap last July and makes only limited appeal on Hong Kong debut.

runners.comment: Made pleasing Hong Kong debut over C&D last month, keeping on for fourth
runners.name: A Time For Us
runners.spotlight: Won 6f maiden on debut in Australia just under a year ago and made pleasing start to Hong Kong career over C&D last month, keeping on for fourth; one to consider.

runners.comment: 2-8 in New Zealand; drops back from 7f and sports new headgear on Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Lucky Candy
runners.owner: Yeung Wai Kwong & Lee Sheung Ping
runners.spotlight: Signed off in New Zealand with 7f handicap win last April and with strike-rate standing at 2-8; drops back in trip and sports new hood/tongue-tie on Hong Kong debut.

runners.comment: Second Hong Kong run was better than the debut and this move back up from 5f should suit
runners.name: Pegas
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 4yo; well down the field on Hong Kong debut in November but last month's 5f sixth was much more encouraging and this move back up in trip ought to suit.

runners.comment: Well down the field over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Lets Have Fun
runners.spotlight: Twice a runner-up when trained in Australia but finished well down the field over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut and needs to take a big step forward.

runners.comment: Did well to finish third from stall 11 at Happy Valley last month; drawn wide again here
runners.name: Mighty Commander

prev_owners.owner: A Boyd, P M Gangemi & Talinga Girls

runners.spotlight: Holding his own in this higher grade since Class 4 win on seasonal debut at Happy Valley in September, and did very well to take third from stall 11 there three weeks ago; not drawn well here either, though.

runners.comment: Went close on seasonal debut but not quite in same form since; headgear switched
runners.name: Never Too Soon
runners.spotlight: Lost out only by a short head on seasonal debut at Happy Valley in October but wasn't quite in same form on next two outings and needs a boost from the new blinkers today (usually wears cheekpieces).

runners.comment: Won over 6f in Australia but was soundly beaten over C&D on his first two Hong Kong starts
runners.name: Eternal Richness
runners.owner: Ng Ying Kit & Kenny Ng Chun Pang
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f in Australia but was soundly beaten over C&D on his first two Hong Kong starts.

runners.comment: Yet to progress from winning debut on dirt and has bad draw for turf debut
runners.name: Rising Force
runners.owner: Tai Woon Shing & Chan Koon Man
runners.spotlight: Won readily on debut here (6f, dirt) last March but found one too good when hot favourite to follow up in May and managed only seventh on latest outing in June; may still have potential but makes turf debut after 201-day absence and has a bad draw.

runners.comment: Placed from just out of the weights over 5f recently and this return to 6f will suit
runners.name: Lucky Eight
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when placed from just out of the weights here (5f) last month and will be suited by this return to 6f; will need to be taken very seriously if he gets a run today.

runners.comment: Made very solid start to career over 7f last season; has fitness to prove today
runners.name: Super Express
runners.spotlight: Scored over 7f here on debut last March and was very close second over that trip on next three outings; can progress this season but has fitness to prove after six-month break, and the drop to 6f is not sure to suit; also a reserve in 9.50 race.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D last June but absent since lesser effort over 1m1f the following month
runners.name: Beauty Alliance
runners.spotlight: Finished well to take third over C&D in June but ought to have been suited by the return to 1m1f when only eighth the following month and has a wide draw for this reappearance run.

runners.comment: 2-8 in Australia; makes Hong Kong debut after a layoff and has wide draw
runners.name: Natural Numbers

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, R & C Legh Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.spotlight: 2-8 in Australia, the latter win gained in 7f handicap last May; drawn wide and has fitness to prove on Hong Kong debut; usual blinkers discarded.

runners.comment: Denied clear run when fourth over C&D last month and has better draw today; shortlisted
runners.name: Six Pack
runners.spotlight: Smart when based in Australia and has consistent record in Hong Kong this season (6f-1m); denied clear run before staying on for fourth over C&D last month and has a better draw today; shortlisted.

runners.breeder: Gn & Cm Bloodstock Ltd & Te Akau Opulent Syndicate
runners.comment: Signed off in New Zealand with small-field 7f win last March; Hong Kong debut today
runners.name: Class
runners.owner: Jessica Man Yi Lee & Gregory Chi Ho Ho
runners.spotlight: 2-8 in New Zealand, signing off with small-field 7f win last March; not drawn well for Hong Kong debut and entitled to benefit from this outing.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on seasonal debut and recent defeat from stall 13 not viewed too harshly
runners.name: Ka Ying Attack
runners.spotlight: Won three times last season (twice over C&D) and made pleasing reappearance when staying-on third over C&D in October; didn't get home when ridden positively from stall 13 here last month but has a better draw today and enters calculations.

runners.comment: Well beaten on last month's seasonal/stable debut; others have much less to prove
runners.name: Charming Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with some disappointing efforts for Danny Shum and was soundly beaten over C&D on last month's stable debut; may yet come good for Caspar Fownes but others in this line-up have much less to prove.

runners.comment: Gained both Hong Kong wins over 6f on dirt in 2023 and is yet to strike form this season
runners.name: Gummy Gummy
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.spotlight: Gained both Hong Kong wins over 6f on dirt in 2023 and is yet to strike form after four starts for new stable this season; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Placed over 1m in October but not quite in same form on either start since
runners.name: Keen Molly
runners.spotlight: Placed over 1m at Happy Valley in October, his third Hong Kong start, but was not quite in same form there on either appearance in November and Zac Purton evidently prefers With A Smile today.

runners.comment: Won a shade cosily over C&D last month and is now 2-7; up in grade today; respected
runners.name: With A Smile
runners.spotlight: Won a shade cosily over C&D last month and now has 2-7 strike-rate; upped in grade today but has good draw and Zac Purton keeps the ride; probably still has more to offer.

runners.comment: Made promising Hong Kong debut over 6f and could have untapped potential over 7f
runners.name: Armor Golden Eagle
runners.spotlight: Won in New Zealand last March (5.7f) and made promising Hong Kong debut over 6f in November, staying on for sixth; could have untapped potential over 7f and can be dangerous if that recent run brought him on.

runners.comment: 0-8 in Hong Kong but last month's C&D fourth was a step in the right direction
runners.name: Ghorgan
runners.spotlight: Smart when trained in Germany; yet to be placed after eight Hong Kong starts but took good step in right direction when fourth over C&D last month and now has something to build on.

runners.breeder: Ccharalambous, Dj & Ma Frew, Thatzopoulos & Partners
runners.comment: Finished last over C&D when a big-priced outsider for last month's Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Lucky Together

prev_owners.owner: T A Scanlon, T G Scanlon Et Al

runners.spotlight: Won 7.5f maiden in Australia last May but finished last over C&D when a big-priced outsider for last month's Hong Kong debut.

runners.comment: Shade disappointing last time but was placed over C&D on seasonal/stable debut
runners.name: Eighty Light Years
runners.spotlight: Slightly disappointing when midfield here last month but was placed over C&D on seasonal/stable debut in November and remains well handicapped on older form.

runners.comment: Not seen since disappointing seasonal debut in October; drawn wide for first 7f attempt
runners.name: Very Grateful
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who launched Hong Kong career with three good efforts over 6f last May-July; not seen since disappointing reappearance run in October, though, and has outside draw for first 7f attempt.

runners.comment: Narrow C&D winner in November and ran just as well when fourth over 1m last month
runners.name: Thriving Brothers
runners.owner: Yeung Chun Wang, Yeung Ho Wang & Yeung Chung Wang
runners.spotlight: Doubled Hong Kong tally with narrow C&D win in November and probably ran just as well when fourth at Happy Valley (1m) last month; considered each-way.

runners.comment: Showed first significant promise in Hong Kong two starts ago; well beaten since
runners.name: Nova Knight
runners.spotlight: Showed first significant promise in Hong Kong when keeping-on sixth at Happy Valley (1m) in November, his third local start, but was well beaten over that C&D last month.

09:50.race_name: Cha Kwo Ling Handicap (Div II) (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course B+2) (Turf)

runners.comment: Ex-Irish 4yo who made an excellent start to his HK career towards end of 2025; big player
runners.name: Circuit Grand Slam

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals Irish EBF Race
quotes.quote: We were delighted with Tunbridge Wells today, Ryan (Moore) said he is still babyish. Obviously the race today would set him up for Ascot (Coventry Stakes) if he was forward enough so we'll see how much that race brings him on, if not we could come back here for the Railway Stakes - Aidan O'Brien, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 4yo who won over C&D from awkward draw on Hong Kong debut in November and was very close third here last month; could still have a bigger run in him and commands respect.

stable_tour.quote: He took a nice step forward from his first start at Navan to win at the Curragh and could run in the Coventry. We'll do another piece of work with him during the week and see how he gets on in that.  11-06-24

runners.comment: Placed on four of his six Hong Kong starts and has much better draw than last time
runners.name: Infinite Resolve

prev_owners.owner: P C Orton, Vinery Stud Et Al

runners.spotlight: Placed over C&D on four of his six Hong Kong starts, most recently when third behind Circuit Grand Slam from stall 12 in November; better drawn today and ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: Ready 5f winner at Happy Valley last month; needs to prove he can handle a 7lb rise
runners.name: Candlelight Dinner
runners.spotlight: Seemed to take form to whole new level at Happy Valley (5f) last month, winning readily; will be fine back over 6f but needs to prove he can cope with a 7lb rise.

runners.comment: Stayed on for fifth over C&D in Hong Kong debut but has awkward draw today
runners.name: Heaving
runners.owner: Cindi Hui Ming Ming, Dr David Choy Tak Wai & Ricky C W Kay

prev_owners.owner: Rtd Racing, Pin Cushion Racing Et Al

runners.spotlight: 3-5 when based in Australia (all wins over 6f); made quite promising Hong Kong debut when staying-on fifth over C&D in November but wide draw reduces his appeal today.

runners.comment: Placed in 6f Group 3 on final start in Australia and well drawn for Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Mighty Masts
runners.owner: 24/25 Chris So Wai Yin Trainer Syndicate
runners.spotlight: 3-8 in Australia; absent since finishing second in 6f Group 3 in May but has favourable draw for this Hong Kong debut; interesting to see how he fares.

runners.breeder: Hall Of Fame Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Ended last season in good form at Happy Valley but others here look better handicapped
runners.name: Romantic Son
runners.spotlight: Exploited plum inside draw when winning readily at Happy Valley in November and last month's fifth there was perfectly respectable, but others here look better handicapped.

runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: Close second here last month but back on career-high mark and drawn much wider today
runners.name: Young Arrow
runners.spotlight: Seemingly back in prime form when close second over C&D last month, but recent 2lb nudge puts him back on his career-high mark and he's drawn much wider today.

runners.comment: Won 6.7f maiden handicap in Australia in June, his second start; Hong Kong debut today
runners.name: M M Concord
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when winning 6.7f maiden handicap in Australia in June but makes Hong Kong debut after six-month absence and has double-digit draw; swaps blinkers for cheekpieces.

runners.comment: 7f maiden winner in Australia just under a year ago; drawn wide on Hong Kong debut
runners.name: Pi Legend
runners.spotlight: 1-7 in Australia, the win gained in 7f maiden just under a year ago; drawn wide for Hong Kong debut and not sure to be ideally suited by the drop back in trip; probably best watched.

runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Placed over 5f on Hong Kong debut and may not have handled dirt last time
runners.name: Quartz Legend
runners.spotlight: 2-3 over 5f when based in Australia and belied 41-1 odds when placed over that trip on Hong Kong debut at Happy Valley in November; well beaten when upped to 6f for dirt debut later that month but might be happier now back on turf.

runners.comment: Has found things tough since upped to this grade and has the outside draw today
runners.name: Flash Current
runners.spotlight: Dual Class 4 winner here last season (6f/7f) but has found things tough in this higher grade since (four runs) and has the outside draw.

runners.comment: Came good at Happy Valley in November and well close in this higher grade last month
runners.name: Tourbillon Golfer
runners.owner: Shum Mak Ling, Justin Liu Sai Wai & Wilson Liu Chung Kin
runners.spotlight: Came good with front-running win at Happy Valley in November, his fifth start, and was close second there when upped to this higher grade last month; respected in current mood.

runners.comment: Won four times over 1m on dirt last season but has been out of form this term
runners.name: Never Peter Out
runners.spotlight: Won four times over 1m on dirt last season but has been out of form this term and can be overlooked over this C&D.

runners.comment: Ran okay in first-time blinkers two starts ago but safely held since; needs drop in grade
runners.name: Wolf Coming

quotes.race: William Hill / British EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands A, B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's never easy carrying a penalty, so that was a really pleasing effort from Qetaifan. I'll have to discuss with the owner what the next steps are but he has shown he can cope with that ground, so we might look at the Horris Hill for him. He's also in the sales - Andrew Balding, trainer.

runners.spotlight: Seemingly aided by first-time blinkers when staying on into midfield over C&D  in November, his third Hong Kong start, but safely held over 7f since; probably needs a drop in grade.

runners.comment: Made very solid start to career over 7f last season; has fitness to prove today
runners.name: Super Express
runners.spotlight: Scored over 7f here on debut last March and was very close second over that trip on next three outings; can progress this season but has fitness to prove after six-month break, while the drop to 6f is not sure to suit; also a reserve in 8.40 race.

runners.breeder: A M Aldridge, Mrs F V & G F Moughan
runners.comment: Ended last year in good form over 1m; up in grade today; drop to 6f not an obvious move
runners.name: Fortunate Son

prev_owners.owner: M C Sharkie, P Vawdrey & D Painter

runners.spotlight: Emerged from spell in the doldrums with clearcut 1m win at Happy Valley in November and was placed off today's mark over that C&D last month, but moves up in grade today and the drop to 6f is not an obvious move.
